story:
The NOVEL idea 


 It began as a compendium of semi-autobiographical short stories I wrote starting the summer I graduated high school in 2006 and finished the following summer. It was merely the first draft of a novella  in 2007 and  was buried only momentarily in the proverbial the sands of time. 

     Only recently has the novella been exhumed and, through rewrites from last April through June, has transformed into a 157 page novella . The money raised will be used to jumpstart my career as a published author. The funds will cover the initial expenses of launching my novella.  The novella has been published through Lulu (with its own ISBN and all) with help from a small Wisconsin based arts company T- ECmedia (The Eidolon Collective)

     The story itself is told in 5 parts called Threads, which are broken up into chapters. The first 2 threads are very introspective as the main character, Ryan Mathers, reflects on various parts of his life with insights and observations that build up toward a more plot driven latter half.


The test print, as shown above, is now a souvenir for one of the editors. Minor modifications have been made, particularly to the title.

            The COST


  •  $250 to print an initial 60 copies I can sell by myself, approximate cost of Lulu's rates for a 6X9 paperback.  The format is essential for E-Book, which the novella will also be available as.
  •  $400 is to pay the 4 editors I worked with each a flat fee of $100 for graciously offering me their proofreading skills, advice, and time.
  • $1000 is for marketing, promotion, and perks. This includes at least $5 a day to promote Fabricated's Facebook page for a month. A mass press release will cost $300 alone.
  • $1000 as a fee for me, the author, for all the hard work I put into the novella. That's a conservative $10/hr for a very conservative 100 hours estimated time I worked on it. This isn't even including the time I spent on the cover design, the cost of ink and paper for the first few drafts, or any other promotional footwork. It, too, will likely go into marketing the book anyway.  (If I don't reach my goal, this would be the last paid out) if this seems steep, here's what your investing in:


                            The CREDENTIALS

I am...

 - A college graduate who's earned a Bachelors Degree of the Arts Degree in Film Studies from the University of  Milwaukee Wisconsin.

-  A Librarian's Assistant at The Brown Deer Public Library.

I have...

- invested hundreds hours into the skill of writing, my body of work includes:

      - 8 screenplays:

             - 3 which have been submitted to screenwriting contests, 1 in 2013 entitled Flux for The Hollywood Screenwriting Contest and 2 for the Page International Screenwriting Awards in 2014 and 2015, 1 entitled Script 6 and the other entitled Auteur).

The image above is one of the drafts of a script entitled Script 6 (It is metafiction :D)

              - 1 , entitled Doll, which I recently wrote, that has a director who's                                  submitted a  film accepted into Sundance attached to direct.

              - 1 entitled Beneath the Horizon which was filmed and produced by several students at of The Chicago Art Institute.

 CLICK TRAILER HERE 

      - 2 other yet to be published novellas, each currently 20,000+ words in their second drafts, entitled Our Life and Infatuation and Illusion, both which I hope to publish someday if this campaign works out.  

      - Countless short stories and poems.

      - A 20 page thesis for my Film Studies capstone class arguing that technology is portrayed as a double-edge sword in the Scream franchise (kind of random, I know ).

.....I intend on posting samples of my work as the campaign progresses.


I will publish my book regardless of this campaign's success

story:
Short Summary

We are a husband and wife responding to God’s call to use our talents and gifts to build up the Kingdom of God. Our partnership combines 20 years of  retail sales and project management experience and more than 10 years of ministry experience and theological education.

We are establishing a publishing program – The House of Aaron Publishing (www.thehouseofaaronpublishing.com) – to support aspiring anointed authors. We are providing the full services needed to deliver professionally produced books that are theologically sound and easy to read.

We want to spread the message of God’s love and hope to a hurting and weary world through works that inspire, challenge and speak to people of all ages and all walks of life. We are excited to support anointed authors who write inspirational and encouraging works that challenge the reader to grow closer in relationship to God.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $20,690 for the cost of printing, website hosting, editing and graphic design services, publishing software, and subscription fees to produce first run editions of 5 anointed first time authors. We will publish an initial printing of a limited edition compilation Narratives book series written by Veronica Patterson, our premiere anointed author, as well as our next 4 anointed authors. If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we receive will still be invested in publishing our premiere author. 


We've got some great perks for your tax-deductible donation ranging from a pre-ordered limited edition of the Narratives book to a 1/4 page personal recognition in the book dependent on the level of donation. We have the perfect perk for you, regardless of the size of your contribution. 

The Impact

Your contribution will help provide a platform for unpublished authors who may not have the opportunity to be published by traditional publishers. Your support will help expand the Kingdom at a time when people need to know about the love of God for themselves.  

Risks & Challenges

We may face challenges with traditional distribution channels with our books. However, we believe our advantage is in the use of electronic media and on-demand printing to reach our customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you just can't contribute. We understand. But you still can help in the following ways:

  • Pray that our campaign is successfully funded.
  • Pray for our premiere anointed author and subsequent anointed authors.
  • Get the word out! Share our campaign with your network.

story:
Anthony Gore was a preacher’s son, his childhood spent immersed in the delusions, half-truths, and falsehoods of the Christian Identity Movement. Homeschooled and quickly becoming the black sheep of the family, Gore spent the next thirteen years of his life building upon the theory that if it felt good and you didn’t get caught, you should do it. By the age of twenty-seven, Gore had five children and six pending felonies.

He would spend the next eight years in several prisons, his whole world crammed into a tiny room. Over those eight years, he retrained his mind for success. By the time he was released, Gore had put himself through college, Bible college, substance abuse education, and finally rehab. He reconnected with his children and became a role model for many. His goal these days is to use his experience and acquired wisdom to educate others before they end up lost in the prison system--so they can fulfill the destiny set before them and enrich the lives of everyone they meet.

All contributors donating to Changing Lives Book - A Book Publishing Fund will receive a free electronic publication of the book when it is released.  We hope to send it to print and also create an audiobook.

Any funding received will go to the publication and marketing of the novel.

Our goal is to reach every person from every walk of life. Whether you are an inmate, criminal, addict, or just someone who is trying to get by in life, this story will inspire you to be so much more.

Can't contribute? There are ways you can help - share and help us spread the word!

story:
What This Book Is About

“The Seekers: The Secret of the Turtles”  is a mystical tale of a Caribbean princess who sets off on a journey with her best friend and a prince of Barbados to save the sea turtles and calm an active underwater volcano. Along the way, she learns she has an extraordinary future unlike any she ever imagined for herself. The picture only book , titled "The Seekers" is the first chapter of "The Seekers: the Secret of the Turtles", which captures the beginning of the journey for the young cast.

With a diverse cast of characters, many of whom have mixed heritages, and set in a fantastical setting, young readers will find an array of characters to relate to as the group travels on their mystical adventure.

About the Author

Cece Younger is a mother, artist and academic. This book is a result of a conversation she had with her 3 year old daughter while putting up the Disney princesses wall decals.  Her daughter asked "why do all the princesses look like you? Why don’t they look like me?’” Author Cece Younger says. “It broke my heart and from that point I wanted to create kid’s products that reflect diversity of people.”

This project is the second in her plan to write 2 additional books to continue the series and have picture books for each.

About the Illustrator

Arthur Ella is a cartoon artist who lives in Yaounde, Cameroon. He is a passionate and professional illustrator who holds a national diploma in computer graphics, and many years of experience. He started drawing since his childhood. When he discovered his passion and his talent for drawing, he spent more time doing what he loves.

 

WHAT DOES THE BOOK EDITING AND DESIGN PROCESS ENTAIL?

The following are some of the larger components included:

Layout Design - A custom interior design of a book includes fonts, formatting, and styles used throughout a book. Coming up with a consistent template for each chapter maintains consistency and readability throughout the book. (approx. $2500)

Proofread - A proofreader goes through an edited, formatted book to look for any mistakes in the text, as well as any undesirable design elements. (approx. $500)

Cover Design - Many people judge a book by its cover, so a quality design is important to the quality of the overall book. Cover and back cover design includes marketing copy to tell the book’s story and details such as generating the barcode for selling purposes. (approx. $1000)

Formatting + Publication Costs - Once the manuscript is print-ready, it will be available on Amazon and other book-selling platforms. Each has different requirements and fees associated. Also, the book will need an ISBN and other official components. (approx. $1500)

Printing - Even authors have to pay for their books! Printing costs will cover books ordered through the campaign, as well as an initial run of books to share in marketing and publicity efforts. (approx. $2,500)

story:
For the past 5 years, my team and I have traveled the United States, Canada and Mexico photographing and interviewing teenagers and young adults currently going through cancer treatment, in remission, or who have survived this illness.

Though teens are the most interesting and dynamic of cancer patients, they often fall through the cracks in the cancer world.  Most cancer research funds and other resources are directed towards adults, and next to young children. 

The goal of High School Year Book is to create a community in which teens and young adults with cancer can connect and support each other. We are creating a book – being published by Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles - filled with shared stories and the photos of teens going thru cancer.  This book will be given to young people just getting their diagnoses so they can see the stories of other teens who have gone through similar experiences. We are also compiling these stories in a documentary film so that the general public can see how extraordinary these kids become in the face of cancer. 

Your contributions will allow us to finish the book and distribute it to those who need it now.  Your donations will also go toward the production of the documentary film.  Both tools will serve as a part of an emotional support system for teenagers and families battling cancer, as well as an educational resource for the broader community.

Visit our website at www.hsyearbook.org and follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  Please join these kids and share our pages to help spread our message.

Thank you all!

Brian Braff

story:
To mark our decade anniversary (April 19th), we are putting together the ultimate collectors item.  A massive collection of posters, photos, sketches, set lists, & other odds and ends from Prof Pinkerton's personal vault.

The book will be almost exclusively pre-sale. We need a min of 100 people to sign up to make the cost per unit reasonable. We are offering a sliding scale rate as an incentive for folks who contribute early. The more folks who sign up better for everyone. Since the overhead is less the more units we print we will be able to include more content as numbers grow. Our overall goal is to print somewhere between 100-500 copies.

We are still researching the best printing option however our ideal end product will be a will be a full color hardcover volume with 200+ pages of content. Updates regarding content will come as specifics are worked out. We are earlier enough in the planning that requests may still be considered.

If enough folks pre-order I would like to include a passcode of digital extras such as 

  • Casey Malones short doc about the show
  • Josh Bryan's short film "The Balloonatic"
  • A photos archive
  • The out of print first album by our house band "The Magnificents"
  • Unreleased live footage including the legendary Jesus vs. Santa wrestling death match  

We are also selling other items to underwrite the project such as discounted tickets packages, buttons, stickers, T-shirts, and our longtime favorite "Mystery boxes!". This funds will also allow us to print a small run of additional copies for the merch table for future fans.

story:
Hi Indiegogo community!

At Sports History Magazine our mission is two fold: a) engage readers with insightful articles and rich photos related to sports history and b) provide a medium for professional writers to promote their written works. 

I launched www.SportsHistoryWeekly.com two years ago and to date, we have compiled hundreds of timeless articles, puzzles and photos that are archived in our website.

It is now time to take the digital platform to a paper magazine that will be delivered to thousands of households, libraries and universities for an annual subscription. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $25,000 so we can print and distribute 5,000 copies of our first paper issue magazine.  They will be distributed as marketing samples to solicit subscriptions from households, libraries and universities. 

As a valuable donor, you will receive the inaugural issue for free + the next 5 issues if we build the critical subscription base.  Most importantly, your contribution will help us launch an enterprise that will support writers, authors and professors who contribute their wonderful stories to our publication.

In addition, you will provide an enriching reading experience for those who still enjoy well written traditional content.  Think of your parents or grandparents who would love to read Sports History Magazine that rings with memories and nostalgia from the old days!  

Mockup/example of a sample issue of Sports History Magazine 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk is that not enough subscribers will join to make Sports History Magazine a sustainable business beyond the first issues.

We intend to confront that challenge by marketing the magazine through all our social media channels, leveraging on our extensive network of writers, readers, universities, and corporations.

Mockup/example of a sample issue of Sports History Magazine 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, it doesn't mean you can't get the word out.  Become a subscriber later on, or buy a subscription for someone you know who will enjoy our unique magazine.

Mockup/example of a sample issue of Sports History Magazine

story:
Early-Bird Deluxe Version

Technical Specs for the Early-Bird Deluxe Version:

- Hardcover book (signed by the author)

- CD

- Pdf / ePub 

- Soundtrack Mp3

- Poster (signed by the illustrator) 

 

Let this adventure take your breath away!

Listen soundtrack while you read this book!

Ivar is a child full of fears and insecurities. He is faced with the small everyday trauma of his age: to move to a new city; to be mocked by a group of bullies; to discover himself as tiny and defenceless; to fall in love; to feel lonely…Through this path full of obstacles, he will meet a true friend, Van, who will help him grow and become more confident.
Mostly important, thanks to Van, Ivar will learn to discover the power and beauty of the nature, which surrounds and transforms everything, until it blends with our own breath, replaces it and fills our lungs.

Let yourself be carried away by Van and Ivar across a path of new discoveries and awareness, to find the child hidden inside each of us, and help him grow up again.

 

Read, watch and listen from any device

Goodnight Little Princess is a story to be read, watched and listened to on any device.

 

Goodnight Little Princess will be available both in English and Italian version, in a paperback book edition, or in the deluxe edition, consisting of hardcover book and CD. 

Both the standard and the deluxe version give you the possibility to sign in on the free site https://www.goodnightlittleprincess.com and download epub and mp3 files of the novel.  

 

 

Why this book

Hi, I'm Valerio. I started writing Goodnight Little Princess in 2016. 
I thought illustrating and composing a soundtrack would be the best way to convey this opera in all its entirety, to create a full immersion for the reader. Goodnight Little Princess is a tale of a journey that will bring the main character to be aware of himself and the world around him.
There’s a part of us that won’t ever age, constantly in seek of freedom and adventure, this book is a call to nature, a ode to life. 

 

The aim was to be completely drown in another dimension: my grandmother used to read me stories which brought my soul in fields of bravery and marvel and surprise. The best chance to wander with fantasy. 

As I grew up, I discovered that charming spell already surrounding me. All those stories seemed actually real, maybe because there’s no such difference between dreaming and living. 

 

Try Now!

https://www.goodnightlittleprincess.com/#trynow

Digital Version

- Pdf / ePub 
- Soundtrack Mp3
- Poster (signed by the illustrator) 
 
Let this adventure take your breath away!
Listen soundtrack while you read this book!
Ivar is a child full of fears and insecurities. He is faced with the small everyday trauma of his age: to move to a new city; to be mocked by a group of bullies; to discover himself as tiny and defenceless; to fall in love; to feel lonely…Through this path full of obstacles, he will meet a true friend, Van, who will help him grow and become more confident.Mostly important, thanks to Van, Ivar will learn to discover the power and beauty of the nature, which surrounds and transforms everything, until it blends with our own breath, replaces it and fills our lungs.Let yourself be carried away by Van and Ivar across a path of new discoveries and awareness, to find the child hidden inside each of us, and help him grow up again.
 
Read, watch and listen from any device
Goodnight Little Princess is a story to be read, watched and listened to on any device.


 
Goodnight Little Princess will be available both in English and Italian version, in a paperback book edition, or in the deluxe edition, consisting of hardcover book and CD. 
Both the standard and the deluxe version give you the possibility to sign in on the free site https://www.goodnightlittleprincess.com and download epub and mp3 files of the novel.  
 

 
Why this book
Hi, I'm Valerio. I started writing Goodnight Little Princess in 2016. I thought illustrating and composing a soundtrack would be the best way to convey this opera in all its entirety, to create a full immersion for the reader. Goodnight Little Princess is a tale of a journey that will bring the main character to be aware of himself and the world around him.There’s a part of us that won’t ever age, constantly in seek of freedom and adventure, this book is a call to nature, a ode to life. 
 


The aim was to be completely drown in another dimension: my grandmother used to read me stories which brought my soul in fields of bravery and marvel and surprise. The best chance to wander with fantasy. 
As I grew up, I discovered that charming spell already surrounding me. All those stories seemed actually real, maybe because there’s no such difference between dreaming and living.

story:
Our Story at October Hill

October Hill Magazine is a two-year-old quarterly nonprofit magazine, created for the purpose of providing a platform for new and unpublished authors of short stories and poetry and visual artists. We are keenly aware of how difficult it is today to become published as a first-time author. Therefore, we are passionate in our belief that all new writers deserve an opportunity to have their work considered for publication. We dared to be different. That is why we created the very first literary platform for publication of the works of new and unpublished authors.  

We have been extremely well-received in the literary community. In fact, our readership is growing by leaps and bounds. But with growth comes more costs. We firmly believe that it is time to take our publication to the next level.

Our Plans for Growth

  • We want to begin paying our all-volunteer staff – most of whom are college students - who have supported our work and made our publication possible for the first two years. They are part and parcel of our success. Furthermore, we consider them to be the next generation of literary editors in training. They deserve to be rewarded.
  • We plan to launch a print companion to our digital publication. We want to reach a wider readership. Many of our readers have asked for a print magazine. We believe it is time to give them a print publication to hold in their hands and to read at their own leisure, whether on a flight cross country, a subway ride, or an afternoon on the living room couch. This is not inexpensive.
  • We are already planning our Second Annual Literary Contest for authors of short stories and poetry, even as our first contest draws to a close. Our contests are independently judged and are designed to recognize and reward the very best work of new authors. We are personally putting up $3,500 in prize money.
  • We ask our writers for revisions! If their work shows promise, we ask the writer to work with us to make the necessary revisions for publication. We give writers the opportunity to be published in a very tough industry, in which most publication offer only a pass or fail option. And our writers are never charged a fee for submitting their work and having it read, or for working with our editors.
  • We are also planning for the launch of a newsletter for our followers, who wish to remain up-to-date on our quarterly themes, upcoming issues and special projects.
  • October Hill Magazine is incorporated as a non-profit in the state of New York and is in the process of applying for 501(c) (3) status from the Internal Revenue Service. This will cost nearly $1,000.

Why Your Help Matters

All of our goals will take money. Publishing is not cheap. But we believe firmly in supporting our writers and, in so doing, making sure that the candle light of literature, fiction and poetry continues to burn brightly in the darkness all around us. We believe that publishing new literature and poetry honors the authors who create it and nurtures us all culturally and emotionally.

Who are the writers and artists your contributions will be supporting? They are a global community of aspiring writers who write by day and wait restaurant tables at night; mothers who wearily put their children to sleep and then try to carve out time at night for their writing passion; poets who may teach a class or two and scrape together enough money to attend a writer’s conference in the woods of Vermont. This is how they pursue their craft in the modern economy.

Our publication was founded by Richard Merli, an investigative journalist and editor, who always had a passion for the written word and always harbored a dream of creating a literary magazine. He was joined in his mission by Samantha Morley, a talented young editor who brought ideas, enthusiasm and determination to the mission. For us, it has been a labor of love.

Won’t you join us in making our first ever IndieGoGo campaign a success? Without the support of generous donors, such as you, October Hill Magazine cannot accomplish all of its goals. We will be forever grateful to you for making a contribution to our cause.

Spreading the Word

And if you can’t send any money our way, you can help by spreading the word, asking those who can, to consider making our campaign a success. Please spread the word about this campaign. Share it here online, talk about it on social networking sites, or simply tell your friends, neighbors, and family members. Also, visit our official website at https://www.octoberhillmagazine.com/

As always, we wish to thank you for your generous support of October Hill Magazine. And we hope you enjoy reading our upcoming Winter issue, marking the close of our second year!

На что пойдут собранные средства

  • Вёрстка двух книг "Король Лир" и "Ромео и Джульетта" на английском и русском языках
  • Печать тиража в соотвествии с количеством людей, поддержавших кампанию


Художник-иллюстратор Владимир Николаевич Ненов
 

Родился в Новокуйбышевске, там же закончил художественную школу, затем живописно-педагогическое отделение Куйбышевского художественного училища.
После окончания учебы работал в портретной мастерской Куйбышевского филиала Союза художников художником-оформителем в цехе наглядной агитации. После армии закончил ЛВХПУ имени Мухина, во время обучения увлекся книжной графикой.
В 1993 году Владимир начал сотрудничество с американским издательством Tor-book, создав для него около 30-ти книжных обложек. Позже начал работать и с ведущими отечественными издательствами — «Азбука», «Нева», «АСТ», «Эксмо» и другими.

story:
THE STORIES WE HIDE: ENIGMA FRONT 5

Our lives are made up of stories, but not all stories are ones we want to have told. For whatever reason, in whatever way, for ill or for good, some stories are buried. Truths are hidden, things go unsaid, and secrets are kept... or not, as the case may be!

How does a story become a secret? To what lengths will someone go to keep their secret? What happens when those secrets are uncovered?

These are the stories we hide.

THE STORIES WE HIDE will bring together speculative fiction stories from members of IFWA, the Imaginative Fiction Writers Association. Our members range from hobbyists and beginners to internationally-renowned best-selling writers from across Canada and around the globe, with several Hugo, Nebula, and Aurora Award winners among our ranks!

THE STORIES WE HIDE will be the fifth volume in the Enigma Front anthology series, and the second published by ExitZero Books. We are planning to release the book in August 2018.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We're setting a Flexible Funding goal of $1500 to get the anthology into print. At least half of whatever we raise through this campaign will be put toward paying the writers for their stories. Put simply, the more we raise here, the more the writers get paid.

We also need to, y'know... print the book. Print on demand publishing has made this easier and more cost effective than ever for small presses, but there are still upfront costs which must be covered. If we don't meet our $1500 goal, we will still be producing the anthology with whatever we do raise.

As for what you get, THE STORIES WE HIDE will be an important collection of speculative fiction. IFWA is a pretty diverse crowd of writers, so you're looking at a book with science fiction, fantasy, horror, slipstream, all of the _____punk genres, and likely a few stories that defy categorization. The writers are working on their stories right now, and we're hoping to cram around 20 pieces into the finished book when we release in August 2019.

 

THE IMPACT

Since 2015, the Enigma Front anthology series has been a stepping stone for new authors and editors to dip their toes into the murky waters of the publishing business. A number of promising writers have seen their first stories show up in past Enigma Front books alongside seasoned veterans and a few big names, and previous volumes in the series have been shortlisted for the Prix Aurora Award, Canada's premiere honour for speculative fiction.

For a beginning writer, seeing a story you've worked on in print is an incredibly encouraging thing to see for the first time, and having that credit to your name opens doors further down the road. Your support on this campaign ensures the continuance of the Enigma Front anthology series, allowing us to offer this opportunity to more new and upcoming writers for years to come.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The risks are minimal. We have a good team of editors at the ready, all of whom have worked on projects like this before. We have a talented pool of writers already working on their stories, and ample time to put the book together before our release date of August 2019.

story:
Come, sit.

The fact that you are here is no accident – the gods have called for you to turn your eyes to their actions once more. Zeus, the King of Olympus, has decreed that the Pantheon must return to Earth, for they are losing their way. Who is ‘they’? Perhaps it is you, dear mortal, lost within the eras of modern-day technology. Or perhaps it is the Gods, unsure of how to reinvent their own wheel, or whether they should even try. 

It has been far too long since you looked to us for guidance, since you have asked for the heavens to come down and help you. We will wait no longer – we are here, mortals. Right now.

History tells tales of the old Gods of Greece, where they took pity on mortals, made them champions to their causes, played games with their minds. There are, as you may know, many unsavory stories as well.

We are more than an old scribe’s tales. History was written by the victors and those with deep opinions, and in this new age, we strive to become more than old Homer’s flowery and potent words, or Ovid’s ballads of conquest and pillage. 

IMMORTAL FEARS

Halloween is a time for facing fears we thought long dead, and for seeing ourselves for who we truly are:

  • This fall, Rewritten Realms will be releasing the first anthology of the antics of the gods all set around the most mysterious time that is Samhain. 
  • Contributors to the indiegogo campaign will get a special edition copy of the anthology which will come with a signed thank you card from the gods! 
  • If we don't reach our goal, all of the funds received will go towards the publication of the anthology, to pay our amazing editors, isbn, marketing and graphic teams. 

The Impact

With your help, we'll be able to pay our amazing contributors and deliver an even better product: 

  • How many times have you heard about how you wish there was a place, you could read about the gods in modern times? Well, there is! 
  • This anthology will be the first of Rewritten Realms, LLC, the parent company of In The Pantheon, and all funds will be used to contribute to the next anthology, and the one after that. 
  • In the end, we're a bunch of authors trying to make our way through this crazy world, and turn into a publishing company that looks out for our authors before anything else. Our goal is to take our incredibly talented group of authors and make it so they can point to something and say, I'm f**king published. 

Risks & Challenges

There is always the possibility that a meteor will come hurdling to earth and we won't make the deadline for our publishing date, but here's the thing:

  • No matter what, we are completing and publishing this anthology, even if every dime comes from our own pockets. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help! There's tons of ways to get involved:

  • Get the word out! We know these are difficult times for everyone, but social media can help us get more visibility. Make sure you are following @inthepantheon on all your social media platforms.
  • Share using the Indiegogo tools!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jo-Ann Richards Goffe, and I’m a Christian Cultural Advocate. My mission is the decolonization of worship spaces. 

 

As a Jamaican working in West Africa in 2002-3, helping Christ-followers to use their own languages and music genres in worship, my eyes were gradually opened to the importance of discovering our true identities, and connecting this with God in worship. In fact, I began to realize that this could even potentially lead to a reduction in the crime rate in my home country!

 

On returning to Jamaica, I had conversations with church and worship leaders, and was encouraged to start a national conversation about the importance of developing culturally relevant expressions of worship. We went one step further, and started a global conversation, a part of which is the KW Magazine: CREWShall Connections in Faith & Culture! The magazine is designed to facilitate conversations about worship and cultural identity among Christ-followers primarily of African heritage in Jamaica, the Caribbean, the African continent and the rest of the world.

 

Interviews with singers, authors, dancers and other artists, project features, articles from worship and culture leaders all over the globe, are combined with music scores, poems, devotionals, health tips and a kids story! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are starting out small with just 500 copies. To print 500 copies of the magazine , we will need $2940. Your contributions will help to take the conversations into schools, colleges and churches, and give you a chance to participate as well!

The Impact

In the past, my campaigns have focused on local, Jamaican impact. This project is extending the impact much wider. We are reaching out to connect Christ-followers on the African continent with those in her diasporas all over the world. Whether you are of African heritage or not, or have friends or in-laws who are, it is a truly meaningful project for you to contribute to! Most valuable contributions in this issue of the publication are:

  • Music scores for Jamaican worship songs
  • Health Corner
  • Introduction to an amazing teenage gospel artiste from the Caribbean. There is so much to learn from her!
  • A Bishop's take on raising culturally conscious kids in the UK

The success of this magazine will result not only in the sharing of information though. Support for the magazine means support of CREW 40:4. One of our major projects involves mentoring youth through culturally relevant expressions of worship using the performing arts! The magazine is one way we plan to assist in funding that project.

Risks & Challenges

The first issue of KW Magazine was like a test run. A few generous contributors supplied the funds for printing and we were off and running. Finally, the shipment arrived and we got the call to pick them up. Imagine our shock when we opened the box that should have contained 490 copies of the magazine, and it only had 136, with 18 of them damaged or dirty! So yes, there are definitely risks. We are happy to report that the publishers up fronted the cost for reprinting and reshipping, and that the shipping company is in the process of refunding said costs to the publishers. Our publishers (Select Arrow) rock!!

Timing is also sometimes a challenge, as contributing writers are not always on time. In fact, the first issue was scheduled to be released on July 1 of 2018. It wasn't released until March 1 2019! But we give thanks it was released and the responses have been great!

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, and we understand that. However, you can still have access to the online version of the magazine - you just won't be able to download it. You can also definitely spread the word around and help to build the Kom Mek Wi Worship Tribe!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Paul Metsa. I am a Minneapolis based musician, songwriter, author, community activist, and unpublished poet (hoping to change that with this IGG campaign!) I have performed over 6,000 professional gigs, released 12 original recording projects, honored to  have been awarded 8 MN Music Awards, and have performed, participated, and produced hundreds of benefits for a variety of causes. My autobiography Blue Guitar Highway was published by the University of MN Press in 2011, the same university that refused me entrance into their music school years earlier- finally how life works.

My music has been favorably reviewed in the Austin Chronicle, No Depression, Spin Magazine, among others. The Huffington Post referred to me as "the other great folksinger from Minnesota's Mesabi Iron Range." Kirkus Review said of Blue Guitar Highway, "Metsa is as likeable narrator as ever graced a barstool." I have always loved playing with the English Language in a variety of styles and formats.

I have been writing poetry and free verse for many years. As I celebrate my 40th anniversary of my first gig in Minneapolis in the Fall of 2019, I would love to self publish a book of these poems and verse along with a companion CD of me reading the works backed up by some of the best musicians in Minneapolis, improvising soundscapes to support the poetry. It would be a brand new and exciting artistic avenue for me, and would nicely complement my songs and prose, as well as providing a more intimate glimpse of myself as an artist. The accompanying spoken word CD with improvised music supporting the poems, will also let me experiment with a variety of musicians exploring loops, different instruments (like the Native American flute that accompanies my poem Liquid Heart within the video appearing here) and more. It will also let me work with both my usual musicians, and other great musicians throughout the Twin Cities that I don't get a chance to work with but whose work I love creating new work along the way.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $7,500 over 35 days. Here is the cost breakdown: 300 books at $5 per= $ 1.500.  Artwork and Book Editing: $ 750. Studio time to record, mix, and master CD- $750 x 3 =$ 2,250 (that is three full days in the studio.) Musicians- 10 musicians at $150 per musician = $1,500. Replication of 300 CD's w/ artwork- $1,000. Incidentals-$500.

If I don't reach my total goal my priorities would be to get the book done first.

The importance of this particular project for me is to not only extend my artistic reach into poetry (with both the book and the spoken word CD) is that it will give me another avenue to explore in terms of putting on solo shows featuring both the poetry and my music. I also relish the chance to create new musical soundscapes with musicians I've always wanted to work with, along with my longtime musical partners!

It also gives me two more items to sell at shows, in stores, and online. I have also founded a 501 C3 Dog Rescue group called B.A.R.K. (Blackie's Animal Rescue Krusade) that I am rolling out in 2020. We will be providing music and musicians to Humane Shelters, and Canine Rescue Operations, to raise money and awareness of the shelters and their musicians. It is named after my beloved rescue Blackie, who I spent 16 of the greatest years of my life with. Together we raised thousands of dollars for rescue groups with concerts I both produced and performed at. Having Alphabet Jazz and the companion Spoken Word CD, will let me sell these at these shows, giving a portion of the sales to the cause.

While Alphabet Jazz will exhibit my talent and facility as a poet, I also believe poetry is a much needed balm in this world of technological madness and chaos. I hope it gives people a glimpse into my personal thoughts, ideas, and impulses, and hopefully inspires others to try writing poetry out for themselves.

I did a Kickstarter Campaign in 2014 and raised $8,400 (with a goal of $7,500) to put out a companion CD of my music (Blues, Ballads, and Broadsides) to go along with my book Blue Guitar Highway.

In 2017, I was a bit less successful with an IndieGoGo campaign for my song Ain't Gonna Whistle Dixie Anymore. We were shooting for $5,000 but truthfully I got a little gun shy. We did raise $1,500 which enabled us to do a great lyric video for the song. Here is the link to the video:

https://youtu.be/BBqxRmXwMko

I am looking on doing a strong 30 Day campaign for Alphabet Jazz utilizing my almost 1,500 followers of Facebook, my almost 5,000 Facebook friends, as well as my growing Twitter and Instagram accounts. I am confident our goal of $7,500 is both worthy and doable.

I'm hoping even if you can't contribute, feel free to go to my website at www.paulmetsa.com where you will be able to hear several tunes of mine and watch my videos free of charge. Please consider sharing my Alphabet Jazz campaign with friends. I really appreciate it!

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Miracle Village is a beautiful coming of age fiction novel set in Haiti. It is a story of family, love, suspense and secrets all wrapped up in rich island culture. 

The story itself has been on my heart for years, and I’ve actually already written it in many different ways, however it never felt right. It wasn’t until I went to Haiti on a volunteer missionary trip in 2016 that all the pieces came together for me. 

On this trip, I led a workshop on inner beauty and strength for the women in the little town of, Vilaj Mirak, Miracle Village. Miracle Village is a village of survivors, it is filled with resilient people that have shown us that it is possible to start life all over again. Its quaint, colorful, and vibrant aesthetic was the perfect setting for my story. And so, naming the book after this village was inevitable. 

I am proud of this novel. I’ve written several stories that I’ve shared with friends and family. However Miracle Village is a story that I believe is worthy to be shared with the world. It is a testament of how Haitian Americans are finally starting to take control of their narratives.

I am so excited to release this work. As a creative independent author, I will need your help to realize my dream. My goal is to raise $5,000 to have the book edited and self published. I am also raising funds to organize the official book launch event which is scheduled for December 1, 2018. 

The town of Miracle Village has given me so much hope and inspiration and I would like to return the favor. Therefore a portion of the book sales will be used to aid the people of Miracle Village. 

Thank you for helping me accomplish my vision.

story:
I have almost accomplished my lifelong dream. A couple of years ago, I picked up a manuscript I started twenty-five years ago and began to write again. Here I am, two years later, with a finished manuscript that readers have said is a page-turner. I have completed the final stages of editing on my own, and it’s now ready for a professional to edit it.  

I am raising funds to bring my dream of being a fiction writer to come true. Many people don’t understand the amount of work that goes into creating a novel, aside from the countless hours of writing and editing. There are book covers, several editors, proofreaders, formatting - the list goes on. 

 It takes diligence and perseverance to finish a manuscript, but to publish it takes even more. And then there are the costs. Below is an estimated cost for me to turn my manuscript into a published novel. 

Editing & Proofreading - $4,080.00  

Cover Design - $800.00   

ISBN & copy-write- $175  

Print on Demand Service - $80.00

 With taxes and fees, this adds up to $6,100.00.  Having this money available means, I will be able to publish my manuscript in months instead of years. I would be grateful for any help you are willing to give.

The help you give will mean I get to start doing what I love for a living. I’m not sure there is a way to express what that will mean for me and my life. There isn’t a big enough word.

The Anturan Prophecy

When Taylor Burke rescues the mysterious Rayla from a mountain lake, he learns she was not there by accident. She has come through a portal from a different world looking for him. Now, rather than returning to a normal life, his saving her leads to several, more than unexpected complications. 

Not only does she port him to her world, she tells him his presence is vital since he is the prophesied savior of her people. Then, as he comes to terms with this situation and begins to help her people achieve freedom from their enslaver, Tarak, he finds himself falling in love with Rayla. 

Their situation worsens after their refuge is compromised, and in the race against time to find The Refuge’s inhabitants a new home; Taylor and Rayla discover a ruined city of magic. Can this be the place where they can take a stand against Tarak... and still survive?

The Anturan Prophecy is portal fantasy at its finest: intrigue, magic, and a ruined city. It’s a standalone novel about the war-torn world of Anturan and the journey to escape the tyranny of oppression. This novel is an intended lead in a series about the universe Anturan exists in. I am currently writing the second book in the series, and it is three-quarters finished. And I have simple outlines created for the third and fourth. 

Age: 16+

Length: Approximately 390 pages 

 

Readers are saying:

 “Anturan is a page-turner. “ 

 “I kept wanting to read to find out who this mysterious woman is.” 

 

Still not convinced? Read the first 3 chapters of The Anturan Prophecy here: https://www.cdraderauthor.com/the-autu

 

What comes after the novel is complete?

E-book

I have done my due diligence in working on my marketing. Amazon’s Kindle direct publishing (KDP) offers a 90 day Kindle select program. KDP Select is a program available to all authors willing to grant Amazon exclusive rights to sell their e-book through the Kindle store only.

The main benefits of enrolling include access to:

Kindle Unlimited

Kindle Countdown Deals

Kindle Free Promotions

Kindle Owners’ Lending Library

Increased royalties for sales in select countries

The main game changer here is Kindle unlimited, an all you can read program. I have spoken with some self-publishing authors, and Kindle Unlimited enabled them to jumpstart their careers as authors. Kindle Unlimited has become a top-rated program with readers. Without being enrolled in the program, it has become almost impossible to rank well on Amazon. It allows for promotions, like selling your e-book for 99¢, enticing readers to purchase it after reading the available chapters for free.

While digital copies of the book must only sell through Amazon:

A 10% sample of the book can be made available outside of the Kindle Store;

Print (or any other non-digital) versions are allowed to be distributed elsewhere, and copies of the book can be emailed to reviewers for editing purposes.

Once the 90-day contract is over, you can renew or cancel to punish your e-book with other programs such as Apple Books.

Paper Print

I will be using Ingram Spark - a direct publishing program - to print The Anturan Prophecy. This print platform allows the following.

The global distribution to over 40,000 retailers & libraries

Availability to Amazon, Apple, Kobo, and Barnes & Noble

Print quality and e-reader compatibility

Online sales reporting

All managed from a single platform

The print on demand option here means that I do not need to order thousands of dollars in books. There is a small onetime fee to register the novel. In my stretch goals for my marketing strategy, I will be ordering copies to send to bloggers and book reviewers to get reviews before the book goes live on Amazon.

Why am I using IndieGoG:

I have been working on The Anturan Prophecy for over 20 years. I finally completed it last year and spent the last few months self-editing and working with associates to get feedback. I have found an editor ready for the project, and I am looking at a few cover designers. Once those pieces are complete, the book formatting, ISBN, Etc., will be completed. 

I have done one of the hardest parts I’ve written it! I need your help to get this book published!

The $6,000.00 funding goal will allow me to publish an e-book and print copies for sale on various platforms. I have chosen the flexible campaign because being even a few dollars short means not receiving the funds to move forward. Choosing which campaign to pick was very hard. I’m ready to move forward as an author and writer and publish this book and the following books in the series.

The more money we raise, the more marketing and time I can put into this book. Stretch goals include - high-end publishing software (Fancy book options), Pre-order copies for marketing, Hometown Launch, illustrated map of Anturan, Traveling to local book stores to do book signings, and an Audiobook. Below is an estimate of what I will be able to do once I reach my goal. These figures are including the original funding goal of $6,100.00. 

High-end file formatting program for publishing - $6450.00  

Pre-order copies for marketing - $6800.00 

Hometown Launch - $7,350.00

Map - $8,225.00

Book Signings- $10,225.00 (print copies for signing and promotion and travel expenses)

Audiobook - $13,025.00

I would be honored if you would join me on this journey of publishing my book!

Risks and challenges

The editing process and commissioning a cover created will take time. If I consider everything, I expect I could have the novel ready by the midwinter this year. I would begin marketing and have the e-book available for launch on Amazon KDP by the end of January 2021. No matter what, I will be sending out the thank you notes and shout outs when the campaign is complete.

It allows for promotions, like selling your e-book for 99¢, enticing readers to purchase it after reading the available chapters for free.While digital copies of the book must only sell through Amazon:A 10% sample of the book can be made available outside of the Kindle Store;Print (or any other non-digital) versions are allowed to be distributed elsewhere, and copies of the book can be emailed to reviewers for editing purposes.Once the 90-day contract is over, you can renew or cancel to punish your e-book with other programs such as Apple Books.Paper PrintI will be using Ingram Spark - a direct publishing program - to print The Anturan Prophecy. This print platform allows the following.The global distribution to over 40,000 retailers & librariesAvailability to Amazon, Apple, Kobo, and Barnes & NoblePrint quality and e-reader compatibilityOnline sales reportingAll managed from a single platformThe print on demand option here means that I do not need to order thousands of dollars in books. There is a small onetime fee to register the novel. In my stretch goals for my marketing strategy, I will be ordering copies to send to bloggers and book reviewers to get reviews before the book goes live on Amazon.Why am I using IndieGoG:I have been working on The Anturan Prophecy for over 20 years. I finally completed it last year and spent the last few months self-editing and working with associates to get feedback. I have found an editor ready for the project, and I am looking at a few cover designers. Once those pieces are complete, the book formatting, ISBN, Etc., will be completed. I have done one of the hardest parts I’ve written it! I need your help to get this book published!The $6,000.00 funding goal will allow me to publish an e-book and print copies for sale on various platforms. I have chosen the flexible campaign because being even a few dollars short means not receiving the funds to move forward. Choosing which campaign to pick was very hard. I’m ready to move forward as an author and writer and publish this book and the following books in the series.The more money we raise, the more marketing and time I can put into this book. Stretch goals include - high-end publishing software (Fancy book options), Pre-order copies for marketing, Hometown Launch, illustrated map of Anturan, Traveling to local book stores to do book signings, and an Audiobook. Below is an estimate of what I will be able to do once I reach my goal. These figures are including the original funding goal of $6,100.00. High-end file formatting program for publishing - $6450.00  Pre-order copies for marketing - $6800.00 Hometown Launch - $7,350.00Map - $8,225.00Book Signings- $10,225.00 (print copies for signing and promotion and travel expenses)Audiobook - $13,025.00I would be honored if you would join me on this journey of publishing my book!Risks and challengesThe editing process and commissioning a cover created will take time. If I consider everything, I expect I could have the novel ready by the midwinter this year. I would begin marketing and have the e-book available for launch on Amazon KDP by the end of January 2021. No matter what, I will be sending out the thank you notes and shout outs when the campaign is complete.

story:
About Hooverville:

The Good Girl's Guide to Proper Etiquette:
DON'T: Dance without a partner.
DON'T: Chortle.
DON'T: Speak while a man is speaking!
DON'T: Reject a Marriage Proposal
DON'T: Disappear in the middle of the night.

Annaleise Winston has never been very good at following rules.

Read Chapter One Here: https://kaylajoyartist.wixsite.com/website/post/hoovervilleexclusivechapter

Set in New York in the summer of 1932, Hooverville tells the story of aristocrat Annaleise Winston, who can never seem to fit in with the Society Girls, the strict rules that govern them, or their selfish indulgence during the midst of the Great Depression. Behind closed doors, her publicly perfect new fiance, Frank Alexander, is violent and dismissive, but without his financial security, Annaleise and her mother will be on the streets. 

When Annaleise finally has enough of it all, she runs away and is accidentally stranded in a Hooverville, a lawless homeless encampment in Central Park, where she must keep her identity a secret if she wants to stay safe. But a kind shoe shiner named Thomas Kelley may get in the way of everything she thought she ever wanted. As their love grows, the Great Depression worsens, and Frank will pay any price to bring back his bride.

Hooverville is based on a true story about the Great Depression, The Bonus Army protests, and the homeless camps that scattered the country during the era. 
 

This is my second book, but the first one that I am publishing. I am overwhelmingly excited to see this book in it's physical form and to see it on shelves and in the hands of readers. I think it's just such an important story that I started almost two years ago, and I intend to see it through.

What I Need & What You Get

Every dollar I raise will be put towards self-publishing this book. I chose to self publish over traditional publish because of the many pros, and it was something I wanted to do since I started writing this book, but I couldn't afford the cost of publishing, especially after the coronavirus pandemic when I no longer had money coming in. 

I need to raise approximately $3,000 to cover the costs of cover art, line editing, professional editing, marketing, and print/distribution. Most of the budget will go towards cover art, formatting and having it professionally edited. 

We have some amazing perks included with your donation, from print copies, to exclusive content, to merchandise boxes from small businesses! In addition to your chosen perk, you'll recieve every perk from  the lower levels.

The Impact

I have proof that at five years old I wanted to be a published author, and that dream hasn't faded a single bit. I have chosen to self publish because I don't want to be tied down by a publishing company telling me what I can or cannot write, or telling me that certain scenes or entire plotlines can't be used in the book. Hooverville is my baby, and I want to have creative control over this project until the end, and I would like to own the rights to the characters.

By donating to this project, you'll not only be helping a dream come true, but helping to get a never-before-told story out into the world. Annaleise Winston is a strong heroine who's been compared to Scarlett Ohara and Rose Dewitt Bukater, and she will be a role model for young girls everywhere who read her story.

story:
About The Secret Eye

The Secret Eye follows two men who are thrust into service during World War II. There is a marked difference in the motivation of these men as they choose to serve their country. A secret gift to the United States from Great Britain propels the US to a technological advantage that will determine the fate of the war. But, a new threat emerges from Japan, one that will terrorize the US forces in the Pacific. How can America Survive?

I love history and World War 2 has always fascinated me. These young men were our greatest generation. The main character of this book is based on the life of my stepfather Charlie who grew up in Little Rock, Arkansas. He chose to serve in the Navy and become one of the few men to work on America's newest secret weapon.

On the other side of the Pacific Ocean, in the Land of the Rising Sun, a young man struggles to find his way in the world after his father is killed fighting in the Sino-Japanese War. As the oldest, he is exempt from serving during World War 2, but he still serves.

The two men leave everything at home to meet in battle, one armed with terror and the other armed with a secret weapon. Japan will try to win the war using terror, how can America win the war? The Secret Eye.

 

How Can You Help & What You Get

This is my first book and I have dreamed of writing a book like this for most of my life. One that would honor the men who sacrificed so much for our freedom. I am providing you an opportunity to pre-order this book and take advantage of some special purchase perks. 

 

The Impact

To help me publish my first book, the money raised through this campaign will help fund:

  • Editing services necessary to prepare my manuscript for publishing
  • Creation of Book Cover Art
  • Interior formatting of the book
  • Publishing of the final manuscript

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is completing the manuscript and making it ready to publish. Handling worldwide shipping can be challenging as well. I have eliminated the shipping risk by including the cost of shipping into each campaign tier. 

I will be working closely with BookBaby Publishing to make sure we ship your selected perk to you as early as possible (I anticipate a Summer publishing date). We will keep all backers of this campaign apprised of the delivery status of their book. My publisher has worldwide reach and can accommodate any order.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you may not be able to contribute to publish The Secret Eye for various reasons. But that does not mean you cannot help. Here are some ways you can help drive interest in The Secret Eye with your friends:

  • Consider helping me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign using Social Media.
  • Indiegogo has outstanding share tools that will help you tell the world about my secret, The Secret Eye!

 

About The Author

Brad Hanson is a first time author from Texas. His extended family has served the United States through military and civilian service for over 50 years. Brad's love of history has taken him all over the world visiting ancient and modern historical locations. He brings his specific interest in World War 2 history to his first book, The Secret Eye.

Brad works in technology as a Program Manager for a fortune 100 company. He is married with 2 grown children and 2 furry babies.

story:
Rad Girl Revolution will be a hardcover (10x8") children's book for kids ages 3-7 that empowers young girls and encourages gender equal mindsets in young boys. 

RAD stands for Rise Above Doubt and Reach Any Dream. The book will feature 30 inspiring storybook-style photos of real little girls in fields typically under-represented by women, along with a rhyming verse describing each career. The book includes occupations such as Scientist, Judge, Artist, Astronaut, Doctor, Pilot, Journalist, Director, Chef, Author, CEO, Engineer, Paleontologist, President, and many more. 

Why Photographs? 

We don't want our message getting muddled in the fantasy of typical picture book illustrations. We are showing young girls career opportunities they may not otherwise know exist, and we believe photos of real girls help further drive home the reality.  Plus, as anyone with little kids knows, children LOVE looking at photographs of other kids! Children are intrigued by their peers- influenced even, so we felt the positive and empowering portrayal of real little girls was a must.

Why Rhymes?

There are many empowering children's books that are suited for girls 7 and up, but we wanted our book to appeal to a younger audience. Gender stereotypes are set in children as early as age 6, so it is crucial to expose them to empowering books and reach them during the critical developmental ages of 3-7 years old.

1. The Book 

2. Kickstarter Exclusive Coloring Book 

10-Page "Rad Girl" Coloring Book in PDF

 3. Rad Girl Sticker Sheet 

9.75 x 7.75" Sticker Sheet with 10 "Rad Girl" Stickers

 4. A Rad Girl Revolution "Future Madam President" T-Shirt 

Available in Sizes 2T - Youth M

5. Print YOUR Rad Girl's Name in the Book 

*limited quantity available

6. "Rad Girl Revolution" School Pack 

Your school will receive 10 copies of "Rad Girl Revolution" + a customized lesson plan (for pre-school - 2nd grade)

7. Your Own "Rad Girl" Photoshoot  

Re-create any Rad Girl photo-session with YOUR Rad Girls!

STRETCH GOAL REACHED:

Hello! We are Sharita Manickam & Jen Bruno! RAD Girl Revolution was written by Sharita and photo-illustrated by Jen. We are neighbors from Forest Hills, NY and we became fast friends when our kids started having playdates together. We found we had shared creative interests and similar values in raising socially-conscious children.  

While inspiring books such as Good Night Stories for Rebel Girls, She Persisted, and Little Leaders fill our children's bookshelves, we wanted to create a book where every little girl could see themselves represented in the pages. While we believe it is very important to teach our children about the incredible women of the past, we also feel it's essential for young girls to be able to picture themselves becoming the inspiring women of the future!

We are inspired by the increased momentum toward gender equality, and feel that putting these images and rhymes in front of today’s youth can help better level the playing field from the start.  

                           

JOIN OUR EMAIL LIST!

 

Have a question, comment, or an interview request? Send us an email!

radgirlbook@gmail.com

story:
Lily's story

Lily was born in Merced, Northern California on February 3, 2013. She grew up in San Francisco as a companion dog for her Mom, who was not allowed to work while her Dad was studying. From San Francisco Lily traveled the world. Lily got her name from the song “Pictures of Lily” after her parents went to “The Who” concert in Las Vegas. In 2014 the family moved to Cape Town, South Africa where she had many more experiences. Lily is the only Schnauzer in the world who has walked a glacier in Alaska and climbed Table Mountain in South Africa. Lily developed granulomatous meningoencephalitis (GME), a brain disease, just after her first birthday. GME is a very dangerous sickness for dogs. Lily was extremely brave, and with the help of a great doctor and the love of her owners, she recovered from the disease and subsequent chemotherapy and cortisone treatments. She is now in remission and is back to being the same cute Schnauzer with a big heart and loads of personality that she was before her illness. 

Three of Lily's books, based on her life, have been published to date. Lily's books have also been translated into French, Spanish and Chinese. How Lily got her bling back is set in Washington Square, San Francisco, and deals with issues related to friendship, jealousy and strangers. Its also introduce children to time capsules. Lily goes to Alaska is a fun story that plays of on a family holiday on Alaska, and deals with fatherly love.


Two other titles, dealing with Lily's move to a far of land away from her friends and brave Lily going to hospital, will be released in April and May. 


Lily's ABC Safari has been published on the 1st of March as an iBook, with othe platforms following shortly. The e-book exposes a younger generation to the adventures of Lily. The book is a fresh approach to learning the alphabet, and is definitely not your typical "A" is for Apple type book. Lily introduces her friends to wild animals that you get while on Safari in Africa, thus adding another level of learning, as it makes children aware of some endangered species, and introduces conservation at a younger age. 
Lily's ABC Safari has already been funded, but now we want to create a more engaging and quality experience for our young readers, by creating an animated e-book with your help.  


About the author

Steer Goosen developed the concept of the children’s book series “The Adventures of Lily.” The Adventures of Lily introduces children to adventures and traveling through the eyes of Lily, the miniature Schnauzer. Steer introduces simple facts about the places and characters Lily encounters, intertwined with little life lessons. Steer is a great believer that traveling and life experiences are among the most important building blocks of a person’s education. One should never pass up any opportunity to gain even the smallest experience. Immersing yourself in different cultures offers the opportunity to understand others much better and to discover new perspectives on life, helping to create a class of world citizens through whom humankind can become united. Life experiences and travel cultivate and accelerate creativity and innovation.

The merging of fantasy and reality through the use of actual events in Lily’s life is the canvas for the stories. Backed up with photographs on the website, it is aimed at making Lily’s character engaging and identifiable. The website is also interactive, and allows children to share their stories with their peers on the blog.


The Impact

By Steer Goosen Lily's big personality has crept into the hearts of all her friends in the USA and South Africa, over the first two years of her life. She was nearly taken away through illness, but she remained brave and strong and overcame her sickness, which was associated with chemo treatment and lots of other medication and the side effects thereof. I feel she has a lot of value to offer young children and their parents.

The style of illustrations used in Lily's books help the author to add to the impact of the story by involving the readers imagination. The author also aims to entertain the reader through humor in every scene and throughout the story. The partnership between the illustrator and the author is truly magical, creating a truly immersive experience.

By Scott R. Harpole
Kids stories are often difficult to review, especially because I'm also a children's author. However the concept of seeing the world from Lily's viewpoint (she's a little schnauzer that travels to Alaska) is both humorous & engaging. The pictures are refreshing, simple and creative. The story is fun and makes you want to find out what happens next. Excellent job!

Lily's story inspires children to deal with social issues such as jealousy, friendship, strangers, moving house, parental love, conservation and lots more. Lily's stories are great reads for children of all ages.

By Deon TerBlanche
Fantastic kids book, we enjoyed every moment of it. The story is fun and Lily is just adorable, we couldn't put it down and HAD to finish it in one sitting. The graphics are perfect for a kids book, no clutter each one just perfect to explain the page (some things need to be left to the child's imagination.) I can recommend this book to kids of "all" ages, I loved it and I am 48 years old!

Below are some of the illustrations taken from "How Lily got her bling back" and "Lily goes to Alaska". (Text omitted)


Transforming Lily's stories, in particular "Lily's ABC Safari", would allow parents access to a interactive and engaging conceptual learning tool for toddlers.  


What We Need & What You Get

The funding is required for the following production elements:

  1. Voice Over
  2. Sound Track
  3. Animation
  4. Publishing
The perks Lily overs for your help include large discounts on her books and also mentions as well as personalized books.


Risks & Challenges

The vector files has already been funded and are in production, should the target not be reached the book will still be produced but it would just take a bit longer. Three of the 5 books in the series are already produced, 2 of them are published and available for distribution as perks, with a third already in postproduction, and would available as a perk in March 2015.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can still support Lily by leaving a review, spreading the news or posting a short story of your adventure with your pet on her blog at the www.theadventuresoflily.com. She would love it more than a bone.

Please review the latest adventure of Lily the amazing Miniature Schnauzer, available now as a special made for iBooks version. Lily's latest adventure is also available in Chinese,  Spanish and French. 

Don't forget to review her other book, Lily goes to Alaska, on Amazon, Lulu, Smashwords, Kobo, Made for iBooks and Google Play. Also available in Chinese, Spanish and French in all the stores. 

Or just share with your friends on the Indiegogo share tools above!

The author also aims to entertain the reader through humor in every scene and throughout the story. The partnership between the illustrator and the author is truly magical, creating a truly immersive experience.


By Scott R. HarpoleKids stories are often difficult to review, especially because I'm also a children's author. However the concept of seeing the world from Lily's viewpoint (she's a little schnauzer that travels to Alaska) is both humorous & engaging. The pictures are refreshing, simple and creative. The story is fun and makes you want to find out what happens next. Excellent job!


Lily's story inspires children to deal with social issues such as jealousy, friendship, strangers, moving house, parental love, conservation and lots more. Lily's stories are great reads for children of all ages.


By Deon TerBlancheFantastic kids book, we enjoyed every moment of it. The story is fun and Lily is just adorable, we couldn't put it down and HAD to finish it in one sitting. The graphics are perfect for a kids book, no clutter each one just perfect to explain the page (some things need to be left to the child's imagination.) I can recommend this book to kids of "all" ages, I loved it and I am 48 years old!

Below are some of the illustrations taken from "How Lily got her bling back" and "Lily goes to Alaska". (Text omitted)


Transforming Lily's stories, in particular "Lily's ABC Safari", would allow parents access to a interactive and engaging conceptual learning tool for toddlers.  
   What We Need & What You Get The funding is required for the following production elements:


Voice Over
Sound Track
Animation
Publishing

The perks Lily overs for your help include large discounts on her books and also mentions as well as personalized books.



    
Risks & Challenges The vector files has already been funded and are in production, should the target not be reached the book will still be produced but it would just take a bit longer. Three of the 5 books in the series are already produced, 2 of them are published and available for distribution as perks, with a third already in postproduction, and would available as a perk in March 2015.
    
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute financially you can still support Lily by leaving a review, spreading the news or posting a short story of your adventure with your pet on her blog at the www.theadventuresoflily.com. She would love it more than a bone.
Please review the latest adventure of Lily the amazing Miniature Schnauzer, available now as a special made for iBooks version. Lily's latest adventure is also available in Chinese,  Spanish and French. Don't forget to review her other book, Lily goes to Alaska, on Amazon, Lulu, Smashwords, Kobo, Made for iBooks and Google Play. Also available in Chinese, Spanish and French in all the stores. 
Or just share with your friends on the Indiegogo share tools above!

story:
If you have ever been to Colonia Roma in Mexico City then you know why I have fallen hard for this neighborhood. A mix of hipsters, debutantes, grandmothers and street vendors, this place has not only become the it place to live in Mexico City, but one that continuously reveals itself to me in unexpected ways and never fails to capture my curiosity.

For the past three years I have been working on a guide to living in my neighborhood, one that would not only give readers a list of the best carnitas stands and upscale hotels, but also a map of the voting districts, the hours of the closest supermarket and info on how to rent an apartment. If I can give this project the boost it needs to succeed, my hope is to make living guides to all my favorite neighborhoods in the city -- coming soon to a barrio near you.

All my researching and writing is done and it's time to get my project edited, printed and stocked on shelves, but I need your help. I want this guide to be useful, insightful and beautiful, crafted with love and intense passion for the place I live, but the cost of self-publishing is more than a lowly freelance writer can afford. 

I am looking to raise 5,000usd for the graphic design, printing and editing of my guide. If you can make even a small donation you will be part of what I promise will be the best guide to la Roma ever written.
