story:
What Is It?

“Alone (In My Room)” 

is my latest endeavor as an author, it’s a narrative story using the mediums of poetry, prose, journals, jokes, visual art to tell the story about me and my experiences, perspectives, understandings that occur what is intended to be conveniently the ‘safest’ where I am my true self and unmitigated by immediate influences of the world that lies out the four walls that know me the best. It is a journey of love, pain, joy that deals with issues of beautiful and tragic experiences that occur in it’s purest stream. I am honestly scared of hell of putting this book out because of the potentially vulnerability that I accept but I also understand there is a lot of power in vulnerability and that sometimes the most effective art scares the artist but here I am depending on my community to help me fulfill my dream of producing a project that means a lot to me. 

Two years ago, I produced a small chapbook "I Grew Up Right Beside", a simple project but a little harder to produce than I expected. A beautiful experience giving my art to the world and to get a great response. While I creating IGURBY I wanted to share experiences about my growth, particular growth that goes unnoticed or unacknowledged, the gradual and sharp growth using the theme of how I viewed the through experiences of love and blackness. Through that project, it helped me connect with other people sharing experiences about their and I was able to find a connection by building with our differences and similarities often with people that I did not know I could create such a connection with. That inspired to realize that things that are happening right beside me that goes unnoticed with helped me start a continual social engagement art project which takes the stories of the people that are right beside you and reflect them artistically. The Right Beside You staple is an annual concert that reflects the experiences using podcasts, photography and engaging that live music and poetry. I won't to do the same thing with Alone In My Room under the Right Beside You umbrella and igniting engagement around the topics of solitude and how we view ourselves using different mediums such travelling workshops, concerts and instructional material. 


Who Am I And Why?


“Lying, thinking”-  Maya Angelou, Alone

Art is and has been a powerful force that has allowed me to engage and communicate to myself and others that I share this world with. It’s been like the J.Dilla instrumental that has brought out the best in me and thrive off the vibe. Giving me the chance to “Express Myself” like I am NWA spokesperson, using stand-up comedy, MC hosting, singing, acting and various stages but most importantly express myself through the means of spoken word and poetry. As an immigrant whose ability to travel has been limited, art has allowed to travel through Canada and see that country as more than a mass of land with borders but a canvas that as allowed me to leave poetic graffiti tag on stages from as far east as Halifax, NS to stages and communities as far as Victoria, BC. It’s allowed to be published in various anthologies such as the Great Black North and publish my own chapbook, I Grew Up Right Beside You. It has allowed to have my poems part of community projects such a community flash mob for my poem, Blackberry, Love. It has allowed me have various youth groups through Unity Charity and Art Gallery of York and Harbourfront Centre. It has given the opportunity to share my words on the prestigious “When Brothers Speak” stage and even given me the opportunity to win the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word title as the best poetry slam team in the country with Toronto Poetry Slam in Montreal in 2013. It has allowed me to be myself.


I have learned a perspective that art for me is not just process of creation but more so a process of ‘allowing’. To let the rays shine through, to pull back the curtains. A scary process and this is what my project is about.


What I Need 


Eww. Need is such a strong word but it is necessary. Alright let's do it like this. Let pretend that you are Nicole Wray and Missy Elliot singing the low key classic, "Make It Hot". 

You sing: 

I got what you want (got what you want)
I got what you need (got what you need)
Can I get another shot
This time I'ma make it hot

Aight, good that's beautiful singing. 

I reply;

A Ton + Andre 3Stacks Benjamin

(Andre 3Stacks ($3000) + A ton ($2000) = $5000)

I could have easily just said $5000 but I like to make things complicated. Anyways, self-publishing is not an easy task and a lot of things go into making a wonderful a lot that stuff after the book is written. Funds will be used in this manner: 

  • -  Copy Editing
  • -  Printing (It cost to print with good material. Like yea, for real)
  • -  Cover Design
  • -  Artwork
  • -  Launch Party
  • -  Book Formatting / Layout
  • -  Marketing
  • - Promotional Merchandise

Risks & Challenges

Like how my homeboys would say back in the day when addressing the condition of their daily livelihood, "it's hard outchere, mang"

As an artist, there is a lot of risk in self-publishing a book. Especially financial risk and it’s not easy. There’s a lot that goes into making a project that it is effective and wide-reaching. I have learned this first hand in my project, “I Grew Up Right Beside You”, although it was a small project, there was a lot of energy that goes into it even after the actual text of the project is complete. I want this book to reach people and as well be more than just a book but a gateway to many things that help us with the discussion of “solitude”. I am learning to ask for help and even asking for help is a lot of me but I need help if I want to the things that I want to do this summer and that includes producing this book and as well as completing my studio able for my Right Beside You social engagement project and they canvasing the for the 3rd Annual "Right Beside You" concert and I usually pay out of pocket for a lot of these things and I can easily go into debt and I don't to do that. As corny as it seems, it's not about making money for me, it's about effecting people and not lose while effecting people. 


Perks

Various perks are listed and that includes autographed merchandise, free entry to events, handwritten letters and commissioned personal poems. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Just give love and share this campaign.

story:
Short Summary

With two books already into The Game series that have been enthusiastically received, I'm eager to continue writing.

I am a fantasy author, living in Athens, Greece. The self-publishing process is highly demanding, and resources, as well as time and living expenses,  are factors that mount up against us Indies.

Your contribution would be a great and practical push forward.

About THE GAME series

Falling into the Metaphysical Fantasy genre, THE GAME series revolves around a concept that spans ages, but is initially presented in the contemporary world, and specifically in modern time Europe.
It ties mythological with metaphysical concepts in an effort to answer the question "What do old gods, and ancient beings of our lore do in modern times?"
The idea that belongs to the fantasy genre is that mankind and the beings of myth and legend are bound to take part in a sinister 'game' that takes place every five centuries and the stake of which is the control of the collective unconscious of all humanity.

You can find more details about the concept of the series here: http://www.yanniskarats.com/the-game-series.html

You'll find a couple of quotes with great-looking background pictures in the gallery of the campaign.

The Books

Book #1 is titled THE BOOK OF THE FORSAKEN and introduces the main characters of the story:

Igor Rubinstein, a dark trickster with shadowy desires. Robert Cassidy, an outspoken ex-convict with a passion for nicknames. Daniel Maladie, a bibliophile with the extraordinary ability to be afraid of everything. 

Their stories intertwine under the guidance of the storyteller, a whimsical but manipulative old god, who stages everything for his plan to unfold, integral part of which is securing an ancient relic - the book of the Forsaken races of the Earth and the Moon.

COVER of The Book of the Forsaken (The Game, #1)

*

Book #2 is titled THE RINGMASTER'S GAMBIT and carries on exactly where Book 1 left off.

The book's storyline takes place in and around an old-style circus -Emilian's Finest- that was put together by the mysterious storyteller of the series, in order for its members to execute a very important part of his plan, when the time comes. While he hides in his circus outside Vienna, the parties that are interested in the information the book holds, gather with malefic intent and power-hungry minds.
The clash that ruptures the life of the circus is both inevitable, and expected- at least by the old god . 

COVER of The Ringmaster's Gambit (The Game, #2)

*

Book #3 is titled THE DARK SIDE OF THE MIND and, once it is finished, it will conclude the current storyline that began in Book 1.

Events lead everyone in the bowels of the Moon where the long-forgotten city of the Forsaken races lies. The Game that takes place every five centuries erupts there, and the old god -still guiding his pawns- will have to see his plans either fail or brought to fruition.

COVER to be revealed during the campaign.


Risks & Challenges

Getting the paperback edition done through the POD services of Createspace and the Ebook editions (pdf, epub, mobi) through Smashwords does give me some freedom of movement. What remains to be done is write the remaining 70% of the 3rd book, edit, make a cover, arrange the blog tour and fund for the manufacturing and delivery costs.
Sounds hard? It is.
Is it? Yes.
You sure? Yep.

And it's also fun. And a dream come true. ;)

Do indeed mention it here and there.

Consider picking a perk for yourself, but do not be selfish. Let your shackles fall and share the campaign freely with friends and foes. Tell your loved ones as you break up, or write about it on napkins when you leave a restaurant and you haven't paid your bill so that people can hunt you down alleys with your napkin at hand, asking about the mysterious and utterly engaging Indiegogo campaign you mention on it. Use sprays on toilets or, why not, the underground walls. Hack into TV networks, interrupt news time and be annoying. Tattoo the titles on your - ok, too far.
You get the gist, spread the word.

Other parts of me online

You are already hooked (if not thrilled)?

Read reviews of my published work on Goodreads:

https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/6436774.Yannis_Karatsioris

See Works in Progress of mine on Write On by AmazonKindle:

https://writeon.amazon.com/profile/amzn1.ignite.profile.024d7df26c93f8c9e050007f010040bc?ref_=ign_m_tn_pr_ps

Give me a thumbs up on FB:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yannis-Karatsioris-Author/219293951499809

Say hi through my site:

http://www.yanniskarats.com/

story:
when i turned 18, i went vegan; that was about 6 years ago & that's where my passion for cooking really began. 6 years ago really isn't such a long time ago if you think about it- but then again it kind of was when it came to the advances in vegan dairy & meat substitutes. there really weren't any boxed cake mixes i could try, ice creams i could just purchase, substitutes or anything like that available to me- at least not within reach. so, i started to make my own things; my own vegan lava cake, carrot cake, calzones, macaroni & cheese, meatballs, no bake brownies, ravioli, omelettes, burger patties, etc.

i didn't think much of the substitutions / foods, i produced- i just knew that if i craved something it was up to me to make said something. it wasn't until about 2 years ago that i started posting on my now deactivated personal instagram, that i realised people were interested in what i made, interested enough that they wanted recipes & to try making these things at home so that they could enjoy these alternatives. two years later & hear i am- the green goddess behind 'ethicallyvegan'. the ever growing instagram food photo-blog that i am so proud to say i've posted, maned & have been making & posting recipes for.

i've finally decided to come out with an e-book for many of the things i've listed above. cakes, cookies, pastas, etc. hearty meals that fill you up & make you feel good because you've taken an ethical stance by choosing not to consume any animal products. 

i promise you that through my e-book you'll find hearty recipes that'll 'wow' even omnivores, recipes that will help you feel satiated & happy, whether you're trying to venture into a plant based diet, want to try a meatless meal a week or are already vegan. 

a lot of my 'followers' on instagram always point out that they appreciate my food photos, my attention to details, plating, & so much more, & i want to offer that in a fresh new way in my e-book; with photos that vary from colourful backgrounds helping bring out the even more colourful dishes, or backdrops / plates / flatware that really bring your attention to the meal at hand. i'm posting this indiegogo campaign because i want to keep bringing you out the best of my food photography, as well as stunning dishes paired with beautiful flatware & dishes all delivered with crystal clear imagery that makes you feel as though you're really there. with your help, i can make a stunning e-book that you'll want to refer to time & time again until you've the recipes basically memorised!


i'm hoping to have this book done in the mid to late spring of 2016, & with your help, my goal would be entirely possible.

story:
Short Summary

The Lopit Community in Australia....

This campaign aims to build a primary healthcare centre in Longiro, which is located in the Western Lopit Mountains, South Sudan - a peaceful, yet undeveloped area. Lopit community members (20) now living in Australia have outlined and are implementing an action plan, starting with the goal to end avoidable death and suffering for mothers and children during birth.

The mortality rate in the Lopit Mountains is currently 1 out of 7 women during childbirth, and 35% of children before  reaching age 5. Your contribution will significantly lower this rate.

What We Need & What You Get

In part 1 of this campaign, we raised USD540. It's a start!  This amount will be directed to purchasing basic building materials and equipment. The bricks are ready and land (500mtrs X 450mtrs) is allocated. The next stage is to buy the cement and build the center. Then the roof.. etc.,  and we will continue, using all funds received to build each of the next stages.

Here's a list of materials and equipment needed:

  • $10,000 - Basic construction materials
    Cement, iron sheets, timbers, wheelbarrow, metal spades, roofing nails, big nails,  doors, H2 water tanks, fencing and barbed wire, jembe, axe, hammer, panga, tables, jerrycans, plastic bags, generators, iron bars, racks, agricultural water tube, digging bars, solar panels & equipment, tape measure, hand-saw, paint, pipes, fittings, (includes $3,000 - Transport of materials from Kenya and Uganda). 

As we continue the campaign, these are the next items needed.

  • Construction labor
  • Medical fittings and equipment (e.g. beds, trolleys, etc.)
  • Ambulance

In case of not reaching our entire goal, the funds will go towards each of the next stages of the healthcare center construction. E.g., the bricks are ready and land (500mtrs X 450mtrs) is allocated. The next stage  is to buy the cement and build the center. Then the roof.. etc.,  and we will continue, using all funds received to build each of the next stages.

If the funds received exceed the target, then we will proceed with Stage 2, which is to construct a classroom for primary education in Longiro. Approximately 200 children are currently learning English in an outdoor classroom.

The Impact

Primarily, you will help to reduce the mortality rate for 57 villages in the region. Also, drive the building of schools, establishing rehabilitation centers for people suffering from Leprosy, developing farming and agriculture to improve food security and establish financial sustainability.

Several NGO's are operating aid projects in the Lopit Mountains. These include UNICEF, Save The Children, Norwegian Church Aid and Association for Aid & Relief, Japan. Your contribution will encourage and help to stimulate all efforts.

By contributing, you will play an important role in helping save and give life to people in the Lopit.


What has been done so far

The project is being driven and implemented by the Lopit Community itself. Primarily, it is the determination of the people from Lopit to help their motherland.


For at least a couple of years, the Lopit Community in Australia has been building its network, presenting the situation to various organisations and is receiving ongoing support. As a result of these efforts in 2012, a 40' container of supplies was loaded in Melbourne and shipped to the Lopit Mountains. It contained:

  • Clothing for children and adults
  • Shoes, boots and sandals
  • Food items (including rice, lentils, milk powder, beans, tuna, oil, sugar; wheat flour; other non-perishable goods)
  • Medical supplies
  • Kitchenware (cooking utensils and pots, bowls and cups)
  • Bedding (sheets and blankets)
  • Cloth/fabric (of any sort, that can be made into clothing)
  • Mosquito nets
  • Sewing machines (treadle machines, not electric)
  • Organic seed for grain and vegetable crops
  • Hand tools for agriculture and also for building
  • Soap

For more information, visit https://hnhproject.wordpress.com/page/3/

The Lopit Community in Australia raised an initial $8,000 and sent 3 representatives to the Lopit area to assess the situation and return with their findings. This entire project is based on moving in the direction of development as determined by the Lopit people, and coupled with support garnered in Australia and partnerships established with international organisations, are major factors for overcoming hurdles along the way.

Risks & Challenges

The violence that erupted on 15 December 2013 between armed forces loyal to President Salva Kiir and armed forces loyal to Former Vice President Riek Machar in Juba, the capital city of South Sudan, has resulted in numerous challenges to government programs, including reform of the country's poor healthcare system.

Despite making significant gains in promoting awareness of health and wellness in South Sudan, preventable diseases remain a serious issue. Malaria is one of the country's biggest problems, with thousands of children dying daily from this treatable disease. Although rates of HIV and AIDS infection have slowed in recent years, many families are impacted by these serious conditions.

Also poor sanitation in the  Lopit Mountain areas and the lack of affordable medication further contributes to the spread of disease, and many women and children do not have access to even basic medical treatment.

A key challenge will be to provide trained healthcare staff and/ or volunteers on the ground. Although there's lots of goodwill for providing this support, it is yet to be confirmed.

Another challenge will be to ensure that equipment shipped can be used and ongoing supply sustained. Plans to develop agriculture as a means for building sustainability are also in the initiative stage.

A variety of approaches for solving these challenges and saving lives in Lopit region include:
  • Major health interventions will work even in the poorest remote areas of Lopit by building healthcare and schools facilities across the region and train members of Lopit community to manage the system and providing universal healthcare access to all women and children.
  • Involvement of volunteers from around the world will play a significant role in lowering the mortality rate in the peaceful region of Lopit Mountain. Your involvement as a volunteer is very important to set a good example that will lead to success for locals to follow.
  • Introduction of programs in many forms, e.g, health awareness, workshops across the region and adequate funding from both international and local sources for improving women and children’s access to healthcare and education. 
  • Good management on the ground and effective use of information will decrease the risk of infection to slow down the spread and decreasing vulnerability to reduce risk and impact. Sustainable donor funding will save lives and money
  • Partnerships with Lopit community, NGOs, and private companies can be powerful.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you have experience working with medical teams in remote regions or developing countries, we would love your input, suggestions and stories in order to acquire a good foundation of knowledge.

story:
Letters to Boys is a healing journey.

Life, love and relationships mark us – sometimes indelibly. It is only through understanding those scars, through revisiting the pain and celebrating the beautiful lost moments that we are reborn and remade. If we can start to tell our stories, to use our voices, and to listen to each other, we can reconcile our masculine and feminine rifts to come to a new place of understanding and transcendence.

I’m Sarai Johnson, entrepreneur, #1 Amazon Best Selling author, speaker and regular old person with a bunch of sexual baggage. Just like almost everybody.

Why should you care about my specific baggage? Here are several reasons to consider:

1.  Everybody loves to play voyeur sometimes. Plus, maybe my baggage is worse than your baggage, and wouldn’t that make you feel better about yourself?

2.  My baggage includes a whole lot of religious detritus and that’s pretty darn interesting on a socio-political level.

3.  As a society, at large, we need to have an honest conversation about rape culture. I mean, a really honest one. Not one that’s like, “I’m a feminist and this is a definition of something here and your definition is wrong!” or like, “I’m a guy and I’m nice and so you should just be grateful for how nice I am!” or other crap like that. Let’s talk. For real.

Here’s my deal. On the verge of my 35th birthday, and just after achieving my 8th year of marriage, my life blew up. As a mother of two, a wife, an accomplished professional, a worship leader at my church, and now, an entrepreneur, I suddenly found myself the victim of a bizarre sexual assault. It happened while I was traveling for business, and it disrupted my whole world. It rattled my sense of self, challenged my concept of security and wholeness, and shook me to the core.

As I started to pick up the pieces, however, I realized that this event was so powerful and significant it had the potential to break up a shell I had unconsciously built around myself. It threatened (promised) to tear down the tower of external definitions of who I thought I was supposed to be, which I had created over years and years without really stopping to consider the choices I was making along the way.

The assault lanced a wound I didn’t know I was carrying with me. It revealed a crack in my foundation so deep, and so brittle, that I knew I had no choice but to go down to the studs of my life to rebuild. I knew that I could never move forward, to live as the person I know I am, to accomplish the big work I know I have to accomplish, unless I found strength in spite of what felt and looked like a major fault line.

This journey of mine back through time has been filled with tenderness, sadness, beauty, pain, and, mercifully for me (and now you) a good amount of hilarity.

All told, this story deserves to be told because it is messy, beautiful and meaningful. It touches on universal themes and experiences of love, loss, self-loathing, redemption and freedom. It’s a story of me, all the boys I’ve loved or tried to love, and, chances are, it’s a little bit about you too. It’s about our children. It’s about how we can create true connection and healing between masculine and feminine people to get to a better place of understanding and healing.

Sexual assault, rape, coercion, manipulation and abuse abound in our world, in our culture, between men and women and in many other relationships. We don’t deserve to be treated or to treat each other this way. So, let’s get our shit together and stop being jerks. This book is one small step toward getting there.

This book is a launch pad for a big conversation. I want to talk about sexual assault and how to NOT rape people all around the country. I want to engage this conversation so that women will be free to say “NO” and be heard, and so men will be free to hold space for themselves and their partners. So they will be confident to connect with women without fear or self-doubt. I don’t think this issue is an “us against them” kind of thing. It’s much bigger than that – and the only way to heal that gap is to come together and work toward understanding and love.

What I Need & What You Get

I’ve self-published before, and it was easy-peasy. I wrote a book, made sure there were no major typos, and published it on Kindle, lickety split. This book is different. It’s my soul on pages. It’s a great-big-huge important message. It needs to be not just good, but brilliant and amazing! Thus, I need a real, live editor. A designer. A bunch of paperbacks to distribute far and wide.

I’m looking to raise a cool $7500 with this campaign which will be used as follows:

$2700 for a genius book coach/editor who will help me whip this tome into shape

$3000 for printing and shipping real, live, physical books

$1000 for promotion and firestarting

$800 for copyediting and design

The Perks

Even though I know you’re altruistic, you still deserve a little cred for giving your energy and cold, hard cash to something like this. A couple of the cool things you can expect for providing various levels of support for this campaign include:

·  An advance copy of the e-book before the October publication date

·  An autographed copy of the paperback

·  An audio version of the book

Pretty exciting stuff, I know. Try to contain yourself.

If I don’t raise the entire goal, I’ll shut this campaign down and start all over again because I will not be stopped. Nay! I shall rise above a failed Indiegogo campaign and do another one until I have enough to publish this doggone book! Save the internet the pain of me nagging forever and ever, and just support it now. Is this blackmail? Coercion? I’m not sure, but I’m pretty determined and I won’t go away.

The Impact

This project is something that has the potential to shift beliefs and behaviors toward reconciliation and love between the masculine and feminine realms. It’s an opportunity for many people to seek healing through walking along with me through my journey, and perhaps, to be inspired to walk through their own with eyes and heart wide open. It’s a chance to start a conversation to bring understanding and light to a dark, dark place.

This is something I’m equipped to do because I have a long history of speaking up and saying what others won’t in a way that brings about change. Fun fact: my name means “argumentative and contentious” and I live up to it every single day. Ask my beleaguered friends and relatives, and they’ll vouch for me on that front with a sigh and a roll of the eyes.

In all seriousness, after spending years working in nonprofits, bringing about collaborative efforts for change and contributing to community progress on many fronts, I’m ready to do the same at the interpersonal level. I’m ready to address the challenges of sexual power dynamics, of religious oppression of women, and the confusion men often face when they are faced with allegations of sexual misconduct.

Risks & Challenges

This book has been fully drafted and is currently undergoing revision and perfecting. The biggest challenges I have in front of me today, right this minute, are my strong distaste for internet trolls and my unwillingness to use the new app Periscope.

To overcome these issues, I’ll grow a thicker skin and start collecting hilarious comebacks and or the serenity to not engage with trolls. As for Periscope, I’m still working to master Twitter, so, first things first.

Overall, my life is full of examples of overcoming obstacles to make the impossible happen. I’ll do it again and again. This is no different. Wait. This is different because I care about it so deeply and passionately that I can’t imagine a scenario in which it doesn’t happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, you can still make this awesomeness come alive! Tell all your friends – get fired up and shout it from the mountains! Use the Indiegogo tools to hook your friends up with details about this project if you think they’ll be interested (they will be! I assure you!).

Thank you for taking the time to check this project out! I hope you’ll get involved and help me make this dream a reality.

story:
Soy Éric Courthes, un investigador y traductor francés, bastante conocido en Paraguay por sus ensayos sobre la obra de Roa Bastos y la insularidad de este país, sus memorias apócrifas de Amado Bonpland, y sus traducciones de autores locales como Augusto Roa Bastos y Esteban Bedoya...

La ''novela''de Boggiani que les propongo serán otra vez memorias apócrifas sobre la juventud del personaje en Italia y su muerte extraña en el Chaco Boreal, así como traducciones de sus diarios de viaje por el Mediterráneo, Argentina y Paraguay, inéditos en español, hasta hoy... 

Aquel explorador era también un pintor famoso, fue además uno de los primeros etnofotógrafos, y uno de los precursores de Claude Lévi-Strauss...

Los fondos, de 2 000 euros, servirán para los gastos de impresión de 300 ejemplares de unas 400 páginas y su envío a domicilio, por si fuera necesario...

Ya hice lo mismo en 2010 con mis memorias apócrifas de Amado Bonpland: ''Memorias de un muerto, el viaje sin retorno de Amado Bonpland'', publicadas por Servilibro: http://www.servilibro.com.py/libreria/productos/memorias-de-un-muerto-el-viaje-sin-retorno-de-amado-bonpland
De no poder contribuir directo, gracias por difundir esta campaña por las redes sociales, a fin de que amigos suyos interesados puedan aportar mediante indiegogo u otros medios apropiados...

 Para que me conozcan mejor, conéctense a mi nueva página de dominio, aún en obras, a mi página de escritor en facebook, en las de Guido Boggiani y Amado Bonpland, creadas por mí, y por fin en la mía personal:
http://ériccourthès.com/galeria.html
https://www.facebook.com/pages/%C3%89ric-Courth%C3%A8s/133819223383673?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/pages/Amado-Bonpland/108712895889127?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/eric.courthes

story_txt:
Soy Éric Courthes, un investigador y traductor francés, bastante conocido en Paraguay por sus ensayos sobre la obra de Roa Bastos y la insularidad de este país, sus memorias apócrifas de Amado Bonpland, y sus traducciones de autores locales como Augusto Roa Bastos y Esteban Bedoya...
La ''novela''de Boggiani que les propongo serán otra vez memorias apócrifas sobre la juventud del personaje en Italia y su muerte extraña en el Chaco Boreal, así como traducciones de sus diarios de viaje por el Mediterráneo, Argentina y Paraguay, inéditos en español, hasta hoy... Aquel explorador era también un pintor famoso, fue además uno de los primeros etnofotógrafos, y uno de los precursores de Claude Lévi-Strauss...Los fondos, de 2 000 euros, servirán para los gastos de impresión de 300 ejemplares de unas 400 páginas y su envío a domicilio, por si fuera necesario...Ya hice lo mismo en 2010 con mis memorias apócrifas de Amado Bonpland: ''Memorias de un muerto, el viaje sin retorno de Amado Bonpland'', publicadas por Servilibro: http://www.servilibro.com.py/libreria/productos/memorias-de-un-muerto-el-viaje-sin-retorno-de-amado-bonplandDe no poder contribuir directo, gracias por difundir esta campaña por las redes sociales, a fin de que amigos suyos interesados puedan aportar mediante indiegogo u otros medios apropiados... Para que me conozcan mejor, conéctense a mi nueva página de dominio, aún en obras, a mi página de escritor en facebook, en las de Guido Boggiani y Amado Bonpland, creadas por mí, y por fin en la mía personal:http://ériccourthès.com/galeria.htmlhttps://www.facebook.com/pages/%C3%89ric-Courth%C3%A8s/133819223383673?fref=tshttps://www.facebook.com/pages/Amado-Bonpland/108712895889127?fref=tshttps://www.facebook.com/eric.courthesMuchísimas gracias anticipadas a todos y a todas...Éric Courthès: '' El cazador de exploradores''

story:
Short Summary

Hello Generous World!

My name is Victoria Pope and I am a self-published author living in Montreal, QC. I have released two books so far, with a third book on the way in the Action-Erotica genre. Now...

At this point you're probably wondering why on Earth I have started a crowd-funding campaign, and why I would need it. So I'm about to tear off the scab and show you just how vulnerable a lowly self-publishing author's life can get.

There are of course dozens of success stories of  men and women who are able to spew out hundreds of books and have the privilege of making a living off it. Never mind the fodder readily available for every hormonal tween and sexually-deprived person on the planet, there are literally thousands of authors from every genre, background and education level that are able to achieve what millions of us are so desperate to do. To make it. 

Ever since I was a kid I wanted to be a movie director. My mother spent thousands of her hard-earned cash to put me through film school, but I, like so many others in my position, was unable to find an in into the industry, and the rent was due. I ended up working as an office drone for the preceding seven years, always returning home with a yearning to just tell stories. It wasn't until two years ago that I gave it a real shot and just started writing. Not scripts or screenplays, but an actual novel. I stuck with the genres that I love most, for I truly wanted to write something that I personally would not be able to put down. And for those of you that know me personally, you'll know that there are two genres that get my heart pumping with wild fervor.  Sex. and Action.

So I wrote and I wrote, and it didn't matter that I had no idea how to obtain a publishing contract, or even a literary agent, I just wrote for the hell of it, and when I typed the last period of my first novel I sat back and smiled, completely proud of myself. I did my research and decided to go the self-publishing route, even designed my first cover, and two months later, my imagination was officially for sale on Amazon and Barnes & Noble. I was so excited, absolutely convinced that I would be able to do this full-time by the end of the year.

But you can guess what happened next right?

With little time and no money for marketing or campaigning, my book did not sell the thousands of copies my naivete envisioned. But I still pressed on and wrote another, this time having it edited by a real copy-editor and the cover designed by a professional. Still, the sales have tanked.

The most frustrating part is...this is my dream, what I want to do. I want to tell stories. I don't want to be a waitress or a data entry clerk. I want to entertain YOU!

I am asking the world to give me TWO MONTHS of stress and debt-free time to finish my fourth book and campaign the ever-loving crap out of myself and my books so we can see another young soul achieve their goals.


What We Need & What You Get

The $4000 CAD I am asking for is very simply, to cover my expenses for two months. This includes my rent, phone and internet bills, as well as food. This will be able to let me write every day as my actual job. Can you imagine?

For every person that donates, I am willing to give a free copy of my books, whichever ones they choose!

If I do not make my goal, it will at least help me pay off some of the debt I have racked up to pay for the editor and book cover designer. It will also help finance the next few projects I have lined up (they will just take much longer.)

The Impact

To be honest, two months of writing every day could be THE difference it would take to set me on my way for the REST OF MY LIFE. You never know what you can achieve if you're able to focus on your dreams and forget about the stressful distractions that come with every day life like finding menial jobs you hate that barely pay rent, or the sheer sadness of not being able to do what it is you wake up for.

I am relying on the kindness of strangers to help me live my dreams. Some people need years and years of schooling, some are born into greatness, and others, like myself, just need that lucky break.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk I face is that the two months will provide nothing for me. The reason I chose two months is because I do not want to ask too much of people, especially on such a gamble. But I believe that everyone is put on this earth to contribute to it in some way or another, and I want to make people feel, to have their heart racing. I want to entertain, and I want to do it well.

No matter what happens, I will not stop writing. It may just have to be a hobby. You can count on me to never stop typing!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monitarily, there are other great ways you can help me out. You can buy one of my books, rate them on Amazon or Goodreads or follow me on Facebook and Twitter. Every little bit helps!

story:
Julie Presley's newest release, Nor Forsake

I'm so thankful you're here and ready to partner with me for my second book. While I've been working towards publishing Nor Forsake for the last two years, this book has been in my heart for much longer than that and I am so excited to finally launch it into the world where it belongs.

Nor Forsake is a story of the Lord's promises and redemption, healing in the midst of pain and chaos, and the surprises that He brings when we're least expecting them. This is not just a romance, but also a love story between God and His children. I can't wait for you to read it.

What We Need & What You Get

Self-publishing is a huge venture yet I continue to believe it is the best avenue for me to pursue at this time. Your help means the world to me.
Costs include:
  • Basic self publishing fees (e-book, print books, member fees, etc.)
  • Editing, proofing, design work
  • Marketing and promotions
  • Indiegogo fees
We've made some space in the budget this time around to include some things that we didn't previously, mainly in the marketing department, as mentioned in the video. That was the biggest lesson I learned while watching Stones of Remembrance come to life. Marketing is key!
Check out the side bar to the right to see the perks available to you for giving! 

The Impact

I'm continuing on in my goal to reach women with a message of healing and freedom. The feedback on those topics from Stones of Remembrance was overwhelming and I've found that this is an amazing avenue to bring an understanding of what God wants for our lives in an unconventional way, through fiction.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am so thankful that you're here at all and if you are unable to give at this time the best way you can help me is by sharing this campaign on your social media feeds. Thank you so much for your support, I could not do any of this without you!

Also, going over and above our monetary goal is NOT a bad thing! There are always hidden costs and circumstances that arise and any extra funds raised will be allotted for those things and for future projects because, let's be honest, I have more than a few!

How to Stay Connected

Keep checking back here because as we reach certain points along the way, I'll be celebrating with excerpts, the cover reveal and other fun surprises!
Other ways to stay in the loop:
www.juliepresley.com
www.facebook.com/authorjuliepresley
www.twitter.com/jpresley48

story:
Over a month ago, I made a huge mistake. I decided to go with Kickstarter for my virginal first venture into the wide-world of crowdfunding. My initial goal was 3,300 and I managed to raise almost 2,500 dollars within a 33-day time frame. 75% was covered, but yet, I didn't get any of it to help with the welfare of my book, which I obviously was aware of beforehand. Hence, that is why I'm here now. Wow, would you look at all those numbers above! So yeah, some friends of mine asked what I'd do next since I didn't 'make it', and for a while, I was working under the notion that I wouldn't do anything at all. I figured that I'd just put my head down, and continue the project on my own, with no help whatsoever. That is, until I read that you can have flexible funding through this site! Man, it was a blunder to go with the McDonald's of crowdfunding in the first place. I should've known better.

But anyway, if you're a stranger off the digital sidewalk, and you're wondering just what this novel is about specifically, I will clue you in now. NO NET is a story that is relative to the times we live in today, it chronicles the many differing types of people that we all come across, and it shows how little or how much losing the Internet could alter certain individuals. It consists of 20 APP's, which are akin to chapters, but a little longer, and they are all, whether it be in a minor or major fashion, connected to each other as a overarching narrative...

With all that being typed, I have cut the overall amount needed previously in half because many things have changed. I no longer have my heart set on a supposed "professional" doing my audio book. I have assigned my friend to do it, who is very good, and I will be assisting in that field as well! So now, the goal is 1,500 total and the great thing is that even if I don't 'make it' this time around, I'll still receive whatever amount that's gathered at the end, which is vital as I need to pay a few people for their work on this ambitious project. The focus is entirely on paying the artists for the front and back cover as well as the twenty sketches that will be inside to coincide with the APP's of the book. The goal is to make a lasting, quality product for the physical form enthusiasts! Quite a rare thing these days, I know. For all the 42 backers fresh off the boat of KS, please consider jumping onto this new ship with me. I would TRULY appreciate it. And for any possible newcomers, please consider getting acquainted with this novel that I've busted my ass on for the past five months. I will post the first two APP's for you to read and hopefully, you'll enjoy them both and help out in any way that you can! 
Thank you, anyone and everyone!
NAN.

story:
Hey Indiegogo-ers!

Thanks for coming over and checking out our campaign!  We’re so excited to bring this e-Book to the world, and with your contributions, we’ll be able to do it faster and better than we could on our own.

Kitchen Common Sense is an all-inclusive guide that cuts down all the magic of professional cooking technique that can make cooking for yourself seem complicated and time-consuming. 

Who Are We?

I’m Justin!  I have been a professional cook for over 7 years now.  I’ve worked in numerous kitchens all across Los Angeles, gathering technique, tips, and pointers from some of LA’s best chefs from places like Fleming’s Steakhouse, Tender Greens,  Picca, and Nobu. 

And I’m Liz!  I’m a NYU graduate-turned-restaurant supervisor who has been unknowingly struggling in the kitchen for years.  That was until I met Justin during our years working at Nobu Los Angeles together. 

Why Did We Write KCS?

For years, we’ve watched so many of our friends and family begin to take on “healthier” lifestyles.  Nowadays, the mindset in LA is revolving around everything Organic and All-Natural, and if you’re not in some sort of group fitness class, then you might as well be chowing down on Mickey D’s every night.  But living healthfully can be expensive and tedious, especially when you don’t know your way around the kitchen.  Buying meals from places that tout fresh and delicious foods for every meal can really put a dent in your wallet.

Everyone around us seemed to want to cook for themselves, but claimed they didn’t know how or didn’t have the time to do it.  After a few years of working doubles and overtime, while having others ask for tips to help make cooking at home easier, we finally came up with an answer.  That answer is Kitchen Common Sense.

What’s in the e-Book?

This first book (which we’re hoping to make a series) includes the all-around basics: the most frequent questions answered and the most common foods explained.

This interactive experience will include pictures and diagrams (with videos available in the coming months) to ensure every reader grasps each and every concept discussed in Kitchen Common Sense.

The Perks:

We are offering awesome perks for donating your hard-earned money to Kitchen Common Sense, including:

-  Our Gratitude Displayed on our Site and in the Book

-  Your Own Copy of the Kitchen Common Sense e-Book

-  The Ultimate Kitchen Common Sense Experience with Justin in your home

Your contribution will go towards our book cover design, professional editing, photography and e-book formatting, and all the little tidbits that will surely make our book and website launch successfully.

Know this will not be easy.  We’re devoting our full attention to this passion project.  We want to bring Kitchen Common Sense to life, not just for us, but also for each person who struggles to get through the day-to-day grind to stay healthy and positive. 

Cooking well is just the start.  You, too, can bring the world a little closer to feeling at home in their chef’s hats.   

Don't have the funds, but still want to contribute?  Spread the word about Kitchen Common Sense any way you can.  Share our story on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter...Tell your friends...Tell your mom...Tell your cat!  We want KCS to reach as many eyes as possible!

Thanks for all your support!

story:
Luego de 14 años de adicción al juego empecé a buscar las razones de mis problemas, lo que me llevo a comprender que en el control de las emociones es la clave para el éxito. Queremos hacer realidad el sueño de que este libro que fue creado en digital pueda ser impreso en  grandes cantidades con el fin de poder regalarlo a muchas personas que lo necesiten y no puedan obtenerlo. Así mismo, queremos que el libro llegue a los hogares de todas aquellas personas que pueden tener el libro en físico, sin embargo, no pueden obtenerlo de manera digital a falta de una tarjeta de crédito para su compra o un dispositivo electrónico. Educar las emociones es parte esencial del ser humano para llevar una vida más tranquila, libre de ataduras. Liberate de tus emociones y ayuda a que muchas personas también puedan hacerlo. Desahógate Despierta Ya.

            

          

After 14 years of gambling addiction I started to look into the reasons of my problems which helped me understanding that controlling our emotions is the key for success. This campaign is looking to make real the dream of printing this book out in big quantities in order to be able to give it to as many people as possible. People who may need it but couldn't afford it. At the same time, we are looking to print this book for the people who couldn't obtain it in a digital way, either because they don't have a credit card to pay for it or because they don't have an electronic device. To educate our emotions is an essential part of the human being to have a better and happier life. Start to be free controlling your emotions and help others the be free controlling theirs. Vent it Out, Wake Up!.

At the same time, we are looking to print this book for the people who couldn't obtain it in a digital way, either because they don't have a credit card to pay for it or because they don't have an electronic device. To educate our emotions is an essential part of the human being to have a better and happier life. Start to be free controlling your emotions and help others the be free controlling theirs. Vent it Out, Wake Up!.

Did you miss the opportunity to support this campaign? There's still time! CLICK HERE!


While giving a speech at her high school graduation, Faith, the class valedictorian, shares her childhood dreams and the lessons that served as the foundation for her courage. 

Age range: 2+

Book Excerpt

"At the tender age of two mama said, 'Baby, with God there's nothing you can't do.' And I believed her..." ~ Faith

Be sure to pre-order your copy of I Know I Can!, beginning at the $15 level, so you can see how these few empowering words motivated a little girl to dream BIG!

Faith Dreams Of Conversing With Historical Greats: 

Fannie Lou Hamer, Annie Easley, Mahalia Jackson, Stokely Carmichael, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., and a few other awesome people who will only be revealed to backers!

She Also Dreams Of Foreign Travel: Spain, France, South Africa, Mexico


My goal is based on the following expenses:

  • Cost to Complete the Book Illustrations
  • Book Editing and Publishing Expenses
  • LCCN - Needed For Library Purchases
  • Processing Fees
  • Rewards Fulfillment

What happens if we don’t reach the goal?

If we don't reach the goal, we will use the funds raised to complete the illustrations and raise the balance of the funds offline so we can meet our delivery date of this November. – But let’s not focus on that! We need little girls to start feeling Faith’s influence ASAP! – Please be sure to share this page with everyone you know!

I am publishing this book because I believe that if we begin to empower little girls at an early age, they will be better equipped to set their own standards and think critically; and they will grow up KNOWING they are capable of greatness!

A couple of the illustrations for I Know I Can! are complete; the one above of Faith visiting The Louvre Museum in Paris, and the one below of Faith interviewing Fannie Lou Hamer.

This campaign will fund the remaining illustrations so we can see what else awaits this adventurous little girl! We'll be sure to share the illustrations with our backers as they are completed!

Daveia Odoi is a naturally gifted illustrator and graphic artist who has been drawing for as long as she can remember. She is the owner of DNT Dynamite Design, LLC, a well-respected graphic design and illustration service company based in Franklin Park, New Jersey.

Daveia illuminates the world with the brilliant smiles in her illustrations and on the stationery and gifts she offers via The DynaSmiles by DNT.

story:
Short Summary

I just need enough money for 100 cups of coffee.

Tall Order

What started out as a joke based on a Futurama episode, combined with my love for a good cup of coffee while watching Twin Peaks has turned into much more than that.

I want to write about, review and study coffee. I'm not an expert and I've never worked in a coffee shop, but I do love coffee. I want to know more about it. I want you to know more about it too, so go on this journey with me? We'll start from the ground up.

Grande Goals

What else do I hope to achieve?

  • What goes better with coffee than donuts? Or Pie? Or both? Ideally, I'd like to document those tasty things along the way as well. There's a lot more to coffee culture than just the beans.
  • While I want to learn about the various locales that the beans come from and how they end up in your cup, I will focus on local happenings for the time being - I live in Chicago and I drink coffee in Chicago.
  • Coffee is more than just a pick-me-up or a thing you drink while you stare at your Macbook, it's used in cooking, brewing and so much more. Let's talk about these things.
  • I won't just write, I'll take pictures too. I might even photoshop them to make them even prettier. Or I'll just draw things in Paint. Photoshop ain't cheap.

(Some pun involving Venti size drinks)

The risks involved:

  • Overcaffeination. Is that a word? I don't know.
  • That's about it. I'm just looking for a little help getting a cup of coffee!

Additional Bullet Points

What else is there to say?

  • Special Agent Dale Cooper is my hero.
  • I like my coffee black. You?

Cheers, friends.

story:
We are GenZ!

Our main goal is to give members of Generation Z, millennials, students, new writers, and innovators experience for the real world, with writing, and on their résumés.

  • GenZ™  is an innovative publishing platform for the new generation to have their work seen, recognized, and published and read by millions.
  • GenZ™ Publishing was created by bestselling Generation Z author, Morissa Schwartz, who recognizes the need for younger voices in literature and sees how few are actually getting books published.

  • When a young person is published on GenZ™ , they can use that experience in their portfolios, for résumés, to share with friends, family, and fans, and as an accomplishment to be proud of for the rest of their lives.

  • It can be nearly impossible for writers with promising talent to produce standout work that will be recognized, and we provide them the opportunity to be seen in the publishing and print world. 
  • Members of Generation Z and millennials are full of innovative ideas that deserve to be shared with a large audience. GenZ™  provides a medium where these young people can be positively recognized for their work through a professional product and supportive company.

What We Need & What You Get

We are launching our catalog and global marketing initiative and would appreciate your support:

    • Service like this is unheard of in publishing. In most mediums, publishing and promotion steps are forced onto a writer who has little experience. This explains why 95% of books fail at reaching a large audience. We will use our funds to be sure that our authors are successful as possible.

      • We perform every step of publishing for our authors while teaching them about the process of publishing a book.
    • We have a website at GenZPublishing.com and plan to make it as innovative and user-friendly as possible. This is where authors will submit manuscripts, where book buyers can peruse our catalog, and where both writers and readers can interact.
    • To create the highest quality books, we are hiring talented young editors to work on the books alongside authors, the new generation of artists create dazzling book covers, and those up and coming in the business industry will be part of our global marketing campaign. In this way, we are supporting young professionals of multiple industries. 
    • Legal fees including contracts to protect authors and ISBN registration are examples of technical fees that this young company requires, in addition to the cost of printing books, website maintenance, and marketing.
    • Your contribution will aid in the publishing of young people, and you will forever be a part of GenZ. See our perks section for the details of our special 'thank yous' to you.

What Makes Us Different

There is self-publishing, which can be difficult to produce and get noticed. Self-publishing requires resources and experience that most young people do not have the money, access, or experience to secure. Self-publishing also has an ugly stigma attached to it by many that may not provide the best example of a talented writer’s work value.

Then, there is the traditional publisher route, but it is nearly impossible to be published without being established and having an agent. Even with that, publishers receive thousands of manuscripts per week and only dozens are published. Those who are lucky enough to be published, lack creative control and are subject to the publishers’ every vision.

We are not a self-publisher or traditional publisher. We will help you shape your work while you retain creative control. When it is published, it will be available electronically and in print, perfect for sharing with readers and fans. It is also a great way to show samples to future employers. How many young people can actually say they were published and have the professional book to prove it? We provide you with that chance and give you the exposure that you need to be successful at life and shape the future.

Risks & Challenges

We are young and still proving ourselves to the world. We are very determined to overcome any hurdles and are prepared for challenges.

  • We are young, so while we are highly intelligent and driven, we lack the decade long connections that some may have in traditional publishing. However, we are determined to use our many resources to prove ourselves.

About GenZ Founder, 'The Voice of Generation Z,' Morissa Schwartz

As The Voice of Generation Z, Morissa advocates for the new generation through hosting the GenZ Podcast, her writing, and her publishing company: GenZ Publishing. 

A literary prodigy, Morissa’s first national article was published in Discovery Girls Magazine at age 12, landed her first job as an adviser to Junior Scholastic Magazine at age 13, had her first book published at age 17, earned the position of top-rated editor on Fiverr by the time she graduated high school, gained dozens of writing and editing credits through college,  and won the prestigious Chapman Award in poetry twice by the time she graduated from Drew University.  Her creative non-fiction book, Notes Never Sent, was published by VIP Ink Publishing. It was ranked in Amazon’s Top 200 Books in the school-age children category.

Morissa began GenZ Publishing after many peers asked her how to publish a book following her success in the industry. She recognized the need for a publisher that focuses on releasing the works of young and innovative writers. This is how GenZ Publishing was conceived. Learn more about Morissa and her work at MorissaSchwartz.com.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out about us!
  • You can follow us on Twitter @GenZPub or like our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/GenZPublishing.
  • Visit our website GenZPublishing.com

story:
When life gives you Don Lemons, turn off the TV and report the Presidential race yourself.

In all likelihood, the 2016 US Presidential Election will be the most heavily covered, overly analyzed election in the country's history. As I type this, the major media networks are hiring small armies of campaign reporters to follow the candidates around from stump speech to stump speech, scrutinizing their every movement and mining their statements for some slip of the tongue that can be turned into ratings gold. Memories only tend to stretch as far as the last news cycle and, with the exception of a handful of outlets, reasoned critique and sustained narrative are all but extinct. 

Like many Americans, I have grown tired of ingesting a brand of campaign coverage that shuffles off important policy discussion and public inquiry for a seemingly endless stream of idiotic commentary and surface-level reporting. However, unlike most Americans, I have been running a progressively-oriented news site, Virally Suppressed, for the past three and a half years and have created an Indiegogo campaign in the hopes that I might add something worthwhile to the swirling maelstrom of crap coverage that we are inundated with, day in and day out.

It is my hope that, in the coming weeks and months, I will be able provide my readers with presidential campaign coverage that focuses on the struggles and desires of the American people, rather than regurgitating the canned statements of the candidates who purport to represent them. It is my firm belief that 50 words from somebody's neighbor are usually better than 5,000 words from the politician that represents them and my reporting on the 2016 presidential campaign will cover the voters themselves in equal measure with the candidates. 

I don't want to waste your time or mine by highlighting every absurd, xenophobic comment uttered by a Donald Trump or a Mike Huckabee. However, I do want to talk to the supporters of those candidates to try and find out what it is in those comments that resonates with them. At the same time, I have no desire to stoke the already roaring fires of discontent between the supporters of Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton with inflammatory invective or lopsided coverage of one side over the other, instead preferring to look at both the similarities and the differences of their policy positions and attempting to find the source of the passion and antagonism in both camps.

Now, this doesn't mean I plan to be "objective" in my reporting. As far as I'm concerned, objectivity is a delusional fever dream cooked up by journalism professors and newspaper editorial boards to blot out the stone cold fact that our personal biases and opinions impact everything that we write. But, while I am not going to be objective in my coverage of the 2016 presidential race, I will do my best to be honest and maybe, if the subject warrants it, unmerciful as well. 

That's All Well & Good, But What Is My Money Going To?

Well, due to the layout of the first handful of primary contests and my own home base in Cincinnati, Ohio, the vast majority of the money you'll be giving me will be going towards travel expenses--with gas being first and foremost among them. 3 of the initial 4 primary contests are in Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina, all of which are only a day's drive away for me (Nevada, whose caucuses are the 4th in that initial grouping, is currently a little outside my pay grade). As such, a hypothetical outline of what your funding would go to support would look something like:

  • $800 towards gasoline, which at an average cost of $2.50/gal in my Corolla that gets about 29 mpg, projects out to a little over 9,000 miles of driving. That would provide me with enough gas to go to Iowa twice, New Hampshire and South Carolina and Wisconsin once, with about 2,000 miles leftover to go to at least one more state. Of course, since I'll be trying to make the most out of that mileage, I'll be trying to spend a good deal of time in each state, which means I need...
  • $550 for lodging. While I will try to save resources by staying with friends or couch surfing, that isn't always possible--especially in rural Iowa. Your average Motel 6 room costs about $55 a pop, so this will get me about 10 nights-worth of Tom Bodett leaving the light on for me. This just leaves...
  • $150 for miscellaneous costs, like entrance to certain campaign events since I am not a member of "press" and will need to pay for access.

Cool, but do I get anything out of it?

Besides enabling me to provide you with campaign coverage you won't find anywhere else, you can also get a number of pretty great perks, like:

  • Completely inedible bubble gum cigars from past presidential campaigns.
  • Trading cards from the 1992 presidential election (yes, someone made trading cards with Dick Cheney's face on them)
  • Political buttons from the presidential campaigns of George McGovern, Richard Nixon and Ted Kennedy.
  • The ability to pitch a story idea about any presidential candidate or campaign issue you are passionate about.

Risks & Challenges

The primary risks surrounding this project have everything to do with money and time. As of November 1st, I will have left my 9-to-5 job to pursue my dream of covering the 2016 presidential campaign and how far I'm able to go--and how much I am able to write--will be greatly influenced by how much money I am able to raise here.

All of the funding numbers listed above are just rough estimates, but the simple fact of the matter is that, like the candidates themselves, I can't do my job if I don't have the funds to sustain it. And, since I don't have a Super PAC, I'm coming to you for support.

Want To Know More?

If you feel like you don't know enough to contribute yet, I encourage you to read two pieces that encapsulate the sort of writing you can expect from this project. The first article, Of Caucasians & Caucuses: My Short, Strange Trip To See Ted Cruz In Iowa, is a good example of what my reporting on the presidential candidates will look like, while the second article, The Family Afterward: West Virginia Four Months After The Freedom Industries Chemical Spill, shows how I will approach telling the stories of folks I meet along the campaign trail.
If you can't find the money to donate right now, please take the time to share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and whatever other social media outlets you can. Every little bit helps.
--------------
Photo Credits for Images used above: Cheryl Senter/The New York Times & Sharon Steinmann/AL.com via AP

story:
Gordon Jay Alexander

65 year old retired guy believes one is never too old to make fun of politicians, pundits and corporate pikers.

Want to start my new career as a stand-up comedian but fearing there isn't enough time to start at the bottom, I have an audition for America's Got Talent (AGT) on Nov. 14, 2015 in NYC.

I'm writing a book about my journey; What? I need talent?

AGT is the windmill this Don Quixote is putting on his suit of armor for.

The book will be in the vein of my previous writings;  stories found at www.sowpub.com and those showing my general incompetence over the years. Read The World's Greatest Go-Kart or The Cuckoo Clock at Seeds Of Wisdom Publishing, a 15 year old business forum.

My campaign is basically for two things, first, a GoPro video camera to create a complimentary video, a mockumentary perhaps, of how the talentless people think they can win a million dollars. 

And to prevent me from having to walk to NYC and stay under a bridge, so there's that too, transportation and accommodations.

But see, I'm already picking out a new car, so when I DO win AGT next year, I'll have it ready to go. Somewhere between my delusion and reality, there is a little kid inside full of trust and hope...

which begs the questions; Am I naive or am I just stupid?

It is a quest.  To find the truth, to finally know...naive or stoopid?

So, there you go.  Your assistance will allow me to make a movie of this adventure, while I'm writing the book. I have the cover done, now I just need to find some words to put into it.

You will play a part in the unleashing of this pent up funniness which has accumulated these last 63 years (2 of those I was NOT funny at all).

You will get the book, albeit the risk might be twofold:

1) It could be very short.

2) It may not tickle your funny bone.  OH Well, I will have tried.

NOW a new wrinkle has appeared.

Turns out my daughter has also applied to audition for AGT, get this, as a stand-up comedian too.  The nerve of that kid.

But, I say bring it on, dad vs. daughter, baby boomer vs. millennial, youth vs. wisdom (HA).
Gordon Jay Alexander
story_txt:
Gordon Jay Alexander
 65 year old retired guy believes one is never too old to make fun of politicians, pundits and corporate pikers.
Want to start my new career as a stand-up comedian but fearing there isn't enough time to start at the bottom, I have an audition for America's Got Talent (AGT) on Nov. 14, 2015 in NYC.
I'm writing a book about my journey; What? I need talent?
AGT is the windmill this Don Quixote is putting on his suit of armor for. 
The book will be in the vein of my previous writings;  stories found at www.sowpub.com and those showing my general incompetence over the years. Read The World's Greatest Go-Kart or The Cuckoo Clock at Seeds Of Wisdom Publishing, a 15 year old business forum. 
My campaign is basically for two things, first, a GoPro video camera to create a complimentary video, a mockumentary perhaps, of how the talentless people think they can win a million dollars.  
And to prevent me from having to walk to NYC and stay under a bridge, so there's that too, transportation and accommodations. 
But see, I'm already picking out a new car, so when I DO win AGT next year, I'll have it ready to go. Somewhere between my delusion and reality, there is a little kid inside full of trust and hope...
which begs the questions; Am I naive or am I just stupid?
It is a quest.  To find the truth, to finally know...naive or stoopid? 
So, there you go.  Your assistance will allow me to make a movie of this adventure, while I'm writing the book. I have the cover done, now I just need to find some words to put into it. 
You will play a part in the unleashing of this pent up funniness which has accumulated these last 63 years (2 of those I was NOT funny at all). 
You will get the book, albeit the risk might be twofold:
1) It could be very short.
2) It may not tickle your funny bone.  OH Well, I will have tried. 
NOW a new wrinkle has appeared.Turns out my daughter has also applied to audition for AGT, get this, as a stand-up comedian too.  The nerve of that kid. But, I say bring it on, dad vs. daughter, baby boomer vs. millennial, youth vs. wisdom (HA). 
Gordon Jay Alexander

story:
My name is Emma and 3 months ago I suffered a stillbirth and lost my beautiful daughter Ella Rose. Since this deeply upsetting experience I have raised money for the fantastic facilities made available for us at the hospital. I have also embarked on a career in midwifery to help others going through what I have.

The Project

Over the past month I have been thinking about my experience and how I could explain to any future children that they had a big sister who we loved but tragically lost. It is so important to me that Ella Rose is remembered and plays a big part in our future children's lives.

I realised to explain this to a young child could cause confusion - and even fear - so I came across the idea of creating a children's book which would gently explain the loss of an expected child and sibling. The book would approach the subject with sensitivity, with words and a narrative a young child would understand. Initially this was going to be a personal project for myself until a friend pointed out that my feelings would be felt by many others also.  I then decided to produce the book to share with the public. I hope this book will support other parents who want to explain to their children the painful loss of a family member through a stillbirth.

There will be two versions of the story, one for a brother and one for a sister with the option to add the sleeping child's name into the narrative.

The book itself will ease a great anxiety for parents and will be a very sensitive and caring way to introduce their child to their sleeping sibling. The illustrated book will be something the child will enjoy picking up and reading and, as they get older, will encourage natural conversations about their sibling.

The story has been written and Claire Williams,  an amazing illustrator and past journalist is on board, all we need now is the funds to produce the book.

Proceeds from the book:

The majority of the funds made from the book will be given to Stillbirth Charities with one being The Willow Room at Princess Royal Hospital.

Contributions

No contribution is too small and if you cant contribute just sharing this across social media will help our project succeed.

Primordial Soup 1:

Primordial Soup 2:

_____________

If you believe...

  • that it takes a village to raise a child
  • in indie companies with strong missions
  • that true diversity matters
  • in platforms for & about voices that have traditionally been under- or misrepresented
  • that our kids should be part of global conversations so we can raise responsible citizens
  • in bringing back important voices from the past
  • in raising up all voices so that we can rise up together

Then consider contributing! Our mission is to publish children's literature that reflects the diverse realities of the world we live in, both at home and abroad. This means seeking out books by & about people & subjects that speak to a broad range of human experience, raising up each other's voices so that we can rise up together.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $25,000 will create opportunities for authors to travel for workshops, panels & readings for their books.
  • $50,000 will give us the resources to acquire important books from the States and around the world and aid in advertising efforts that are paramount to the life of a book. It will also help us to establish partnerships with organizations doing good work: our goal is to donate portions of proceeds of at least one book a year to a different partner organization.
  • $75,000 will allow us to hire a part-time publicist who understands our mission and helps us achieve it. We are two people, and we don't have all the resources we need to make sure Penny Candy Books is a true force for change in the world. 

Current & Future Books

Our first three books & their authors & illustrators need your help to find the audiences they deserve:

A Gift from Greensboro is at once an elegy, a celebration of the magic of childhood friendship and adventure, and a meditation on growing up in the wake of the sit-ins that ushered in the Civil Rights Movement. Paired with intricate, brimming-with-life illustrations, this poem recognizes that true friendship knows no boundaries, and this is the true gift from Greensboro. 

The Not In Here Story. In this heartwarming adoption story, the Seeks set out to start a family but soon discover it's not going to be easy. So they embark on a journey that takes them through the desert, mountains, and jungle only to find that they didn’t have to travel so far and so wide to find a child to love after all.  

 

 

Part girl-power, part cautionary tale, The Hunt, by Margaux Othats, is a wordless picture book that chronicles a young girl who builds and rebuilds a rock sculpture as two hunters repeatedly shoot her creation to bits. As the girl perseveres, what she creates becomes a testament to the creative spirit and a condemnation of violence. 

Upcoming Titles

Your contribution will help us usher our new titles into the world. We are working on publishing books from Australia, France, Japan, Palestine, and the US about subjects ranging from understanding death to girl power to human connectedness. We're developing a truly exciting family of authors & illustrators with diverse backgrounds and important stories to tell. 

Our Imprint: Penelope Editions. Books with guts, vision, & humor.

Under our imprint, Penelope Editions, we'll be publishing a coloring book (for kids or adults) called NUVEAU: The Future of Patterns by Tiffany McKnight in December. Every year, we aim to partner with an organization doing good in the world and share profits. This year our organization is called SixTwelve, located in Oklahoma City. Check them out! 

 

Even if you can't contribute, you can help spread the word:

  • Make some noise about our campaign via social media.
  • Use  Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Purchase our books at http://www.pennycandybooks.com/our-books1/ or from our distributor, Itasca Books, or from your favorite retailer.
  • Ask your favorite bookstore to carry our books.
  • Visit We Need Diverse Books, familiarize yourself with its mission, and consider donating to this organization that inspired us to start a press.

story:
What is Provo Poetry?

We are a group of local poets committed to promoting and instilling the love of poetry within the general Utah County community. Our objectives are to bring poems to a wider audience, support local poets, and promote poetry in general.

We believe poetry is important. Poetry helps us interpret our world and provides a form of expression unlike any other literary form. Poetry allows us to come closer to people and experiences for which we would otherwise have no access. Events, generations, wars, and entire societies are documented in poetry. People share poems to comfort friends, confess true love, for artistic and emotional release, and as a tool for activism.

Provo Poetry was founded in January 2016 by local poets Trish Hopkinson and Marianne Hales Harding.

What will Provo Poetry do?

Provo Poetry will distribute poems written by local poets in creative and interesting ways. Up first—a POEMBALL machine! Put in a quarter, receive a short poem written by a local poet. The first machine already has a home at Enliten Bakery and Café and will be up and running this Spring. Future plans include poems placed on everyday items such as coasters and cup holders, chalk art poetry, and other forms of guerilla poetry. 

Provo’s poetry scene is growing and needs additional promotion and encouragement. We will work with Utah arts organizations, local businesses and poets to help get the word out and encourage a strong poetry community in Utah County. All administration time and editorial responsibilities will be donated and managed by local poet volunteers. Funds raised will be used directly for printing costs and other poetry materials.

story:
On behalf of the Libertarian Party of Canada, I am running in the upcoming federal election. My platform stems from the cornerstones of Libertarianism, e.g., Freedom, Peace, and Respect of Property rights. This translates to a political strategy of 

-Lowering taxes. Raising the personal  tax exemption by ~6 000$ to 17, 300$, and given additional tax exemptions of 4 000$ to families (per child), students and citizens with disabilities. 

-Decentralizing power

-Expanding economic freedom

-End all corporate bail-outs

-Ceasing all interventionist warfare. The Libertarian Party of Canada strongly opposes the aggressive use of Canadian Forces overseas. 

-Restoring justice and property to First Nations by streamlining the land claim process and eliminating all systemic discrimination and condescension. 

-Legalizing marijuana

-Decriminalizing other 'hard' drugs in order to allow drug abusers to get the help they need without the threat of being thrown in a jail and stripped of their rights.

If you would like to support to the movement towards Liberty in Canada, your contributions will be well-spent here. In order to run an effective campaign, I would like to purchase physical paraphernalia, such as

-Buttons

-T Shirts

-Posters

-Lawn Signs

In conjunction with the above, I would also like to invest into making powerful campaign videos, and be able to reward the hardworking individuals on my team. Including you, kind reader :) Check out the 'perks'. If you would like to see any designs or read any scripts written for the campaign, do not hesitate to contact me at meghan.porter@libertarian.ca . 

MUST READ: On this Indiegogo campaign, there is a donation maximum of 20$. This is for legal purposes, in accordance with Elections Canada. 

If you would like to contribute more than that, please contact me at:  meghan.porter@libertarian.ca. 

If you believe in Freedom, Peace and Respecting Property Rights, you might be a Libertarian. If you want your tax dollars to go towards the betterment of your community and not towards violence or corporate bailouts, you might like what the Libertarians of Canada stand for. 

Go to www.libertarian.ca to learn more. Stay tuned for more from the Meghan Porter campaign. 

www.facebook.com/mpmpbc
