story:
HUDSON COUNTY will be a dramatic series that examines the corrupt underbelly of local American politics through the stories of this notorious county.  We will shape the voice of the show from real politicians, gangsters, lawyers, FBI agents and locals affected by the corruption.  This will be a show about the devastating pursuit of Power.  You won’t believe what’s true.

It is our goal to raise capital to help support the development stage; writers, research and interviews are all needed to develop a series of this caliber.  Please donate to help make this show a reality.

story:
Daz Reading is a small writing consulting business. For years, we have used it as a way to make extra income while helping writers achieve their goals. We offer constructive criticism, editing services, and revision services for creative and technical writing.

We already have a small base of repeat clients, but we need to grow and expand. Ultimately, we want Daz Reading to become a full-time sustainable business. 


Besides allowing us to invest money in outreach for new clients, the drive aims to raise funds to:
  1. Replace outdated and/or significantly defective technology
  2.  Purchase up-to-date software for word processing, dictation, editing, and publishing
  3. Access services that will allow us to gain benefits and access to bigger clients (such as the Editorial Freelancers Association)
  4. Help offset costs associated with owning a small business
  5. Pay for office supplies, including ink, paper, fax services, and temperature control for warmer times of the year
  6. THE GIFT OF TIME! Making our business sustainable allows us to devote our free time to our own writing pursuits and projects, as opposed to juggling multiple jobs to meet the costs of living. For example, Carolyn has been working on a screenplay that is currently in development at an indie production company in Los Angeles.


Some of these costs are one-time investments that will significantly improve our work environment. These sort of improvements will free up time and energy to devote to the business's more important operations.

Others are recurring costs. To this end, the drive aims to allow us "breathing room" so that we can focus on growing our business, as opposed to making ends meet. 

While the myth of the entirely self-made enterpreneur exists, the truth is small businesses rarely flourish without some sort of outside investment, whether it be  networking connections, endorsement by third parties, and/or access to significant and necessary funds through loans or sponsors.


If you wish to contribute in a non-monetary way, please get in touch. We welcome non-monetary assistance, such as connecting us with important resources and contacts and helping us gain more exposure.


Finally, please consider sharing our campaign!

Check us out at: http://dazreading.wix.com/dazreading

Thanks!

story:
Memorias del Silencio: Footprints of the Borderland

Memorias del Silencio: Footprints of the Borderland is celebrating its 10th year and we need your help to publish the latest edition. 

Memorias del Silencio, a collaboration between the non-profit literary organization Bordersenses and El Paso Community College’s Community Education Program, aims to provide academic opportunities to migrant farm workers and raise awareness about the condition of migrant workers in the United States. Conceived as a vehicle to give voice to the forgotten, this publication provides a venue for migrant workers to voice their experience and share their world.

Memorias del Silencio is the outcome of creative writing workshops for migrant farm workers, studying to obtain their GED at El Paso Community College. Workshop participants write about their own experiences while acquiring skills of active and critical engagement, which in turn, they employ in their education and community. These workshops celebrate migrants’ ways of knowing, privileges their voice, and encourages confidence in the value of their contribution. Each year the program culminates in the publication of Memorias del Silencio, a selection of poetry and prose by our workshop participants, and in addition, a public reading that showcases their writing.

Being a migrant signifies many things and to achieve a more complete understanding, it must be explored from various points of view. Memorias del Silencio endeavors to present the perspective of those who cross the border in search of work to improve their quality of life and support their family, to present an alternative version to the prevailing narrative, written with their own words.

The money raised from this campaign will go directly toward the design and print of the tenth volume of Memorias del Silencio.  

Other Ways You Can Help 

Help spread the word, share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested in donating.  Also, connect with us on Facebook (BorderSenses), Twitter (BorderSensesEP), and check out our website: www.bordersenses.com.

Here's a look at some of our rewards!

BorderSenses Publications

BorderSenses or ForWord T-Shirt

Vintage BorderSenses and Barbed Wire Open Mic Posters

BorderSenses Tote

story:
Short Summary

Cheesecake de Granger is an online bakery that sells cheesecake cupcakes and other desserts. Currently, we deliver our products throughout the greater Los Angeles area.  We offer unique high quality desserts with exceptional taste and outstanding customer service. We strive to make every customer experience a momentous one.  What started out as a simple challenge to an alternative to a slice of cheesecake has taken on a life of its own, and now we have been in business for 3 years.

This campaign will allow us to open our first retail location in the Los Angeles, California area in the fall of 2015. Our customer base is constantly growing, and we are in dire need of a store front to keep up with the demand.

The $60,000 raised will be used to as start-up capital for our first location, so we need EVERYTHING! Here is a short break down of some of the items on our list:

* Construction
* Commercial oven
* Refrigerator
* Freezer
* Display cases
* Cooling racks
* Computer
* Printer
* Commercial mixers
* Mixing bowls
* Spatulas
* Measuring cups
* Food storage containers
* Stainless steel work table
* Licenses & fees

Currently, we deliver our products throughout the greater Los Angeles area.  We offer unique high quality desserts with exceptional taste and outstanding customer service. story:
STACKEDD  was created in January 2015 to correct the gender disparity in local media. Our site creates a safe, comment-free place for female identifying people to share stories and create art. Our contributors are paid (though, not much) and their stories are proofed, but not edited as to give a true, unfiltered view of the female artistic experience.

STACKEDD  launched with a small amount of private funding. In order to go into print and continue our efforts, we need financial support. If everyone who has read our work in the last six months had donated just $1 per page view we could operate for years at our current budget and go to print. We are asking fans of our work to step up and support our efforts. Your funding will go towards the Fall Print Issue ($7,000-10,000), contributor fees(2,000), and operational costs (5,000).

Because when you love us, we love you back... There will be goodies for those who pony up.

The Impact

Supporting STACKEDD means you think Art and the people who make it are valuable and worth compensation.

With 80,000 page views in 6 months, STACKEDD  has successfully proven people of both genders are interested in reading our take on Seattle and the national Art and Pop Culture scene. We employ 40 freelance contributors, nearly 40% of whom identify as women of color, queer or transgendered, providing a perspective you rarely find in a national media outlet, let alone a local one.


Additionally, STACKEDD  hosts many charitable events and feminist-centric community outreach programs, like STACKEDD Summer Camp, an online mentorship program designed to aid young female identifying people in the Arts. Your donation will help keep our civic-minded programs active.


Risks & Challenges

Eventually, STACKEDD  will become self-sufficient with advertising. We need assistance while we develop the optimum ad platform and compile stats for potential advertisers. Our goal is to get there by year’s end. Your support will keep us going at our current rates until then. I believe in STACKEDD'S  purpose and potential so much, I have financed this project personally (with an additional small, outside investment for web development) up until this point. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Your word of mouth and shares via social media will be the determining factor in making this campaign a success.  Please shamelessly share and re-post.

story:
Eldritch Embraces: Putting The Love Back In Lovecraft

Dragon's Roost Press is at it again.  This time we are taking on the master of cosmic horror, H.P. Lovecraft, and perhaps the most frightening topic of all -- love and romance.  We have put together a collection of 31 short stories from some of the best authors currently writing horror and dark speculative fiction.  Now we need your help with production costs.

As with our previous anthology, Desolation: 21 Tales for Tails, a portion of the proceeds of all sales will benefit the Last Day Dog Rescue Organization, a volunteer group which saves dogs from high kill shelters and those which sell unclaimed animals to research facilities.  The canines are then fostered by volunteers until they can be adopted into their forever homes.

Financial Magic

We will be releasing the anthology simultaneously in physical and digital formats.  For the physical copies we will be using Amazon.com's Create Space Print On Demand Service.  The digital release will be on Smashwords which will allow us to market to Kindle, Nook, iBook, Sony, and other e-readers.

Our goal is to raise $2500.  This will cover the costs of production including expanded distribution which will allow the anthology to be ordered in brick and mortar bookstores as well as on-line.  It will also cover a nominal, 1 cent per word, payment to the authors whose work will be featured in the anthology (writers like to eat too!), as well as contributor copies for the authors and copies to sell at conventions.

Our stretch goal is $4000.  This would allow us to raise the pay rate to a professional 5 cents per word, pay for cover artwork, and promotional materials.

Why We Do What We Do

Every day unwanted animals are euthanized or sold to research facilities where they suffer unspeakable horrors.  By creating this anthology we hope to create a continuous revenue source for an organization which saves animals from this fate.  By helping fund this project, you will be helping volunteers who foster animals in their homes until they are adopted.  These volunteers feed, shelter, and socialize the rescued animals as well as make sure they are vaccinated and healthy.

On top of helping animals in need, you will also be supporting a group of amazing authors.  Dragon's Roost Press is dedicated to bringing the best dark speculative fiction to light, and the stories in this anthology are no exception.  They run the gamut from horror to humor.  In addition to digital and paperback versions of the anthology, you also have the chance to receive other amazing perks including ornaments, custom artwork, clothing, and even pajamas!


We understand that not everyone has the ability to support the project financially.  You can still help!  Get the word out through Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and whatever other social media platforms have sprung up since the last time we looked.  Tell people about what we are trying to accomplish.  If you know any writers, let them know that we are accepting submissions!

Thank you in advance for your help.

Sounds Great, But What Else Can I Do?

We understand that not everyone has the ability to support the project financially.  You can still help!  Get the word out through Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and whatever other social media platforms have sprung up since the last time we looked.  Tell people about what we are trying to accomplish.  

Thank you in advance for your help.

story:
Hi, my name is Jon, and I am a devoted follower of Christ, husband, father and grandfather. An author, pastor, and speaker, I devote most of my time to working with children and families. I am a graduate of Liberty University and Luther Rice University and Seminary, with a B.S. in Religion and M.A. in Biblical Counseling. My beautiful wife Michele and I have been married going on 23 years and have 5 children and 1 grandson. We reside in the Austin, Texas, area with 3 of our children. 
 

 
 

This project came about because our 10-year-old son wanted to end his life without any warnings or any writings on the wall. It was this revelation and many more that compelled our family into action. I wrote this book with an extremely personal and candid approach because I believe that if others can benefit from our journey, then I need to show the good, the bad, and the downright painful. This book is for anyone who loves a person with autism, ASD, or with anxiety and depression. It is also for those personally going through these challenges, to let them know that they aren’t alone. 
 

 
 

In most campaigns, the contributor does not have a chance to save a life, butwith this one you will. When you contribute to this campaign, you are bringing awareness to the world and a secret that so few know about. This sad secret is that children and adults with autism and autism spectrum disorder are much more likely to suffer from depression and anxiety than individuals without these disorders. What’s worse is the fact that a majority of those think of, attempt to, or follow through with ending their lives. 
 

Why? 
 

< Children with autism or ASD are bullied at a much greater rate than their unaffected brothers and sisters. 
 

< People with autism or ASD have higher rates of unemployment or underemployment than the general population. 
 

< Youth and adults with autism or ASD have higher rates of social isolation.
 

When our 10 year old wanted to end his life and had already attempted to hang himself when he was 8, I knew something had to be done. I knew we weren’t alone in this. See, there is this stereotype that kids and adults with autism and ASD are always happy, but that is just simply not true! We had no clue, this book had to be written!
 

Together we can bring about AWARENESS, UNDERSTANDING, HEALING, AND HELP!
 

I have never written a book and am new to book publishing. So, I want to be as transparent as I can be with everyone. It’s what I would want done if I was contributing to Indiegogo. 
 

My book is being published by Clay Bridges Publishing, with whom I am honored to be partnered. They are a hybrid publisher. Basically, what that means is that they partner with the authors 50/50 on the costs to publish the books. 
 

I’m asking for $6,000, which will include the $4,250 fee for production, distribution, and fulfillment. 
 

So, why am I asking for $6,000? The above fee does not cover the line-by-line editing, marketing, and virtual book tours. I know it’s a lot, but there is actually a lot more! If we go over the $6,000, we can do even more to spread awareness to more people! 
 

If together we don't reach the goal, all the money will go toward publishing the book. 
 

The world needs this, and people need to understand that everywhere around us people are hurting and we can help. Some of the people who are hurting cannot communicate, and they desperately need a voice, but their loved ones have never heard or known of the high risk of depression and anxiety. Working together, we can help be their voice! 
 

Some of you that see this would love to give financially but can't. Trust me, we understand, but here is what you can do. Pray, and share over and over again! Indiegogo has amazing share tools! 
 

Thank you, my son Keegan thanks you, and so do all the people this book will help!

story:
Back in the Day

As parents, we all have experienced the moment when you purchased that one item that your children wanted on Christmas day or their birthday. You walk into the room and your child lights up with excitement. They play with that toy for an hour (maybe two) but then as you start to clean up, you notice that toy laying to the side. The box that the toy was in has now turned into the "best toy ever." 

That is where Kardboard Kids came from. Building on the imagination that all kids have and "smashing" that with things in our (the parents) past, to create a series of "how to" books for the whole family.

How to Fly to the Moon in a Cardboard Box, jumps right into the mind of Captain EJ. He is taking a trip to the moon and he has to make sure that he has everything he needs to be successful.    

A Brief Background

Emmanuel Threatt and Brian Blackmore came together to create more than a book. They came together to create an experience that kids and adults can enjoy. Brian has a background in illustration, drawing since he was child and honing his skills over the years. Emmanuel has a been creating lyrical content via rap music for more than 20 years. Both are fathers and both understand the need to engage their children in a deeper and creative way.   

The purpose of this campaign is to put fuel behind an amazing book. How to Fly to the Moon in a Cardboard Box, is a fun imaginative picture book that pulls on the creativity of children and the nostalgia of the adults. Reaching the $3,000 campaign goal will allow us at Kardboard Kids to a provide a high-quality, hard-cover, picture book and plush bear that match the high quality content we've created. Be a part of encouraging imagination in your child the way you experienced it when you were their age. 

We believe this book, along with other to come, will be a book that your children (and you) will want to read over and over. From the bright colors and comic book feel, to the hidden "throwback" gems scattered throughout this book, we know that you will enjoy reading this. We cannot express how grateful we are that you would take the time and consider contributing to this campaign. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution is going directly to creating a high quality product. How to Fly to the Moon in a Cardboard Box is the first book in a series and we want to start off strong. We will be doing a lot of promotion on social media and on Amazon and would love to have a strong presence in order to spread imagination to families all over. You can be a part of this! You are a part of this! Your support makes you a part of the Kardboard Kids family. 

If you are able to contribute, THANK YOU ... If you are not, that's OK! What you can do is share this campaign with your family and friends. You can like the Kardboard Kids Facebook and Instagram pages. Send text messages, emails, smoke signals or whatever you do to communicate with others and let them know about this book and Kardboard Kids. Thank you again for your support.

story:
Funds for a workshop to revise my novel, The Color of Safety

With a video camera in every pocket, the world is finally seeing what people of color have known for decades--that, no matter their wealth, power, politeness or success, minorities are targeted by police officers, often fatally. And usually, the officers get off scot free. This summer, my family's story become part of the nation's headlines when someone we knew and loved--one of our own--was killed by a police officer, after being targeted as "a wide-nose type." I'm looking for $4500 for a year-long novel-writing intensive to combine our experiences with stories from our neighbors in South Central Los Angeles, in a revision of a novel, The Color of Safety,  that I had already written to humanize our country's history of racism. (This summer's draft had a Driving-While-Black episode mid-20th Century, based on court documents.)

In The Color of Safety, African-American and Jewish history are entwined through the four owners of one fine, old house in South Central Los Angeles over the last hundred years. In this revision, I will be changing the story of the owners in 2016: as Molly Lerner struggles to absorb her mother’s Holocaust past, Molly and Daniel and their children get to know and love a mixed race family of neighbors, before their world is shattered by the police shooting of one of their own. 

The novel-writing workshop is led by a gifted teacher and contains only twelve other writers. It  will provide artistic support, practical advice and the formal stamp of accomplishment--three things that will help this book break into traditional publishing. A generous writer friend who has read the existing draft, fronted me the first half-payment (to be repaid from sale of the novel.) I need to raise the rest. 

When I heard about the class--with a fantastic teacher-I leaped at the chance, recruited writers I knew were terrific, and signed us all up. I knew I needed help to pay for it, but with only twelve hotly desired slots--which went within seconds--I had to leap first, fund-raise later. Now I'm in, and passionately revising already. The class starts in three weeks--the due date for funds is coming up!

Budget  Novel-Writing Project

  1. The second half payment The Loft's The Novel Writing Project            $3600                                                             
  2. For a used Macbook Air for revision of The Color of Safety.                           $600                                                                
  3. For the purchase of seven novels required for the class                                   $105
  4. Laser printer and various class related printing costs                                       $195                       

Total                                                                                                                                         $4500

The perks I offer are:

1) for ten dollar donations, I will knit you a scarf--with no dropped stitches, guaranteed. 

2) For thirty dollar donations, I will send you a signed copy of The Color of Safety (after it is published.) 

3) for fifty-dollar donations, I will needle felt your last name, or an abstract design, onto a wool beret. 

4) For fifty-dollar donations, I will knit you an actual Minnesota hat (with ear flaps and long tails.)

5) For 100 dollars, (if you live in driving distance) I will be thrilled to visit your critique or book group and talk with you guys about The Color of Safety. If you live further away, I will Skype into your group. 

6) For 1000 dollars, I will edit or punch up the query letter for your own book project. (What can I say? I have a gift.)

Art can entertain--and I believe The Color of Safety will do so--but more than that, it can transform, translate, enlighten and serve as a call to action against the powers of tyranny.  As we saw during this election, some think that racial minorities and Jews are subhuman. We don't change these minds through argument, but through stories that build connection. I believe that the stories that twist and tangle through The Color of Safety can reach people who might not otherwise be able to identify with an inner-city black family--so that folks from Idaho to Iowa, from New Mexico to New Hampshire, can come to understand what it feels like to be targeted because of the color of your skin, with sometimes terrifying consequences. 

Any support will help. I hope to reach the full amount, but If I don't, what I have will help--a lot-- with tuition. 

If I reach more than the requested amount, what is left will go toward a professional critique of The Color of Safety before submission. If you can't afford to donate, I totally get it! I wouldn't be crowd-sourcing if money was no problem. But you can still help, by forwarding this link to friends you know who might be interested in supporting what I believe will be an important book.  Just use the easy Indiegogo share tools. 

One last note:  this my first ever crowd-sourcing, my first time making this kind of video, my first time doing any of this. If you have suggestions for how to improve this campaign, please let me know. I'm listening.
story_txt:
Funds for a workshop to revise my novel, The Color of Safety With a video camera in every pocket, the world is finally seeing what people of color have known for decades--that, no matter their wealth, power, politeness or success, minorities are targeted by police officers, often fatally. And usually, the officers get off scot free. This summer, my family's story become part of the nation's headlines when someone we knew and loved--one of our own--was killed by a police officer, after being targeted as "a wide-nose type." I'm looking for $4500 for a year-long novel-writing intensive to combine our experiences with stories from our neighbors in South Central Los Angeles, in a revision of a novel, The Color of Safety,  that I had already written to humanize our country's history of racism. (This summer's draft had a Driving-While-Black episode mid-20th Century, based on court documents.)In The Color of Safety, African-American and Jewish history are entwined through the four owners of one fine, old house in South Central Los Angeles over the last hundred years. In this revision, I will be changing the story of the owners in 2016: as Molly Lerner struggles to absorb her mother’s Holocaust past, Molly and Daniel and their children get to know and love a mixed race family of neighbors, before their world is shattered by the police shooting of one of their own. The novel-writing workshop is led by a gifted teacher and contains only twelve other writers. It  will provide artistic support, practical advice and the formal stamp of accomplishment--three things that will help this book break into traditional publishing. A generous writer friend who has read the existing draft, fronted me the first half-payment (to be repaid from sale of the novel.) I need to raise the rest. When I heard about the class--with a fantastic teacher-I leaped at the chance, recruited writers I knew were terrific, and signed us all up. I knew I needed help to pay for it, but with only twelve hotly desired slots--which went within seconds--I had to leap first, fund-raise later. Now I'm in, and passionately revising already. The class starts in three weeks--the due date for funds is coming up!Budget  Novel-Writing Project
The second half payment The Loft's The Novel Writing Project            $3600                                                             
For a used Macbook Air for revision of The Color of Safety.                           $600                                                                
For the purchase of seven novels required for the class                                   $105
Laser printer and various class related printing costs                                       $195                       
Total                                                                                                                                         $4500The perks I offer are:1) for ten dollar donations, I will knit you a scarf--with no dropped stitches, guaranteed. 2) For thirty dollar donations, I will send you a signed copy of The Color of Safety (after it is published.) 3) for fifty-dollar donations, I will needle felt your last name, or an abstract design, onto a wool beret. 4) For fifty-dollar donations, I will knit you an actual Minnesota hat (with ear flaps and long tails.)5) For 100 dollars, (if you live in driving distance) I will be thrilled to visit your critique or book group and talk with you guys about The Color of Safety. If you live further away, I will Skype into your group. 6) For 1000 dollars, I will edit or punch up the query letter for your own book project. (What can I say? I have a gift.)Art can entertain--and I believe The Color of Safety will do so--but more than that, it can transform, translate, enlighten and serve as a call to action against the powers of tyranny.  As we saw during this election, some think that racial minorities and Jews are subhuman. We don't change these minds through argument, but through stories that build connection. I believe that the stories that twist and tangle through The Color of Safety can reach people who might not otherwise be able to identify with an inner-city black family--so that folks from Idaho to Iowa, from New Mexico to New Hampshire, can come to understand what it feels like to be targeted because of the color of your skin, with sometimes terrifying consequences. Any support will help. I hope to reach the full amount, but If I don't, what I have will help--a lot-- with tuition. If I reach more than the requested amount, what is left will go toward a professional critique of The Color of Safety before submission. If you can't afford to donate, I totally get it! I wouldn't be crowd-sourcing if money was no problem. But you can still help, by forwarding this link to friends you know who might be interested in supporting what I believe will be an important book.  Just use the easy Indiegogo share tools. One last note:  this my first ever crowd-sourcing, my first time making this kind of video, my first time doing any of this. If you have suggestions for how to improve this campaign, please let me know. I'm listening.

story:
Bedazzled Ink is a medium-sized publishing company with a mission. Founded in 2004 with 150 books published to date, we are dedicated to literary fiction, nonfiction, and children’s books that celebrate the unique and under-represented voices of women.

We’re interested in fiction with female protagonists and nonfiction from a female perspective that appeals to all readers. In other words, we publish books that are equal in acceptance to books by male writers.

And we’re facing a tough uphill battle.

  • Women account for only 30% of the writers in the average publishing house
  • While women read books by either gender, men tend to read books only by male authors
  • Three-fourths of the reviews by major review publications are for books by men.
  • Amazon lumps all women authors in “women’s fiction” regardless of what kind of book it is.
  • Amazon’s marketing keeps female writers from finding their core audience “not to mention from entering the larger more influential playing field.” (New York Times)
  • A woman writer gets points if they include the “male” world in their work and lose points if they don’t. (New York Times)
  • No Pulitzer Prize winner from 2000-2014 was written wholly from the point of view of a female.
  • Women authors use initials or male pseudonyms to gain credibility in the publishing industry.

Woman authors who write outside acceptable “women’s” genres are forced into inappropriate boxes by their agents and publishers and are incorrectly marketed by booksellers. Women authors have a greater chance of being overlooked by reviewers.

The only way we can fight this inequality of acceptance is to be in the industry’s face as much as possible.

It’s time to step up and reassert that women’s voices are equal and have a right to be heard, now more than ever. Bedazzled Ink is in the unique position to give women their voice through the written word. We’re starting this fight with the books we are publishing in 2017.

Unfortunately, this mission takes funding beyond the modest means of an independent publisher.

We hate to think inside the box and tend to kick boxes and anything resembling boxes out of our way, so we created our Angels for Books Campaign. We know there are people who would love to have the opportunity to support the literary voices of women authors and give them a place of equality and respect in the publishing industry today. Your small contribution will make a big impact on a book’s success in knocking holes in the male-dominated walls.

We hope you choose to become a Book Angel give our upcoming books the Wings they need to reach their full potential audience and take their rightful place alongside books by male authors.

 

What We Need To Do

Since we do not sign books that follow genres or formulas and each of our books celebrates a unique female voice or story, the only way to succeed in our mission is to treat all our titles equally.

This means we have to market all our titles at the same high standard to keep us continually visible within the publishing industry.

We've learned that each time we get a review by a major reviewer and each time we are shortlisted for or win an award, our status rises within the publishing industry. We can't let up now. We have to keep raising our visibility with advertising, reviews, and awards to meet our mission of making women authors equal to male authors in acceptance and respect.

Unfortunately, it takes a lot of effort and expense to get even a single review or an award.

Even with discounts offered by our distributor, IPG, advertising still takes a good chunk of the budget for just a single time ad in major trade publications. Trying for reviews involve preparing Advance Reading Copies three to four months before the publication date, printing review copies, preparing information sheets and press releases, and mailing out the review copies.

Awards not only validate a book's worth, but they help solidify a publisher's reputation for putting out excellent, high quality books.

 

Distribution plus major reviews and advertising equal greater sales. Greater sales equal greater visibility, which creates even more sales. Greater sales means turning enough profit to give us the ability to give Wings to all our new books, which, in return, gets us closer to receiving equality in the publishing world.

We are now preparing our books for 2017 and need an extra boost to our budget to ensure all our books receive equal advertising, reviews, and awards. Like any parent, we hate to be forced to pick favorites among all our equally gifted children so we offer all our titles as perks. You can read about each of our titles at Bedazzled Ink Publishing.

Thank you for becoming a Book Angel and helping woman authors to break through the publishing glass ceiling.

story:
Short Summary

  • Kore Press---a Tucson-based nonprofit, feminist publishing house and award-winning innovative literary activist organization dedicated to the creative genius of women and girls for 24 years--is seeking to raise $20K to support programming and the publication of works that fill a gap left by mainstream publishing.

Why Kore? Why people-powered publishing?

To create a people-powered publishing house has clearly become THE most sustainable route for extending the 24 year old feminist platform for women and marginalized voices that is Kore Press. Our goal is to bring the next season of important projects from the Press to the public as a people-powered enterprise. A significant portion of our budgets have come from support by the beloved NEA, NEH and associated funding sources. Grants are lovely, soft and volatile resources that have continued to dwindle across recent years, and now, are actively threatened. Our fight to save these important institutions is far from over. Yesterday morning, May 23, President Trump released his proposal for a fiscal year '18 budget (running from October 1, 2017 through September 30, 2018), which eliminates both the NEA and the NEH.

In order to launch the Press' Fall season of amazingness (with grants as the icing on the Kore cake, and not the cake itself) we need you on our team like never before! 

While the rights of women, immigrants, people of color, queer & trans folks continue to be threatened, the dedicated staff of women at Kore show up to reveal their commitment to impactful, literary justice publishing and programming. We invite you to become a part of the people-powered publishing team for sustaining Kore Press.

Joining our team is a commitment to indie feminist publishing and to an expansive literary landscape. It's a YES to diversity making our communities better, more real, and more rich. It is a YES to trans and queer writers. It's a YES to all women and a YES to minorities. It's a YES to young women's voices, and to visibility no matter what.

Here's what's slated for Fall '17:

1. The long-awaited, 6-years in the making, one-of-a-kind anthology edited by Dawn Lundy Martin and Erica Hunt for Kore Press, Letters to the Future: Black Women/Radical Writing.  The collection celebrates formal and linguistically innovative late-modern and contemporary work by Black women from the United States, England, Canada, and the Caribbean—work that challenges readers to participate in meaning making.  The writing in the anthology is driven by the writer’s desire to radically present, uncovering what she knows and does not know, as well as critically addressing the future. The book is slated to be launched during a a series of events during the Thinking Its Presence, Race, Advocacy, Solidarity in the Arts conference in Tucson, Oct 19-21.​

  • ​Why is this important? The anthology helps re-write the misnomer that innovative writing is white writing and does it with a particular interest in gender. Is it a coincidence that #blacklivesmatter was coined and put into action by black queer women in the same moment that there is a proliferation of black women writing experimental work? Editors Martin and Hunt say, "We don’t think so. This anthology is part of our means of simply looking at what we are doing together to re-write the future world as unfamiliar. Indeed, it is the familiar, the well-worn racial and racist past that is killing us.”

2. The posthumous memoir by first generation Catholic Polish Holocaust survivor, Lusia Slomkowska, Christine's Crossing. This trauma memoir is unlike any other and takes its place within a community of testimony, and leaves a historical record. It represents a story of Polish Catholic Holocaust victims and survivors, a story that has not yet been widely told or understood, and will become a part of the archives of written, audio and visual record of the Holocaust, along side the stories of the Jewish genocide. Slomkowska's project is about the personal and historical (trans generational) survival of trauma, breaking silence, and surviving as a witness to the impact of genocide.

and

3. Stories can change our world. Kore Press, for the second year, is getting behind the sacred art of story-telling and the empowering practice of truth telling by women by offering an annual Memoir Award, judged by the bad-ass, beautiful writer and heart-wrenching truth sayer, Cheryl Strayed. Strayed says we can learn that “part of being able to bear the things we can’t bear is not about tossing them off, not about making the weight lighter, but simply learning that we have the capacity to carry it.”

This Kore Award is designed not only to launch an emerging woman writer, but demonstrates the Press' commitment to narrative journalism and truth-telling that transcends personal story and resonates with others, as a tool for transforming women's lives.

 

What We Need & What You Get

People-powered publishing needs to raise $20K to launch in the fall.

Here is what the money is going to:

  • $1000 design for two books 
  • $4000 book printing (1000 and 400 copies of each)
  • $2400 marketing ($400 month x 6 months)
  • $8000 publishing staff: editorial, publishing ($1333 x 6 months)
  • $3000 book publicist  ($600/mo x 5 months)
  • $1600 anthology editorial/artist fees (16 contributors)

 

The perks!

We are excited to share our campaign bling with you: the books! Fun tee shirts, temporary tattoos, chances to win a car, cash or airline tickets! Your name printed in our books, dinner with poets, gift certificates, two nights in a Tucson cottage, special delivery services, pencil drawing portrait session, virtual flourishes of thanks and kisses, and for artists---writing/performance consultancies with super star writers and editors. More creative perks from friends of the Press will be added as the campaign rolls out, too.

What do we do if we don't reach your entire goal, you ask? We'll scale back or do more of the work in-house rather than farming it out! 

 

The Impact

Kore has completed two successful crowd funding campaigns in the past--one for a single book project, and another for a 10-week, 40-partner, city-wide engagement series called Big Read Tucson, which contemporized Emily Dickinson's life and work. 

What is the impact of envelope-pushing, new work . .  . on the culture, the canon, the artists, the readers? We believe the impact of both the first generation Holocaust trauma memoir, Christine's Crossing, and the anthology of radical writing by black women artists,  Letters to the Future, will be nothing less than groundbreaking. Here is the list of contributing artists to the anthology:

Lillian Yvonne Bertram

Octavia Butler

LaTasha N. Nevada Diggs

R. Erica Doyle

Betsy Fagin

Tonya Foster

Renee Gladman

Ajdua Garzi Nzinga Greaves

Duriel E. Harris

Yona Harvey

Harmony Holiday

Adrienne Kennedy

Ruth Ellen Kocher

Robin Coste Lewis

Tracie Morris

Harryette Mullen

Akilah Oliver

Julie Patton

M. NourbeSe Philip

Adrian Piper

Khadijah Queen

Claudia Rankine

Deborah Richards

Metta Sama

Ntozake Shange

Dawn Lundy Martin

Evie Shockley

Giovanni Singleton

Kara Walker

Wendy Walters

Simone White

Lucille Clifton

Sonia Sanchez

Wanda Coleman

Jayne Cortez

Tisa Bryant

 

Who is Kore Press?

  • Co-Founder & Publisher: Lisa Bowden, long-time editor, curator, writer, mother, activist for justice and all her linked, gendered concerns.
  • Managing Editor: Ann Dernier, poet, editor, manuscript midwife, mentor, mother.
  • Marketing & Publicity: Annie Guthrie, poet, jeweler, curator, oracular writing coach, mother.
  • Bookkeeping: June Rettig, theater artist, shoe-maker, Rancho Linda Vista Artist Community member.
  • Submissions & Contests: Jussara Esprit (former student intern-turned-remote staffer and knower-of-all-things-Kore), writer, reader, sister, family leader.
  • Social Media & Operations: Sahar Mitchell, circus-artist, performer, writer, mother of two teen girls.
  • Fulfillment & Bookbinding: Laura Bargfeld, film student, writer, artist.
  • Anthology Editorial Intern: Sarah Darwich, writer, feminist organizer, digital media worker, remote intern and recent grad of Duke University
  • Book Marketing Intern: Jenna Whitney, writer, young publishing professional, student of Portland State's Masters program in publishing and writing.

 

Risks & Challenges

With a 24-year track record of publishing and programming in a small, non-profit, arts environment, our awareness of the risks and obstacles on the way to achieving our goals are keen! We have been doing amazing, important work for over 2 decades and know how to adjust, retool, and deliver against all odds. There are also a lot of talented folks and entities out there, so it's a richly competitive, exciting playing field for capturing attention and resources. That is a reality. It's June, summer travels, retreats, and unplugging have begun. We will send some snail mail letters, make phone calls, send lots of emails, and do what we do best online as well to capture the hearts and minds of an expanding circle of believers who care!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean we don't need you on our team!

  • Can you help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign?
  • It's super easy with the Indiegogo share tools! Thank You so much for reading!

With a 24-year track record of publishing and programming in a small, non-profit, arts environment, our awareness of the risks and obstacles on the way to achieving our goals are keen! We have been doing amazing, important work for over 2 decades and know how to adjust, retool, and deliver against all odds. There are also a lot of talented folks and entities out there, so it's a richly competitive, exciting playing field for capturing attention and resources. That is a reality. It's June, summer travels, retreats, and unplugging have begun. We will send some snail mail letters, make phone calls, send lots of emails, and do what we do best online as well to capture the hearts and minds of an expanding circle of believers who care!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean we don't need you on our team!

Can you help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign?
It's super easy with the Indiegogo share tools! Thank You so much for reading!

story:
Most of you know a book takes more than just chucking words on a page and hoping they come together right. It’s a long intricate process, and I’ve been doing it now since 2010. I’ve had success and disappointments, but I love my craft and push to do the best I can. Self-publishing isn’t a poor man’s publishing medium. My craft is words, but that’s not where the journey ends. It needs artwork to draw in a crowd. It has to have careful drafting and expert editing. These things are as important if not more so.

Your generosity will improve my craft.

So, what do I need?

I need help with the following costs:

  • Artwork: Costs of time, effort, creativity, imagery, and the wonders of an artist's mind.
  • Editing: Cost of time, effort, ability, and magical penmanship.
  • Marketing: Advertising across various mediums to extend the reach of my work.

What do you get?

I will reward your generosity with the following as a basic thank you:

  • Your name in the thank you section of the book
  • A free copy eBook
  • Plus some limited special rewards for the most generous.

Thank you for being part of the process!

This campaign is specific to a paperback production.  If I pass my goal, then I will expand the Artwork to a hardback version.

*** Every contribution will get a ebook and a thank you!

story:
Self Publishing Numen Strife! 

 

Hello! My name is M.S. Allan or Monty if you prefer! 

I'm here using Indiegogo to realize my desire of Self-publishing my first completed book, 

| NUMEN STRIFE |

I've been writing this idea for about 5-6 Years altogether, but have been working on my craft for over half of my life! 

I knew that ever since I was about 16 that I wanted to self-publish my first book, and from this point on seek out every which way of publishing and in every piece of media. My goal is small in the grand scope of where I see myself going, but it's an important small step. 

You helping me in any way is appreciated and will be noted going down the road, I have ideas (As you'll see in the perks) that include so much of my contributors in my process that the book is just as much meant to become yours as it has been mine. 

ELEVATOR PITCH 

Numen Strife is a story of sacrifice and hardship. 

Powers unknown and creatures unknown that alter the understanding that the human race has always been made to know. 

After a mysterious and sudden attack on the Kingdom of Regnus, the Hero Guardians including their leader Diagis, best friend to King Maloin, are wiped out. 

Deciding to fall to a dark path in search of finding the next generation of Protectors, King Maloin asks a tournament be held, to pick the best and brightest of his crop to reap and have go under a mortal change. 

The story follows the son of Diagis, a young boy turning only fourteen, Vicadum.

 

The Breakdown

I'm asking for $3,000.00 to fully fund this book release to the extend I need for a further career that begins with this book. 

Printing the Book and Shipping (depending on to which country) is equaling more than the $3000 itself, but I'm throwing my own funds in to make sure every copy finds it's way to you. 

Making you all apart of this book release has been a HUGE part of why I wanted to use a crowd-sourcing platform for Numen Strife. 

I have so much background info that enriches the read, visuals that help along with viewing the story unfold, secrets and hints to share with those of you who want to see further into the process of the world of Munor/Orbdis (Two different names for the planet the story takes place on. )

All of the perks are designed to give you an insider look, to have you enjoy the book to a further extent if you s please, and to be able to get inside my head on this so we can share a good vision of what more this story can be. 

WHY TO DONATE! 

The release of the book on this platform means that we all actually get to print and hold the copy, it's a simple and easy goal that I want everyone to be apart of. 

When I first held my book, I actually cried. 

The Print release means a more lived out desire for me, though I do want to say that outside of the print copies, the book will see it's own release in eBook form on a very popular platform too (hehe), but i wanted to give contributors access to the book and be given all of the other perks I've crafted for them before that. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks! Gah! 

I want to do everything in my ability to make sure everyone gets  their copy of the book, the few risks that come with that are Time - meaning the shipping times could vary depending on who orders what from where! 

Another risk I face is Cost of potential perks - meaning that alongside of just the book being printed and sent out, I have several small things in my perks that include my shipping my own products and pieces of work out to readers.  

Which I will gladly eat from my own pocket, but the (Hopefully) increasing amounts of followers and backers could see me stressing about how much the cost of sending everything else will be, and again how long it might take to get the smaller items, beside the book.

Like I said and like I will always say, I want this to happen and I will ensure with everything that everyone gets what they want. It's my dream. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I've run into my own issues with wanting to back projects but not being able to at the time, or not particularly even liking the projects but enjoying the platform (Otherwise what're we doing here!)  - SO with that said, ANYTHING HELPS 

- If you enjoy the idea but cannot donate to it, please see your way to sharing the idea with friends, family, dogs and cats! 

- Use the share tools on this page to spread it like a deathly virus and take over the world! Muahahahahaha! 

Sorry, my personality got out. 

And that's all there is to it :) 

-M.S. Allan/ Monty

story:
Four of our beloved  Dr. Christine Downing’s books recently ceased circulation through Spring Publications. Help us make her important works "Journey Through Menopause," "Psyche’s Sisters," "Women’s Mysteries," and "Gods in Our Midst" available to future generations both as paperback and e-books. All funds go directly to the publishing house Mandorla Books to offset costs related to digitalizing, redesigning, republishing, and thus recirculating the titles.  

While donations of any size are welcome, please see the perks we'd like to offer you. The number 60 is significant because that's about how many years Chris has been teaching, and the number 90 is for her magical 90th birthday next year!

If you would prefer to make a donation by check, please make it out to Mandorla Books and send it to the following address: 5815  8th Avenue/Sacramento/CA 95820. Please include your email address in the correspondence so your donation can be acknowledged.

Our target date for publication, with your support, is the summer of 2020. 

Chris has provided summaries of each book below. 

JOURNEY THROUGH MENOPAUSE (1987)

Shortly before my 50th birthday I dreamt  that I was pregnant, which somehow led me to realize I was on the verge of menopause, preparing to give birth to my menopausal self. It felt like a call to understand as best I could the soul meaning of the transition that I was approaching. I knew I wanted to live it, to give it the attention one gives to sacred mysteries, to let it be a soul event. I wanted to honor the losses, the continuities, and the transformations. About a year later I set off on a journey around the world that turned out to be  my journey through menopause. Upon my return I realized that somehow things in a deeper place had changed.  I was coming home to Hestia, to a quieter, more centered self. Preparation, Passage, Return--the time-honored phases of a ritual transition. 
 

PSYCHE’S SISTERS (1988)

Shortly after completing my book on the Greek goddesses I had a series of dreams in which I was challenged to recover a lost sister. These dreams made me aware of how, though I had explored Greek mythology’s illumination of my relation to mother and father, to sons and daughter, husband and lovers, I had completely ignored my relation to sister or brother. This led me to realize how depth psychology, too, in its emphasis on the parent-child, relationship, particularly the mother-child bond, had failed to honor the enormous importance that sibling bonds, literal and imagined, nurturing and disappointing, play in our lives ongoingly. The title is intended to remind us of how in the myth about Cupid and Psyche it is Psyche’s envious sisters who push her toward consciousness.


WOMEN’S MYSTERIES (1992)

This book was inspired by Esther Harding’s "Woman’s Mysteries" published the year I was born and particularly by her powerful evocation of female in-her-self-ness.  I wanted to take this further, to speak of women not woman, to honor more fully the diversity among us. I knew I wanted to begin with female experience, with our bodies and our souls, our dreams and our relationships, and to go on to explore how mysteriously gender enters into the lives of all us, women and men alike.  I sought to imagine a poetics of gender, to explore the ways we humans imagine sexual difference and what longings and fears these images betray, to recognize gender as a created reality, always in the process of being made and remade, to acknowledge that masculine and feminine are fictive terms that hide as well as reveal.


GODS IN OUR MIDST (1993)

When I published my book on the Greek goddesses, several men asked me, “When will you write about the gods?”  To which I replied, “You’ll have to do that for yourselves.” But after a while I came to realize that we women do need the gods and not only the goddesses.  I found I wanted   to explore how these gods appear to us, how they show up in our lives—not as representing the “masculine,” but as embodying energies and modes of presence at work in the psyches of all of us. I suspected, indeed hoped, that a woman’s take on this might also speak to men.

story:
75 of Rubin’s friends, foes and comrades were interviewed. Chicago 8 defendants, Berkeley Free Speech movement participants, Paul Krassner, Judy Gumbo, Nancy Kurshan, John & Leni Sinclair, Bobby Seale, Rennie Davis, Country Joe McDonald, Abe Peck, Ratso Sloman, and more reveal in their own voice vibrant, explosive stories of that era.

Bizarre interactions with Allen Ginsberg, Bob Dylan, Timothy Leary, and John Lennon from rare interviews, journals, and diaries — found in Rubin’s archives published for the first time — plus correspondence with Abbie Hoffman, Norman Mailer, Eldridge Cleaver, Mayor Daley, and the Weathermen. The misunderstood relationship between Rubin and his partner-in-crime Abbie Hoffman is explored with controversial insights into their Yippie vs. Yuppie debates.

Author Pat Thomas spent hours digging through all of Jerry Rubin’s  archives — the first person to do since Jerry’s untimely passing in 1994. This is not just Jerry Rubin’s story, but an oral history of the 1960s and 70s counterculture with women’s voices included for the first time in a book of this scope: Nancy Kurshan, Judy Gumbo, Kate Coleman, Stella Resnick, Lola Cohen, Suzanne Peck, Rona Elliot, and Leni Sinclair.

Pat Thomas has appeared on the BBC & NPR as the author of Listen, Whitey! the sights and sounds of Black Power 1965-1975. He was a consultant to the PBS documentary The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution. He also co-curated the book Invitation To Openness: The Jazz & Soul Photography Of Les McCann 1960-1980 and compiled a 3-CD Allen Ginsberg box set: The Last Word on First Blues.

Many photographers have generously charged below their rate,  and hundreds of amazing photos are included. However, even with these discounts, the project is thousands of dollars short of licensing all images necessary. Additional funds received will go towards traveling and lecturing at colleges. Thomas has done one-day lectures at UCLA, USC, Hunter, Evergreen State, Wayne State, Brooklyn College, and George Washington University. But he needs your help to finalize this coffee-table book, packed with a rich oral history of the Anti-War movement, the crusade to remove Nixon from the White House, the birth of social networking and more.

Your donation will ensure that a treasure-trove of photographs will be included in this massive tome. Production costs for the book are mounting, and after publication, additional funds will be needed traveling to colleges nationwide, lecturing to students about this incredible history often overlooked in today’s classrooms.

story:
Why Support "Cues" and Order a Copy of the Book?

For the past 50 years, liberals in America have been following what is considered by many to be the "Progressive's Bible", a book titled Rules for Radicals by the late radical socialist Saul Alinsky.  This  book has been used by progressive professors and politicians for decades to the great detriment of American politics, society and spirit. Now, it's our turn - Cues for Conservatives is the how-to handbook and multimedia blueprint for proactively defending and promoting conservatism with our changing electorate.  By ordering your copy of Cues and supporting our cause, you will be able to:

  • Learn how the conservative movement - and the GOP - needs to reshape its message, reboot its image and unite the Republican Party for a 21st century electorate, with a bold new brand and party platform.
  • Get the tools you need to proactively defend and promote conservatism with the "12 Cues"  - and combat the progressive agenda and Alinsky's 13 "rules for radicals"
  • Engage the Millennial Generation - and other demographics who typically support the Democrat party - to explain the Cue's new conservative movement and win their support.
  • Help us get copies of Cues to every conservative and independent member of Congress - and produce a series of viral web videos - to get our message out and make a difference.

Short Summary

America's political future will very soon lie largely in the hands of the Millennial Generation, born between 1981 and 1999. They are now coming of age and beginning to take over the workforce, and soon they'll control American politics, too, leaning heavily liberal and Democrat. What will this mean for the future of our country? And, how can conservatives respond to this alarming trend?

How can we better reach, inspire and engage this younger generation to save our country from the failed and destructive liberal agenda? The political Left, leaning ever more radically progressive, has succeeded in persuading Millennials and other demographics, significantly out-messaging conservatives with their mastery of political marketing and domination of the media, entertainment and education. If Republicans do not build a unified front and develop a clear strategy to win the support of younger voters, we will quickly become a permanent minority party.  

I started this project because I, as an experienced marketing professional, can no longer stand by as I see radical progressives succeed with the younger generation and other groups, while conservatives remain divided and continue with the same old and failed methods.  I also believe that the Republican party is in need of real change within its ranks, and that the conservative movement needs to become more inclusive of Americans of all stripes.  With the growing divisions within the GOP, we need to reshape the party's image and brand to attract a new, younger and evolving audience.

Cues for Conservatives is a book that I've written - and a multimedia movement I've started - that focuses on how the Left has managed to win Millennial voters and other key demographics, and how conservatives can use some of these same methods, in addition to some bold new tactics of our own, to unite our movement and win them back.


What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help fund the production and publishing of my book, Cues for Conservatives; send a copy to every conservative and independent member of Congress; produce a series of short, high quality animated videos highlighting the chapters in my book; and build a website and social media campaign to promote our message to Millennials and all Americans.

The fundraising target goal is $50,000 to cover our expenses for the items above.

Go the "Gallery" tab above to view a video highlighting Chapter 2: The State of Our Country Today, and a Brief, Urgent Case for Conservatism; this video illustrates the style and quality of the videos we intend to produce to highlight selected chapters of Cues.  Videos are the best way to get reach and engage our target audience.

If we exceed our fundraising goals - which we hope to do - we will be able to produce additional videos, expand our social media reach and ideally hold Cues events in key locations in the US to further spread and promote our message.  My goal is to reach millions of voters to Bring America Forward. 

In return for your generous contributions, you will be able to support our cause, get a digital or print copy of Cues, and more.  You can participate in supporting the new conservative movement and help save our country from the radical progressive agenda.

Risks & Challenges

Cues for Conservatives, in year in progress, has been written, and two videos have been produced and completed.   If we don't raise our target funding (hopefully, we will exceed our target), the project will forge on; the first priority will be producing, printing and shipping the copies of Cues that were ordered, followed by the production of the videos and sending copies out to conservative and independent members of Congress.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please help get the word out, make some noise about the campaign, and share with your friends and family.

Here are links to my blog and social media accounts where you can follow me and this project:

  • My blog, John Paul's Conservative Buzz:  http://johnpaul4usa.blogspot.com.
  • My Facebook page -  please "like" if you have a Facebook account.
  • My Twitter page - Please "follow" me if you're also on Twitter.

Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools below!

voters, we will quickly become a permanent minority party.  
I started this project because I, as an experienced marketing
 professional, can no longer stand by as I see radical progressives 
succeed with the younger generation and other groups, while conservatives remain divided and continue with 
the same old and failed methods.  I also believe that the Republican 
party is in need of real change within its ranks, and that the conservative movement 
needs to become more inclusive of Americans of all stripes.  With the growing divisions within the GOP, we need to reshape the party's image and brand to attract a new, younger and evolving audience.
Cues for Conservatives is a book that I've written -
 and a multimedia movement I've started - that focuses on how the Left has managed 
to win Millennial voters and other key demographics, and how 
conservatives can use some of these same methods, in addition to some 
bold new tactics of our own, to unite our movement and win them back. 



  What We Need & What You Get Your contributions will help fund the production and publishing of my 
book, Cues for Conservatives; send a copy to every conservative and independent member of Congress; produce a series of short, high quality animated 
videos highlighting the chapters in my book; and build a 
website and social media campaign to promote our message to Millennials and all Americans. 
The fundraising target goal is $50,000 to cover our expenses for the items above.
Go the "Gallery" tab above to view a video highlighting Chapter 2: The State of Our Country Today, and a Brief, Urgent Case for
Conservatism; this video illustrates the style and quality of the videos we intend to produce to highlight selected chapters of Cues.  Videos are the best way to get reach and engage our target audience.
If we exceed our fundraising goals - which we hope to do - we will be able to produce additional videos, expand our social media reach and ideally hold Cues events in key locations in the US to further spread and promote our message.  My goal is to reach millions of voters to Bring America Forward.  
In return for your generous contributions, you will be able to support our cause, get a digital or print copy of Cues, and more.  You can participate in supporting the new conservative movement and help save our country from the radical progressive agenda.

  Risks & Challenges
Cues for Conservatives, in year in progress, has been written, and two videos have been produced and completed.   If we don't raise our target funding (hopefully, we will exceed our target), the project will forge on; the first priority will be producing, printing and shipping the copies of Cues that were ordered, followed by the production of the videos and sending copies out to conservative and independent members of Congress.     Other Ways You Can Help Some just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Please help get the word out, make some noise about the campaign, and share with your friends and family.

Here are links to my blog and social media accounts where you can follow me and this project:
My blog, John Paul's Conservative Buzz:  http://johnpaul4usa.blogspot.com. 

My Facebook page -  please "like" if you have a Facebook account.
My Twitter page - Please "follow" me if you're also on Twitter. 

   Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools below!

story:
WELCOME TO MY INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

In the world of creation, marketing and funding are necessary.

For those with talent but no means to achieve their goals, this is the only way.

Success demands money, contacts, and more.

But hey, two outta three goals to achieve certainly ain't bad!

Welcome to my largest undertaking thus far.  In order to get more eyes on my book series "The Generalist," and other works, I am seeking two thousand dollars in order to pay off a professional marketing team to get me in the newspapers, radio, and whatever television show will have me.

Alongside this endeavor, I'll also be financing a west coast book tour, hitting up the best conventions, libraries, book stores, and just about any place that'll have me.

It takes money to get money, and it's the one thing I really don't have.

I'm asking for your help, your support and, above all, your attention.

Bring your friends to this Indiegogo campaign!  Go like the following page, then spread it around:

The Generalist - http://www.facebook.com/generalistmarketing

WHAT IS "THE GENERALIST" ABOUT?

Want to learn more about the action adventure, urban fantasy series "The Generalist?"  Dig the following synopsis:

Action. Adventure. Fist to face. The Generalist is a hard-hitting ride through the Los Angeles of tomorrow, stuffed to the brim with monster-gene humans turned cannibal, Artifacts of enormous strength warping the very fabric of reality itself, secret organizations seeking to out-maneuver each other for ultimate power, and every day a simple miracle just to survive.

And who's standing between the rest of us "mundane citizens" and the myriad forces that seek to devour and conquer this world and those beyond?

The two violence-prone action junkies of the Shop: Frank Todd, the Generalist, and Daniel "Dash" Hopkins, his troll-gened companion and partner-in-crime.

Taking on all foes and challenges no matter how great or small, the Shop will do the job, get the pay, and woe betide any and all who dare to thwart their will!

The Generalist! Because you simply cannot read about people getting punched in the face ENOUGH!

I LIKE WHAT I'M SEEING, BUT CAN I TRY BEFORE I BUY?

You actually can.  Yes, for a dollar you can get the first book in the series digitally, that's true...

But if you'd rather read it for free THEN donate a dollar, feel free to do so using the following links:

Amazon (for U.S. readers) - goo.gl/Zan2x1
Smashwords (for International readers) - goo.gl/1MLkdw

WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?

What's more important than a single dollar from you is the assistance you can provide.  I NEED your strength and your aid, now more so than ever.

Share it on your pages, your groups, your websites, your radio shows, your friends and family, hell bring me somebody you hate and I'll kneecap 'em for a donation that's less than the market average!

I thank you for your time, for taking the time to read this and for your help.


~Thomas Duder, Author of the Things

The Pen Is My Sword - http://www.thepenismysword.com
FB Author Page - http://www.facebook.com/AuthorOfTheThings
Anubis Unit - http://www.anubisunit.com
FB Anubis Unit - http://www.facebook.com/AnubisUnit
FB The Generalist - http://www.facebook.com/GeneralistMarketing

story:
What would I like us to achieve?

Stress, anxiety and trauma touch almost everyone at some point in life. For some it’s a fleeting glimpse. For others it’s being continually managed. There are some for whom, it wrecks their lives.

With your help and support, I’d like us to help more people overcome different types of stress …and then support them to achieve their personal goals!

I’d like us to fund and produce a workbook. A practical self help resource that: 

  • Coaches people through a process of identifying opportunities for personal change. 
  • Provides tools to overcome past issues, present mental obstacles and future psychological challenges. 
  • Teaches us how to achieve personal goals by modelling excellence and creating high performance states of mind.


Tell me more about the workbook.

The workbook will contain:

  • Information about types of stress, anxiety and trauma. 
  • Concepts about the mind and how we think and learn. 
  • Details of how we process stress, anxiety and trauma. 
  • Easy to learn techniques that diminish the effect of stress, anxiety and trauma. 
  • Tools that you can use to build high performance states and achieve more. 
  • Information on how we can learn to model the excellence of others.

Bottom line …the workbook will be inspirational, a learning guide and a practical resource to help people create a new perspective, and write a new story for their life.

One step at a time or should we run?

For the initial funding goal the workbook will be in an electronic format (i.e Kindle/iBook etc). However should we get enough support, then I will endeavour to get a print version out.

The latter scenario is totally dependent on how much support the community provides. Feel free to go full steam ahead and breach that funding goal …and the hard copy is a possibility.


Why am I doing this?

I’m doing this because I’ve been there …read the book …got the t-shirt. I want to help people overcome these issues as I did. Anyone can change.

I’ve experienced stress, anxiety and trauma, maybe you have too. I have been involved in two car crashes. Once as a passenger and once as the driver.

After many years of trying to deal with the fall out I got lucky. …I became aware of, learned and used; a variety of mental techniques and tools from various alternative therapy disciplines. These mental exercises have helped me to overcome and resolve challenging mental states.

So for me, no more flashbacks. No more public speaking anxiety. No more fear of success. No more being nervous of new situations. Increased confidence and self esteem. Public speaking goal reached. The aim of teaching personal development achieved. Yes ...I'm now a coach and teach these tools for a living.

It's not all doom and hard times though. Yes you have to be real about these issues. You also have to have a sense of humour. So have a laugh ...here is a cat with a hat photoshopped onto it. 



How can I support our project?

  • Actively share this Indiegogo project in your social media streams.
  • Inform anyone you know who may have an interest.
  • If you can contribute by helping to fund the book.
  • Make suggestions and get involved in the conversation.
  • All of the above!


What about progress?

I'll commit to a video update once a week. I'll let you know what happened the week prior to the update and what I have planned for the following week. I'll also answer any questions that I think may be relevant to the community.


Rewards.

Can you see yourself grabbing one of these:

  • Inspirational emails with links to uplifting and thought provoking content.
  • Copies of the e-book (Kindle, iBook) so you can work on your own development.
  • Some rewards see multiple copies that you can gift to people who may need them.
  • There will be a Facebook Q&A for contributors to learn more.
  • A hypnosis recording is up for grabs.
  • Can you see yourself with one of the special edition hardbacks.
  • Have a look at the Skype calls that are just waiting to be snapped up.
  • I already teach personal transformation workshops using these tools. One of the project rewards will have me running some live workshops where we get the support to do this. For organisations or groups of people who pull together …we’ll discuss how we can achieve this.

As with all projects …some rewards are limited. Time is of the essence. Don’t miss out.


Risks & Challenges

A: 

1. Challenge: I need to learn the technical aspects of producing the e-book.

Solution: As an former business analyst I imagine I'll be able to investigate, understand and resolve this process.

2. Challenge: I need to do some research and approach a publisher should the funding goal be breached adequately enough. Self publishing a short run in order to provide the rewards we have offered also has to be investigated. 

Solution: Should we get sufficient funds to produce a paperback/hardback copy, then further investigation will be required. I’ll call on any help I can get and have already been researching publishing options. 

3. Please feel free to offer suggestions for any of the above. General comments and feedback are also welcomed.


Who are you? 

My name is John Hannah. I’m an alternative therapist, personal development trainer and transformation coach. I’ve been involved in personal transformation work for over 11 years.

Teaching personal development courses and working as a mind coach means using various tools and techniques from the world of personal coaching, NLP, new code, EMT, EFT, hypnosis, meditation, ancestral patterns and other modalities. We can remove the mental barriers that hold us back.

I’ve helped people to resolve issues such as: 

  • Everyday work and home related stress 
  • Relationship issues 
  • Anxiety and depression 
  • Physical and mental abuse 
  • Abandonment issues 
  • Traumatic events 
  • Anxiety disorders 
  • Phobia (social, heights, spiders, being in open spaces …etc)

It’s not all about getting over stuff. Once we remove the mental barriers that afflict many people; we can also create the mental states required for us to achieve excellence in our own lives.

I’ve helped people to build high performance states and create: 

Social confidence 
  • Increased sports performance 
  • Learning focus 
  • Career change 
  • Improved relationships 
  • Calm and peace 
  • Lifestyle changes 

The funding will allow us to:

  • Work on the project full time so we can deliver this workbook asap.
  • Pay someone where I’d like to include illustrations. 
  • Produce process maps of each technique. 
  • Research and collate some inspirational material. 
  • Get IBSN book numbers. 
  • I’ll have to research how to produce the book in different electronic formats and buy whatever apps I need to do that.

The future. 

To begin there’s this book and possibly a second edition. Somewhere down the line I’d like to develop an online video course, and launch a mobile app. The rest of this work is for another day however.

This is just the beginning of our journey I'm fully committed to achieving a positive outcome and completing this project. So let's concentrate in get the book out first!

Let's get to work!

Yes ...let's get to work.

story:
It all started by mistake, I decided to become a stay home Mom after many years of being an employ, it's been over two years now.

Being at home gave me an extra time to play with my little kids, one of those times we invented a cards game which we loved so much and decided to market it.

In the process of writing the game instruction I noticed that it sounded more like a short story more than a game instruction, and then it hit me that I have a short story on my hand.

From there it took off amazingly and I end up writing a series of short stories, 5 so far, each is an adventure with the Octo-bunch, the Octo-Bunch is a group of eight adorable colorful creatures who wake up each time to find a mystery happening in their town.

One time their colors got switched around, the second time their emotions got confused on another time a visit to the zoo turned out to be a hilarious and funny day and so it keeps on in each following book.

Each adventure comes to an end when the Octo-Bunch find a solution and get to fix the "problem".

Each adventure has an important lesson and added learning values for the little readers, using humor, fun rhymes and adorable illustrations.

There will be also attached to some of the books an actual prop / device that will give the children a tangible experience, so that they can see, touch or play with the device to experience better the theme of the story.

I hope to get your help to make this amazing bunch comes to life and enrich children's life everywhere.

Thank you
