story:
Overview


The book is a guide that explicates upon the mysterious yet effective form of leadership that occurs behind the curtains of various industries. I wrote it because I wanted to highlight the misconceptions of traditional leadership and present an accessible leadership guide that could allow individuals from various backgrounds to unleash their basic yet essential skills that could maximize not only their leadership capacity, but also their life potential to a new degree! My book will publish in April 2020!

The Modest Leader: A Low Key Guide on Shifting Your Focus to What Matters includes a brief insight on the historical application of leadership and delineates a redefining way of approaching leading in everyday life. This is further supplemented by profound insights and application on reaching a higher purpose and a more sustainable state of happiness.

My name is Baha Sharafi and I am the author of the Modest Leader. What is not heavily emphasized or present in society is the notion that you can be powerful and influential regardless of the tangible and non-tangible assets that you possess. I want to write something in which is applicable to one's daily life and can be enjoyably read by parents, teens and/or professionals. I wrote this book because I hope to dissipate this idea that a title is only viable to the extent that we hold it significant; in other-words, I want to project that we can all be leaders of value even if we do not possess a title or some monetary status. Most importantly, I desire to shift the way people look at life's happiness and redefine interpersonal interactions. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the intricacies of your inner potential of being a leader at any stage you currently are in your life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for servant leadership in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to ignite the fire inside of you and ignite the fundamental characteristics that can help you exceed in various components of your life, regardless of your occupation or background.

In this book, you'll learn about:

  • Happiness Expectation vs. Reality
  • People Using vs People Building
  • Power Concentration vs Power Sharing

You will love this book if you are seeking a light-hearted and productive guide that exfoliates the misconceptions that surround the purpose of leadership and success, if you are looking to find a degree of contentment beyond tangible means and if you are striving to brighten your inner light-bulb and reflect that upon others through different mediums.

The Modern Leader is a non-fiction book that speaks to students in high school, college and people in their professional careers who are looking at pursuing meaning into that desire driven career and unleashing their leadership powers in way in which society has yet to emphasize, the side of leadership society does not talk about.


 

The Book-The Modest Leader: A Low Key Guide on Shifting Your Focus to What Matters

This book addresses three main elements: leadership's past, unseen present, and the opportunity of growth. To tailor this book towards a variety of audiences with various interests in the domain of leadership, Modest Leader is written in the following 4 parts:

Part 1 Renovation of Society’s Expectations. Fasten your seats belts as this section contains the introduction + introductory chapters that acquaints the reader with the world of leadership, what it has been, what people may see it as and the new approach towards leadership.

Part 2 Augment the Content. This is the golden section of this guide, where you, reader will get the ability to dive into the key components of being not just a leader but an effective everyday leader. Furthermore you will gain profound, research based insight from decades of credible resources such as the Harvard Business Review where you will begin to understand how these tactics have been successful. From the CEO of PepsiCo to acclaimed medical professionals you will see how these invaluable skills can facilitate in improving the value of your life.

Part  3 Here is the Destination Application where you reader will now not only have been exposed to the tactics and ways of some of the world’s best leaders, but now you finally use their keys to unlock the doors that await your future. This will contain remarks from some of the world’s brightest international leaders who will give their insight on how to foster these various skills, such as stimulating empathy and enhancing communication within your daily life, regardless of your current occupation. 

Part 4 Finally we reach the Conclusion Allusion, where the book ends with my personal insight and a glimpse of how I see meaning in life. Here it may seem that it has come to an end, but this book's end marks the beginning of your journey to seeing life in a rather more pleasant way.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this April

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Baha Sharafi is a young Iranian American professional from the University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelor of Arts in Health and Society with a concentration in Health Policy and Economics. She has had an expansive history of leadership roles both in a formal education setting and in the business workplace. These roles allowed her to become further acquainted with the nature of hierarchies inherent to various industries, namely in that of healthcare. She has been invited to present her work on Servant Leadership in a variety of conferences. Baha hopes to one day work in the public sector to help individual obtain access to treatment and bridge the disparities that currently exist medical care.

Baha wrote this book because she has a profound passion towards the progression of society in the discipline of leadership and fulfillment. She exhibits curiosity in the outlook that people have on life and is intrigued by the interactions that people have on a daily basis. Baha finds herself being engrossed with hearing people's story and what contributes to their definition of flourishing success.

Baha or "lil baja" as her friends call her, is an Iranian-American currently residing in Houston, Texas. She enjoys the art of yoga, the presence of palm trees and watching gradient sun-sets, for it reminds her another day of opportunity is ahead. Baha is by no means a "Where is Waldo" situation. You can often find Baha thinking she is in the Bahamas as she is constantly wearing an over-sized Hawaiian shirt most every where she goes. 

This book is a call to action to inspire a new perspective to a fulfilling leadership role and change the way in which people experience life's interactions

For more information, you can connect with Baha via email at baharehsharafi@yahoo.com

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheModestLeader and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Baha :)

You will love this book if you are seeking a light-hearted and productive guide that exfoliates the misconceptions that surround the purpose of leadership and success, if you are looking to find a degree of contentment beyond tangible means and if you are striving to brighten your inner light-bulb and reflect that upon others through different mediums.The Modern Leader is a non-fiction book that speaks to students in high school, college and people in their professional careers who are looking at pursuing meaning into that desire driven career and unleashing their leadership powers in way in which society has yet to emphasize, the side of leadership society does not talk about. The Book-The Modest Leader: A Low Key Guide on Shifting Your Focus to What MattersThis book addresses three main elements: leadership's past, unseen present, and the opportunity of growth. To tailor this book towards a variety of audiences with various interests in the domain of leadership, Modest Leader is written in the following 4 parts:Part 1 Renovation of Society’s Expectations. Fasten your seats belts as this section contains the introduction + introductory chapters that acquaints the reader with the world of leadership, what it has been, what people may see it as and the new approach towards leadership.Part 2 Augment the Content. This is the golden section of this guide, where you, reader will get the ability to dive into the key components of being not just a leader but an effective everyday leader. Furthermore you will gain profound, research based insight from decades of credible resources such as the Harvard Business Review where you will begin to understand how these tactics have been successful. From the CEO of PepsiCo to acclaimed medical professionals you will see how these invaluable skills can facilitate in improving the value of your life.Part  3 Here is the Destination Application where you reader will now not only have been exposed to the tactics and ways of some of the world’s best leaders, but now you finally use their keys to unlock the doors that await your future. This will contain remarks from some of the world’s brightest international leaders who will give their insight on how to foster these various skills, such as stimulating empathy and enhancing communication within your daily life, regardless of your current occupation. Part 4 Finally we reach the Conclusion Allusion, where the book ends with my personal insight and a glimpse of how I see meaning in life. Here it may seem that it has come to an end, but this book's end marks the beginning of your journey to seeing life in a rather more pleasant way. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this April
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...
About the AuthorBaha Sharafi is a young Iranian American professional from the University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelor of Arts in Health and Society with a concentration in Health Policy and Economics. She has had an expansive history of leadership roles both in a formal education setting and in the business workplace. These roles allowed her to become further acquainted with the nature of hierarchies inherent to various industries, namely in that of healthcare. She has been invited to present her work on Servant Leadership in a variety of conferences. Baha hopes to one day work in the public sector to help individual obtain access to treatment and bridge the disparities that currently exist medical care.Baha wrote this book because she has a profound passion towards the progression of society in the discipline of leadership and fulfillment. She exhibits curiosity in the outlook that people have on life and is intrigued by the interactions that people have on a daily basis. Baha finds herself being engrossed with hearing people's story and what contributes to their definition of flourishing success.Baha or "lil baja" as her friends call her, is an Iranian-American currently residing in Houston, Texas. She enjoys the art of yoga, the presence of palm trees and watching gradient sun-sets, for it reminds her another day of opportunity is ahead. Baha is by no means a "Where is Waldo" situation. You can often find Baha thinking she is in the Bahamas as she is constantly wearing an over-sized Hawaiian shirt most every where she goes. This book is a call to action to inspire a new perspective to a fulfilling leadership role and change the way in which people experience life's interactionsFor more information, you can connect with Baha via email at baharehsharafi@yahoo.comRisks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheModestLeader and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Baha :)

story:
I have been writing almost constantly since I was a kid, it was my outlet, my safe haven, my home. Every point in my life where I felt lost, sad, afraid....I can draw a line to how much I was writing. The less writing I did, the worse I felt. The last few years, I have been working on bettering myself and digging myself out of the hole I put myself in. And I have been writing. A LOT.

I feel like the time is right to share it, damn the consequences, and close off a chapter of my life. So, I am putting out a new collection of writing entitled 'Fuck You, I Love You', it is the first collection of my writing in about 20 years. I can't look back at my old work without cringing, but the new(er) stuff I am pretty proud of.

'Fuck You, I Love You' is a reference, not only to a relationship I was in for a number of years that was toxic on both sides, but also a recognition that we have all been through a relationship, whether it is a friend, family member or partner, that hasn't been positive even though we may love the other person. I've been the person who earned the derision, and I've felt the same about other people. 

Writing these pieces was my way of dealing with my feelings: the love, the pain, the joy and sadness that relationships with others and with myself. I'm not expecting to become a best selling author based on this collection, but I truly hope that it will not only entertain you, but at some point will help someone to not feel so alone in their feelings. If something I write helps one person, mission accomplished.

To that end, a portion of all of the proceeds from the sales of 'Fuck You, I Love You' will be donated to a men's mental health fund here in Thunder Bay. You can find out more about The Andrew Miedema Foundation here.

I have also teamed up with the amazing people at Hooligan Fuel Hot Sauce to create a bourbon infused hot sauce (also called 'Fuck You, I Love You') that will be making it's debut here! 

A big thank you goes out to the folks at Hooligan Fuel Hot Sauce (find out more about them here) as well as to their other amazing project, the Spice of Life Initiative which helped to bring this project to life (find out more about that, here).

And thank you to You, for reading this far, and for your support!

story:
About this Project

Environmental racism is indicative to the fact that racism can affect an individual’s environment for the intended purpose of allowing the access to clean water and basic human rights being limited in certain areas that are largely populated by minority groups for profit.

So, how do we overcome this level of racial inequality? And why don’t many of us know we are subjected to it?

Hello, I am Nadia Fischer, Social Justice Activist and Publicist.

In my new book, My Water Has Never Been Clean,  will attempt to take you on a journey of self-disclosure and allow you intimate access to a little girl's personal experiences, when basic water rights and justice collide. This little girl will reveal the pains of her past, define the nature of the present and her obsession for a better future for humanity.

I am asking for your support to bring this book to completion, launch and print so that it may be published in January 2021.

What I Need

My Water Has Never Been Clean is incredibly close to completion and launch, and I need my community's help to make it all the way! All proceeds from this campaign will go towards the finishing costs of bringing this book to market, including editing, copy-editing, formatting, printing and shipping. $850.00 will support me in publishing both digital and paperback forms.

I believe that to publish does NOT mean to diminish the quality or reach of this work! Therefore, I have not skimped on any finishing step, design or detail. I am committed to doing it the right way and all the way. 

Why This Book is Needed in the World

As a little girl, I knew there was something wrong with the water and how the cultural shift was having a negative impact on my community. I looked everywhere outside myself for the answers and to fix the issues. Discouragingly enough, I didn’t find them.

Then one day, all of that changed… I began an inward journey to discover my true voice; which is activism.

My heart breaks every day witnessing so many people who look me that struggle with trying to be equal and not be judged by the color of their skin.

I am a sensitive and soulful African American woman, I too walked through the world carrying these realities and how the world views my culture. This is a heavy burden that no one should have to bare. 

The reality is that people of color have been carrying these burdens for many generations, and thus, the wounds begin early in childhood and run very deep. Just as it did for me.

It wasn’t always easy. Confronting all the racially closed doors and constantly telling myself that I am equal significantly challenged me to my core.

But it was also so worth it! Because with each wounding burden, I learned to heal and release. I discovered a new truth about who I really am as a woman of color. With each new truth, I took another step towards living the life that would bring me real happiness and fulfillment and that is fighting for the unjust.

I invite you to come on a journey of self-discovery and revelation. Of deep, soul healing that will crack you wide open. In My Water Has Never Been Clean, I share it all, from my struggles and heartache, to my greatest breakthrough moments.

And as you follow along, you will discover the truths behind your own wounding beliefs. About how uniquely worthy, powerful and human you are.

This is the book that I, once upon a time, so desperately needed. It could have saved me from years of heartache and struggle of the harsh realities of racism. It is the book that I know will change minds, heal hearts and transform the lives of so many.

About Nadia Fischer, The Author

At the impressionable age of eight years old, Nadia witnessed firsthand the physical and mental health consequences of what incarceration does to families and communities when her eldest brother received ten to twenty years as a first time, non-violent offender. Over the next ten years as Nadia visited her brother in prison she vowed to always be his advocate and to stand up against unfairness and injustice.
 
In 2014, Nadia established “Incarceration Relief Resource Center,” a non-profit organization dedicated to faith and community-based interventions for offender re-entry. IRRC is a nationwide social justice advocacy organization with the mission to reduce incarceration and improve outcomes for system-involved offenders. IRRC assists offenders to successfully re-enter their communities by helping to provide housing, employment, education, access to effective mental health, chemical dependency, primary care treatment services, government assistance programs, and spiritual connectedness. To date, Nadia has been the conduit for the release of 102 returning citizens, with 0% recidivism.
 
A native of Flint, Michigan, Nadia has a special interest in clean water and agriculture. She is a strong advocate for improved food and water products in the prison system. Through her work and research, she believes there is a direct link between the substandard food and water that is served and the resulting behaviors of prisoners. Nadia has been commended for her work by such notables as Attorney Mark Osler, author of Jesus on Death Row and Bryan Stevenson, founder and Executive Director of the Equal Justice Initiative who dubbed her a “freedom fighter.”
 
As the Chair of the Cincinnati NAACP Prison Branch Committee and the Community Lead for MOBB United, Nadia is charged with extending community and educational resources to returning citizens as well as emotional encouragement to support hurting, brokenhearted moms of incarcerated sons. The emotional aftermath of incarceration is often overlooked by the judicial system and the public when families lose their loved ones to the system. Nadia’s goal is to raise global awareness of the silent cries and deep emotional trauma experienced by the population that she serves. Nadia is passionately dedicated to the work she sees as her calling. She is sustained by her faith in God and inspired by these words of Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr."...injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere....caught in an inescapable network of mutuality, tied in a single garment of destiny. Whatever affects one directly affects all indirectly. Never again can we afford to live with the narrow, provincial 'outside agitator' idea. Anyone who lives inside the United States can never be considered an outsider" (Letter from Birmingham Jail).
 
Nadia resides in Cincinnati, Ohio. She is the proud Mother of one son (Sean) and wonderful aunt to Annalicia and Andre. In her spare time she enjoys traveling, singing, reading, and working with youth who are living in adverse risk environments.

story:
About This Campaign

I am a former software developer turned entrepreneur. In 1996 I bootstrapped my own software development business out of a spare bedroom and grew it into a multi-million-dollar company. I learned  the hard way, by making many mistakes, how to transition from being a successful developer to a successful businessman.

After 20+ years as the CEO of the business, I sold my stake in the company to my younger business partner who will take it on to the next stage of its life. It was time for me to channel my energy into other projects that I'd always wanted to do. 

During my time as CEO of the business I built up a huge well of knowledge and experience about how to grow and operate a profitable software development business. I knew this knowledge would be very valuable to other developers thinking of starting their own business and I wanted to try and capture it in a book. But I struggled to find the time to do this while I was working.

My exit from the business got me thinking about writing the book. Then Covid-19 came along. It proved to be a great time for me to start the process of capturing my experience in book form. In the region where I live we were put under tight lockdown restrictions for a number of months so I was housebound for much of the time. I used the writing process as a way to keep myself busy during that time. As I got into the writing process I found that it flowed very easily and I really enjoyed it. Over a period of about 6 months and hundreds of hours of writing I managed to get the main manuscript completed.

Since then I've been learning all about book publishing. And what a very confusing world that is. I never really encountered writer's block. I found that I could always keep writing. But I've really struggled with publisher's block.

The more I looked at traditional publishing the more involved it became and the more I didn't like it. As an unknown author it was going to be a bit of a slog to get published. Finding agents, dealing with publishers, pitching my book etc. etc. didn't really float my boat. It also looked like it would take a long time to get the book to market even if I was successful in finding a publisher.

I also discovered that traditional publishers have a lot of control over how the book is marketed and sold. I wanted to be able to offer more than just a book but that wouldn't be possible if I went down the traditional route.

So I decided to self-publish the book but that opened a whole other world of challenges. I've spent many of the recent weeks trying to learn all about self-publishing and getting the book ready for publication. I've learned how to use a number of new software packages that help in the publishing process. I've also invested in many activities such as cover design, book formatting, editing to name a few, just to get to the point where I can think about launching the book.

I'm almost there. I believe that I have written a great book. It's the type of book I wish I had been able to read BEFORE I set up my business. It would have stopped me making the mistakes I made. It would also have saved me significant amounts of money. But more than that. It would have shown me the fast-track to success. It would also have given me the confidence to launch my business earlier than I did. It would have reduced my fears about my abilities to grow a company because I would have known the processes to follow to achieve success.

I now need to remove that final hurdle in my publisher's block. I need that final kick to get me to take the remaining steps to get the book out there. Once I know that there are people out there who want to read my book then that will be the final bit of motivation that I need to work through the publishing process and get the book printed.

I've identified a company that will help me get through the final stages of the self-publishing process. If this campaign is a success I will pay them from the funding and begin working with them immediately. I would hope to get the book printed and ready for distribution within 4-6 weeks after that.

I will keep all backers posted on the final stages of publishing and the expected ship date of the book. In advance of this you will receive an electronic copy of the book so you can begin reading even before the printed book arrives.

What You Get

When you back my campaign you will be one of the first people to get a copy of the printed book before it releases to the normal book publishing outlets. And for backers only, I will also add in a digital copy of the book as well as an additional eBook that complements the book - My 21 Growth Hacks. This ebook adds a whole bunch of ideas that you can apply to grow your business. This three-fer is not something that will be offered through any other channel.

I mentioned above that I wanted to be able to offer more than a book. One thing I've always been conscious about is that most How-To books are just the beginning when you are learning something new. My book is full of real nuggets of information and some people will be happy to take those nuggets and go and launch their own software business. But other people will feel they want more hand-holding as they work towards having their own business. 

I've already been asked by some people if I will be offering any coaching or mentoring to go along with the book so if this is something that interests you, I've structured some perks to allow you to choose the level of coaching that you would like. I've previously coached developers looking to grow a business and here's what one of my students, Dedrick, said:-

"I don't think I'll ever outgrow coaching from Paul. He's done exactly what I want to do so he has a wealth of experience. He can see the bad before it happens due to his experience and he can help me check my blind spots. I hope to have check-ins with him even after we are roaring well past our first 7-figure client."

I've also developed an online course that follows the structure of the book. I've narrated this myself and it fleshes out the content of the book in more detail. This course previously sold for up to $10k but as a backer you can access this for a fraction of that cost.

Here are the details of the perks.

Action Taker Perk

As a first step, you might feel that you need some guidance. You might be nervous or undecided about starting a business. Or you may have questions about the process of starting up. You may have some ideas that need validating. You may be uncertain about whether the skills you have are enough to build a successful business. Whatever it is that needs answering about starting a software development business then you can book a 30-minute call with me. I'll give you the benefit of my experience and aim to guide you on the right path to follow.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book,
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 30 minute advisory call with me

 

Bootstrapper Silver Perk

With this perk you get 6 months access to my Private Facebook coaching group. Members take part in a monthly group call where I will address key topics about setting up a successful software development business along with a regular Q&A session. It's your chance to learn from me as you and other bootstrappers go through your entrepreneurial journey.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book,
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 6 months membership of my private Facebook coaching group

 

Bootstrapper Gold Perk

With this perk you get 12 months access to my Private Facebook coaching group. Members take part in a monthly group call where I will address key topics about setting up a successful software development business along with a regular Q&A session. It's your chance to learn from me as you and other bootstrappers go through your entrepreneurial journey.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 12 months membership of my private Facebook coaching group

 

Bootstrapper Platinum Perk

With this premium perk you get 12 months access to my Private Facebook coaching group. Members take part in a monthly group call where I will address key topics about setting up a successful software development business along with a regular Q&A session. It's your chance to learn from me as you and other bootstrappers go through your entrepreneurial journey. You also get unlimited access to my 8-module online training course (previously sold at up to $10k). This course complements the book and adds additional detail and advice. In addition you'll get a personal 1-hour mentoring call with me where I'll focus specifically on your business plans.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 12 months membership of my private Facebook coaching group
  • unlimited access to my 8-module online training course
  • 1-hour personal mentoring call with me

 

Achiever Perk

This exclusive perk is for high achievers who are serious about starting their own business. Get all the Bootstrapper Platinum perks (paperback, digital version, 21 Growth Hacks ebook, private Facebook group, 12 x monthly coaching call, online 8-module training course). In addition, you get 12 one-on-one mentoring calls with me where I will personally guide you through your first 12 months in your new business. Together we'll be able to focus on getting your business up and running and then working towards you landing your first 7-figure client.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 12 months membership of my private Facebook coaching group
  • unlimited access to my 8-module online training course
  • 12 x 1-hour personal mentoring calls with me

 

Owner Perk

If you already have a software business but are struggling to grow it to 7 figures then I would recommend the Owner perk. If you sign up to this perk then I will review your current operation and then, on a monthly call with you and your team, I'll work with you over the following 12 months to help you break through the growth challenges you are experiencing.

This is what you get with this perk

  • paperback book
  • digital book
  • my 21 Growth Hacks ebook
  • 12 months membership of my private Facebook coaching group
  • unlimited access to my 8-module online training course
  • review of your existing business with recommendations
  • 12 x 1-hour personal mentoring calls with me for you and your team
     

Risks & Challenges

The main risk in backing any book campaign is this; will the book get written? That is no longer a risk on this campaign as the writing has been done. All 250 pages of it.

The biggest challenge remaining is getting the book published and delivered to the backers. As previously mentioned, I've identified a company that will take me through the final stages of the publishing process so I believe that this challenge will be easily overcome.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher I use. At the moment this has not been decided on but I will be looking to work with a publisher who can get the book to you within 4-6 weeks after closing this campaign. I'll keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book nears publication. Regardless of this, you will be receiving the digital copy of the book once the final proofing has been signed off. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute but that doesn't mean you can't help. Some ways I'd appreciate your help include:

  • Please share this pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your developer friends.
  • Please use #MillionaireDeveloper and tag me, @thesoftwareboss, so I can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt:
About This Campaign
I am a former software developer turned entrepreneur. In 1996 I bootstrapped my own software development business out of a spare bedroom and grew it into a multi-million-dollar company. I learned  the hard way, by making many mistakes, how to transition from being a successful developer to a successful businessman.
After 20+ years as the CEO of the business, I sold my stake in the company to my younger business partner who will take it on to the next stage of its life. It was time for me to channel my energy into other projects that I'd always wanted to do. 
During my time as CEO of the business I built up a huge well of knowledge and experience about how to grow and operate a profitable software development business. I knew this knowledge would be very valuable to other developers thinking of starting their own business and I wanted to try and capture it in a book. But I struggled to find the time to do this while I was working.
My exit from the business got me thinking about writing the book. Then Covid-19 came along. It proved to be a great time for me to start the process of capturing my experience in book form. In the region where I live we were put under tight lockdown restrictions for a number of months so I was housebound for much of the time. I used the writing process as a way to keep myself busy during that time. As I got into the writing process I found that it flowed very easily and I really enjoyed it. Over a period of about 6 months and hundreds of hours of writing I managed to get the main manuscript completed.
Since then I've been learning all about book publishing. And what a very confusing world that is. I never really encountered writer's block. I found that I could always keep writing. But I've really struggled with publisher's block.
The more I looked at traditional publishing the more involved it became and the more I didn't like it. As an unknown author it was going to be a bit of a slog to get published. Finding agents, dealing with publishers, pitching my book etc. etc. didn't really float my boat. It also looked like it would take a long time to get the book to market even if I was successful in finding a publisher.
I also discovered that traditional publishers have a lot of control over how the book is marketed and sold. I wanted to be able to offer more than just a book but that wouldn't be possible if I went down the traditional route.
So I decided to self-publish the book but that opened a whole other world of challenges. I've spent many of the recent weeks trying to learn all about self-publishing and getting the book ready for publication. I've learned how to use a number of new software packages that help in the publishing process. I've also invested in many activities such as cover design, book formatting, editing to name a few, just to get to the point where I can think about launching the book.
I'm almost there. I believe that I have written a great book. It's the type of book I wish I had been able to read BEFORE I set up my business. It would have stopped me making the mistakes I made. It would also have saved me significant amounts of money. But more than that. It would have shown me the fast-track to success. It would also have given me the confidence to launch my business earlier than I did. It would have reduced my fears about my abilities to grow a company because I would have known the processes to follow to achieve success.
I now need to remove that final hurdle in my publisher's block. I need that final kick to get me to take the remaining steps to get the book out there. Once I know that there are people out there who want to read my book then that will be the final bit of motivation that I need to work through the publishing process and get the book printed.
I've identified a company that will help me get through the final stages of the self-publishing process. If this campaign is a success I will pay them from the funding and begin working with them immediately. I would hope to get the book printed and ready for distribution within 4-6 weeks after that.
I will keep all backers posted on the final stages of publishing and the expected ship date of the book. In advance of this you will receive an electronic copy of the book so you can begin reading even before the printed book arrives.

What You Get
When you back my campaign you will be one of the first people to get a copy of the printed book before it releases to the normal book publishing outlets. And for backers only, I will also add in a digital copy of the book as well as an additional eBook that complements the book - My 21 Growth Hacks. This ebook adds a whole bunch of ideas that you can apply to grow your business. This three-fer is not something that will be offered through any other channel.
I mentioned above that I wanted to be able to offer more than a book. One thing I've always been conscious about is that most How-To books are just the beginning when you are learning something new. My book is full of real nuggets of information and some people will be happy to take those nuggets and go and launch their own software business. But other people will feel they want more hand-holding as they work towards having their own business. 
I've already been asked by some people if I will be offering any coaching or mentoring to go along with the book so if this is something that interests you, I've structured some perks to allow you to choose the level of coaching that you would like. I've previously coached developers looking to grow a business and here's what one of my students, Dedrick, said:-
"I don't think I'll ever outgrow coaching from Paul. He's done exactly what I want to do so he has a wealth of experience. He can see the bad before it happens due to his experience and he can help me check my blind spots. I hope to have check-ins with him even after we are roaring well past our first 7-figure client."
I've also developed an online course that follows the structure of the book. I've narrated this myself and it fleshes out the content of the book in more detail. This course previously sold for up to $10k but as a backer you can access this for a fraction of that cost.

As a first step, you might feel that you need some guidance. You might be nervous or undecided about starting a business. Or you may have questions about the process of starting up. You may have some ideas that need validating. You may be uncertain about whether the skills you have are enough to build a successful business. Whatever it is that needs answering about starting a software development business then you can book a 30-minute call with me. I'll give you the benefit of my experience and aim to guide you on the right path to follow.

story:
Here & There Magazine is a travel-based publication focusing on art, lifestyle and journal series from contributors around the world. Our online content showcases emerging talent and designs in various cities whereas our issues and curated city guides exclusively present artists, fashion, design and more intriguing features exclusive to one city.

Here & There Magazine is going to print!

We're ready to take the next step and bring our content to print. Our goal is to further your experience of each destination, transporting you from your sofa to places around the world. Not only does this give our readers the chance to unplug, but we think our issues and guides will make for an excellent coffee table display! Each of our publications feature stunning imagery, highlighted portrait interviews and descriptive exploring with pieces by locals and emerging creators.

Curated Guide to Halifax

To kick off our first printed publication, we will be showcasing the incredible talent and noteworthy areas around Atlantic Canada's largest city, Halifax, Nova Scotia, in our Curated Guide to Halifax. This past year has been like no other, and our whole team has pulled together to create our best work while staying close to home. We've worked hard to capture the spirit of Halifax, and we can't wait to share this beautiful coastal city with you this summer!

Here's How You Can Help

As a small, independent magazine, we need your support to cover the up-front cost of printing. In exchange for your support, we've created plenty of perks and exclusive experiences as a thank-you for being part of our creative community. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It’s been a hard year, and we understand if you can’t support us financially. You can still show your support by spreading the word and sharing our work on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter!

You can also visit our website to check out our online features and browse our previous work!

About Here & There Magazine

Here & There Magazine has always operated as a global and local publication, digitally since it was founded in 2015. Featuring cities like New York City, London, Montreal and Vienna, Here & There has over 500 daily readers, and 14.5k followers socially. Here & There has developed into an homage to independent artists and writers, bringing them onto a platform of a larger scale,  with our main goal to highlight the unique and intriguing elements of a destination and showcase the local talent within it. 

We're ready to take the next step and will be publishing your favourite issues for others to discover starting first with Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. From here, our goal will be to print one curated city guide and one city issue each year, while continuing to share online content with our audience. 

Who are we?

Founded in 2015, Here & There paused for a refresh and is relaunched in 2020 with a new site design and a new direction.

Aleyah Solomon is a photographer and creative designer and the head curator at the magazine.

Alexa Bouhelier-Ruelle is the editor and head writer.

Kristen Reid runs marketing and business.

Olivia Koetke is the social media manager.

Ayanoh Nakamoto is the assistant editor.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rus Minka Perlman. From the time I was 12 until I was 16, I thought my life was going nowhere.  I wrote this book as a companion for anyone who is battling life and needs and wantsto get back their power.  This book is full of the very tools that helped me heal. Help me get this book into the hands of teens struggling, and give them a reason to believe again.  

What We Need & What You Get

 The money raised will go toward publishing this book and getting it distributed. 

GIVING BACK:

When you donate $99 or more you will receive a free soft cover copy. They will be shipped out to you  in the beginning of April

 

The Impact

Publishing this book is the closing of a very long journey for me. I am deeply aware that I could not have gotten through some extremely difficult years without love and support. I am also aware that I was very lucky, and I know that many teens do not have this type of support and understanding. The loneliness can be overwhelming. I poured my intention for those teens into these pages, hoping to help them become their own best friend and reignite the spark they once had. Finding this spark can curb self-harming behavior and prevent suicide. 

Risks & Challenges

I am ready to fight to see this vision become a reality. There are a lot of books in the world and it may not be easy to get this book everywhere I want it to go, but I trust that He who led me to this vision will help me see it through.

Other Ways You Can Help

If it is not possible for you to contribute, I want to thank you anyway for visiting my page. Another way you can help is by sharing my campaign and spreading the word. Thank you!

story:
Present Salvation

A collaborative book between a visual artist in Seattle and a photographer in the Gambia, West Africa.

The name Present Salvation comes from a play on words combining our two names, Matthew and Essa.

For $15 plus shipping and tax you can help with the printing of this book and have a copy of your own.  A collection of photographs and watercolor illustrations based on Essa's village in the Gambia, West Africa.  The book will contain at least 10 watercolor drawings spread out over 20 pages and several photographs.  The book will also describe the unlikely partnership between Essa and Matthew.

6 months ago, Essa reached out through social media asking for help.  This made me very curious so we started talking through video chats and I learned more about him and his village.  After doing further online research we decided to work on a book together.  We will split the proceeds and the photographer hopes to start a business to support himself and his family, I will use my portion to do the same as well as work on future projects that help other people.  Any extra funds raised will go to Childfund and Interconnections.  Go to my website at www.mdjenkinsart.com or mdjenkinsart on instagram to see my previous projects and process videos. 

https://www.childfund.org/?MAID=53363&gclid...

https://interconnection.org/

As the 2 months of this project continue I will update the project with process videos and more information about how our unlikely collaboration came to be and my personal motivations about the project. 

I may also include other perks such as original artwork.

I promise that any books I mail out will be done so with the utmost care taken in terms of sanitation and care during this uncertain time.  If you have any questions or concerns I will do my best to answer them in an honest and timely manner.  

While this may seem like an odd time to release a project like this we have been working on this for a long time and I hope that if it is full filled it will show how we can still find ways to connect during times of social distancing.

Thank you for your support and please share,

Matthew

story:
1977magazine Vol. V:
rosso, giallo, blu


Prima di tutto, chi siamo?

1977 è una zine indipendente che si è evoluta dal web alla carta stampata con un volume annuale autoprodotto, e dalla comunicazione alla produzione tramite la creazione di eventi, workshop, talk e rassegne. Nata nel 2014, 1977 è una realtà tridimensionale in continua evoluzione, guarda al presente con una visione critica.

Determinazione, senso di appartenenza e spirito di squadra ci hanno permesso di crescere in questi anni, spingendoci a promuovere un'informazione indipendente, trasversale e inclusiva . Il 1977 è un anno di rivoluzioni che cambieranno per sempre la storia; allo stesso modo la nostra voce vuole rappresentare una svolta per la riflessione cinematografica e musicale italiana.


Perché partecipare a questa campagna?

Per aiutarci a rendere reale 1977magazine Vol. V: rosso, giallo, blu!

Al suo interno troverete contenuti che indagano il cinema e la musica contemporanei, intesi come luoghi testuali di scambio comunicativo col proprio target, come forme d’arte strettamente interconnesse al contesto storico in cui nascono e si diffondono. Ricondurre l'oggetto filmico o musicale all'interno di un frame socio-culturale di ampio respiro e interrogarlo significa infatti acquisire gli strumenti essenziali per interpretare il nostro presente, con uno sguardo consapevole del passato e lungimirante nei confronti del futuro.

1977magazine Vol. V: rosso, giallo, blu è diviso in 3 sezioni. Ogni sezione prende in analisi uno dei tre colori primari, con la sua portata simbolica a livello semiotico, antropologico, sociale ed emotivo, mettendolo in relazione al suo uso nella musica e nel cinema contemporanei.

Ci fermiamo qui per evitare spoiler e non rovinarvi la sorpresa ;)


Qual è il nostro obiettivo?

Crediamo nel valore materico e immanente della carta, per questo i nostri volumi cartacei sono oggetti di design che perdurano nel tempo e testimoniano una storia. Ognuno porta con sé il valore dei contenuti culturali che veicola, dei materiali con cui è stato prodotto, dei processi per realizzarlo e delle persone che vi hanno lavorato.

Ogni volume cartaceo di 1977 è una risposta all’esigenza di creare qualcosa di personale che resista alla velocità imperante nell’era digitale. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di conferire un nuovo statuto alla “vecchia” carta: trasformarla in un oggetto prezioso, da conservare e collezionare, che sia ecologico e sostenibile. Per questo la scelta della cadenza annuale, che ci permette di realizzare un prodotto ragionato e altamente curato in tutti i suoi aspetti. E la decisione di stampare utilizzando carta naturale (100 gr) e secondo la filosofia GreenPrinting, volta alla salvaguardia dell'ambiente attraverso l'uso di materiali a basso impatto ambientale e all'utilizzo di energia rinnovabile e automezzi a metano.

Fortemente convinti del valore dell'innovazione e delle potenzialità del digitale, determinati a creare un ponte tra passato e presente, i nostri volumi sono riviste che vanno "oltre la carta" grazie all’utilizzo della tecnologia dei QR code e della Realtà Aumentata.


Cosa ci serve e cosa otterrai in cambio?

Andiamo al dunque. Per realizzare il nostro prossimo volume cartaceo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto. Il 2020 ci ha costretti a rinunciare alla nostra pubblicazione annuale, lasciando un vuoto nella nostra storia, ma il 2021 vogliamo che sia un anno di rinascita per il mondo intero, e anche per noi.

Stampare secondo la nostra filosofia comporta costi elevati, che in questo momento non riusciamo a sostenere. Ma non vogliamo scendere a compromessi: cambiare la nostra visione significherebbe realizzare un prodotto che non solo sarebbe scadente, ma inquinerebbe il nostro pianeta.

Con un contributo a tua scelta (da piccolissimo a grandissimo!) potremo farcela! E se non raggiungeremo l'obiettivo finale, i fondi saranno comunque destinati a coprire le spese di produzione delle nostre attività. In cambio, riceverai dei pacchetti studiati ad hoc per incontrare le diverse esigenze di chi ci vuole sostenere, con dei gadget dal valore culturale, estetico e funzionale: 

  • Borraccia: riutilizzabile, in plastica, piccola e agile di 330 ml - un'alternativa super utile a quella più ingombrante che sicuramente hai già!
  • Shopper: riutilizzabile e lavabile, 100% cotone, nera per matchare facilmente ogni tuo outfit, con una grafica minimale bianca che le dà un tocco di personalità senza essere invadente.
  • Poster: in formato A4, realizzato ad hoc dal nostro team di illustratrici; vogliamo che sia una sorpresa, ma ti anticipiamo che sarà uno artwork a scelta tra quelli di Benedetta C. Vialli, Alsessandra Marianelli aka Luchadora, Ludovica Marani, Chiara Blumer, Giorgia Sara Conte aka Iaia Iris, Francesca Paiocchi (seguile tutte su Instagram!).
  • Illustrazione: in formato A3 e su carta patinata, realizzata ad hoc dal nostro team di illustratrici (vedi sopra :)).
  • I volumi cartacei: 1977magazine Vol. IV - spaziotempo è un must, se non lo hai, scegli i pacchetti che lo includono! E se ti mancano dei cartacei per completare la collezione, puoi acquistare uno dei pacchetti che prevede la scelta di uno dei vecchi, tra il Vol. II e il Vol. III - Le Gambe delle Donne. Il Vol. I è andato sold-out ed e non è più disponibile nei nostri punti vendita, ma per questa occasione speciale siamo riusciti a scovare le ultimissime copie e inserirle nel pacchetto Kolossal, se ti manca solo quello, facci un pensierino ;)
  • Segnalibro: un oggetto un po' vintage e dimenticato, ma che quando serve non si trova mai! Ecco risolto il problema, e puoi utilizzarlo subito durante la lettura dei nostri volumi cartacei. 
  • Adesivi: ti assicuriamo che in ogni pacchetto ne troverai una valanga (anche se IndieGoGo ci ha costretti a metterne un numero limitato)!

Se non te la senti di contribuire a questa campagna di crowdfunding, puoi darci comunque una mano! Eccoti altri modi per sostenere 1977:

  • Prima di tutto: spargi la voce che stiamo facendo una campagna! Magari qualche tuo amic* che ancora non ci conosce potrà scoprirci e sostenerci.
  • Diventa socio dell'Associazione Culturale 1977: con un tesseramento di soli 10€ annui (meno di 1€ al mese!) potrai accedere a tutte le nostre iniziative gratuitamente, ottenere sconti presso i nostri partner e avere una copia di ogni nuovo cartaceo riservata a tuo nome ancora prima di andare in stampa.
  • Iscriviti alla nostra newsletter mensile per rimanere aggiornato su tutti i nuovi contenuti.
  • Se ti piace scrivere e analizzare il panorama culturale che ti circonda, invia la tua candidatura ed entra nella squadra!

GRAZIE ♡

1977magazine Vol. V:rosso, giallo, blu

Prima di tutto, chi siamo?

1977 è una zine indipendente che si è evoluta dal web alla carta stampata con un volume annuale autoprodotto, e dalla comunicazione alla produzione tramite la creazione di eventi, workshop, talk e rassegne. Nata nel 2014, 1977 è una realtà tridimensionale in continua evoluzione, guarda al presente con una visione critica.
Determinazione, senso di appartenenza e spirito di squadra ci hanno permesso di crescere in questi anni, spingendoci a promuovere un'informazione indipendente, trasversale e inclusiva . Il 1977 è un anno di rivoluzioni che cambieranno per sempre la storia; allo stesso modo la nostra voce vuole rappresentare una svolta per la riflessione cinematografica e musicale italiana.

Perché partecipare a questa campagna?

Per aiutarci a rendere reale 1977magazine Vol. V: rosso, giallo, blu!
Al suo interno troverete contenuti che indagano il cinema e la musica contemporanei, intesi come luoghi testuali di scambio comunicativo col proprio target, come forme d’arte strettamente interconnesse al contesto storico in cui nascono e si diffondono. Ricondurre l'oggetto filmico o musicale all'interno di un frame socio-culturale di ampio respiro e interrogarlo significa infatti acquisire gli strumenti essenziali per interpretare il nostro presente, con uno sguardo consapevole del passato e lungimirante nei confronti del futuro.
1977magazine Vol. V: rosso, giallo, blu è diviso in 3 sezioni. Ogni sezione prende in analisi uno dei tre colori primari, con la sua portata simbolica a livello semiotico, antropologico, sociale ed emotivo, mettendolo in relazione al suo uso nella musica e nel cinema contemporanei.
Ci fermiamo qui per evitare spoiler e non rovinarvi la sorpresa ;)

Qual è il nostro obiettivo?

Crediamo nel valore materico e immanente della carta, per questo i nostri volumi cartacei sono oggetti di design che perdurano nel tempo e testimoniano una storia. Ognuno porta con sé il valore dei contenuti culturali che veicola, dei materiali con cui è stato prodotto, dei processi per realizzarlo e delle persone che vi hanno lavorato.
Ogni volume cartaceo di 1977 è una risposta all’esigenza di creare qualcosa di personale che resista alla velocità imperante nell’era digitale. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di conferire un nuovo statuto alla “vecchia” carta: trasformarla in un oggetto prezioso, da conservare e collezionare, che sia ecologico e sostenibile. Per questo la scelta della cadenza annuale, che ci permette di realizzare un prodotto ragionato e altamente curato in tutti i suoi aspetti. E la decisione di stampare utilizzando carta naturale (100 gr) e secondo la filosofia GreenPrinting, volta alla salvaguardia dell'ambiente attraverso l'uso di materiali a basso impatto ambientale e all'utilizzo di energia rinnovabile e automezzi a metano.
Fortemente convinti del valore dell'innovazione e delle potenzialità del digitale, determinati a creare un ponte tra passato e presente, i nostri volumi sono riviste che vanno "oltre la carta" grazie all’utilizzo della tecnologia dei QR code e della Realtà Aumentata.


Cosa ci serve e cosa otterrai in cambio?

Andiamo al dunque. Per realizzare il nostro prossimo volume cartaceo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto. Il 2020 ci ha costretti a rinunciare alla nostra pubblicazione annuale, lasciando un vuoto nella nostra storia, ma il 2021 vogliamo che sia un anno di rinascita per il mondo intero, e anche per noi.
Stampare secondo la nostra filosofia comporta costi elevati, che in questo momento non riusciamo a sostenere. Ma non vogliamo scendere a compromessi: cambiare la nostra visione significherebbe realizzare un prodotto che non solo sarebbe scadente, ma inquinerebbe il nostro pianeta.
Con un contributo a tua scelta (da piccolissimo a grandissimo!) potremo farcela! E se non raggiungeremo l'obiettivo finale, i fondi saranno comunque destinati a coprire le spese di produzione delle nostre attività. In cambio, riceverai dei pacchetti studiati ad hoc per incontrare le diverse esigenze di chi ci vuole sostenere, con dei gadget dal valore culturale, estetico e funzionale: 


Borraccia: riutilizzabile, in plastica, piccola e agile di 330 ml - un'alternativa super utile a quella più ingombrante che sicuramente hai già!

Shopper: riutilizzabile e lavabile, 100% cotone, nera per matchare facilmente ogni tuo outfit, con una grafica minimale bianca che le dà un tocco di personalità senza essere invadente.

Poster: in formato A4, realizzato ad hoc dal nostro team di illustratrici; vogliamo che sia una sorpresa, ma ti anticipiamo che sarà uno artwork a scelta tra quelli di Benedetta C. Vialli, Alsessandra Marianelli aka Luchadora, Ludovica Marani, Chiara Blumer, Giorgia Sara Conte aka Iaia Iris, Francesca Paiocchi (seguile tutte su Instagram!).

Illustrazione: in formato A3 e su carta patinata, realizzata ad hoc dal nostro team di illustratrici (vedi sopra :)).

I volumi cartacei: 1977magazine Vol. IV - spaziotempo è un must, se non lo hai, scegli i pacchetti che lo includono! E se ti mancano dei cartacei per completare la collezione, puoi acquistare uno dei pacchetti che prevede la scelta di uno dei vecchi, tra il Vol. II e il Vol. III - Le Gambe delle Donne. Il Vol. I è andato sold-out ed e non è più disponibile nei nostri punti vendita, ma per questa occasione speciale siamo riusciti a scovare le ultimissime copie e inserirle nel pacchetto Kolossal, se ti manca solo quello, facci un pensierino ;)

story:
"The Book of Cultures" is a picture book with 30 fictional stories featuring characters (buddies) from different countries.  

The stories are lovingly created to introduce children to the wonders of our world and encourage them to embrace diverse perspectives. A magical, educational experience for young readers to discover the differences that make our planet so special, but also to uncover the similarities we often overlook. 

A book to explore the world and make buddies from all corners of the earth! 

 

 

 

Fictional plots capture the imagination of little readers and allow them to experience the world beyond themselves, developing compassion and empathy. 

Each story follows a buddy from a different country and explores unique aspects of their culture. At the same time, the characters' fears and dreams are universal and relatable to every child.

Every story is accompanied by a 2-page snapshot of that culture, filled with fun facts and engaging activities, such as puzzles, songs and recipes.   

 

Adults often forget this. Children don't. Let's keep it this way.

Children are bursting with curiosity, ready to take in people and ideas as they are. Stories nurture this curiosity more than anything else. But so far, children’s literature has failed to portray an accurate view of the world. 

 

With "The Book of Cultures" we want to bring characters from all corners of the planet to the forefront of children's stories.   

Stories that will foster children's capacity to develop an accepting mindset. Stories with surprising peculiarities that will fuel children's imagination and spark their curiosity. And most importantly, stories with striking similarities that will teach littles to search for kindness and magic in unfamiliar eyes.  

 

The idea for “The Book of Cultures" came after hundreds of requests from parents to create new products on more countries. 

“What if we capture the beauty of the whole world in ONE big, bold book? A book that will transport readers to countries across the globe, one bedtime story at a time?” we thought.

“What a MARVELOUS idea," we concluded. We hope that you agree.   

 

"The Book of Cultures" will be the go-to book for children to explore various countries and learn how different people live and think. Colorfully illustrated pages will take children on adventures near and far, all from the comfort of their home. 

 

 

We are two childhood friends from Cyprus that share a love for ice cream, travel and spontaneous adventures.    

 

 

During her studies, Evi worked at kindergartens and had editorial placements at Penguin Random House and at the literary agency of Laura Dail.  Later, she was the first employee of a payments startup, where she led product launch and marketing, helping the company scale. Nefeli worked as an architectural assistant at DOMA (Nicosia) and at Groosman Partners (Rotterdam) and later became an art teacher at a progressive kindergarten. 

Two years ago, we came together and started creating picture books and toys that celebrate diversity, helping thousands of littles learn about different countries through fun, interactive ways (and always off-screen).  

    

Our first two collections were focused on Mexico and China. Mexico's picture book has also been published and distributed to schools around the US by Scholastic, while our products can be found in places such as the MoMA, the Strand and the New Museum.    

Help us bring the wonders of our world to every home across the globe!  

After all, it all starts with a friend. A buddy that's slightly different from you!

**Update: New Media Content!**

Check out interviews with contributors, podcast readings from the poets themselves, and more by clicking here!


Minor Arcana Press proudly presents Arcana: The Tarot Poetry Anthology, edited by Marjorie Jensen. This is the first multi-contributor poetry anthology dedicated to the Tarot, featuring 78 poems, over 50 contributors, and gorgeous cover and interior art by Siolo Thompson (creator of the Linestrider Tarot).

The 78 cards of the Tarot mean many things to many people—a game, a fortune telling oracle, a powerful spiritual guide. Arcana: The Tarot Poetry Anthology celebrates the Tarot as muse: enchanting, inspiring, and empowering. With this groundbreaking new book, Minor Arcana Press seeks to unite poetry readers with Tarot readers and celebrate the power of each.

Editor Marjorie Jensen has brought together some of the most invigorating poets of our time, an international community including Rachel Pollack, CAConrad, Tanya Joyce, Tony Barnstone, Cecilia Llompart, Sierra Nelson, Shloka Shankar, and Teofilo Folengo.


WHAT WE NEED

We need only $4,300 to create a high-quality printed book. This also covers the cost of shipping copies to poetry contributors, paying the cover artist, etc. Exceeding this minimum goal will allow us to print a larger run of books that we can sell as well as distribute to libraries, book reviewers, etc. Everyone who contributes $25 and up will receive a copy of the printed book (funding contributors outside the 50 United States & Puerto Rico please add $20 for international shipping).

THE STRETCH GOAL

If we can double that amount to $8600, we can do so much more. It will allow us to pay for a plane ticket for editor Marjorie Jensen to attend a Seattle book launch (the current home of Minor Arcana Press) as well as help fund the Seattle launch and a separate launch event in Marjorie’s hometown of Oakland, CA. This will also mean many more books in the first printing, making sure this powerful book won’t go out of print anytime soon. 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU (THE PERKS)

Take a look to the right of the screen to see what we’re offering you for your support. Everyone who contributes at least $25 will receive a copy of the printed book (please add $20 for international shipping), and those who contribute more can gain access to a limited number of Tarot readings from the editor, members of the Minor Arcana Press family, and possibly the contributors themselves! Isn’t that even better than a signed copy? In addition, you are directly involved in the manifestation of a bold, necessary book, and you are empowering artistic and cultural innovation by fostering a rich and stable platform for writers to promote their work to an international audience.

WHO ARE WE?

Marjorie Jensen is an educator, writer, and Tarot reader. Since completing her Master’s degree, she has taught (Tarot) poetry and prose workshops at U.C. Berkeley. Marjorie has edited several literary publications, such as 580 Split. Her published articles include “Structuring Sonnets and Tarot Spreads” in Tarosophist International as well as “Cards are Told” in Unwinnable Weekly, and she is a contributor to Spiral Nature.

Minor Arcana Press empowers overlooked and outsider authors and artists through publication, publicity, and community. We find extraordinary and invigorating writers and editors whose manuscripts have been overlooked or repeatedly rejected by other publishers. We pair them with provocative book cover artists to create beautiful books. We specialize in ekphrastic anthologies and single-author books by geek authors, spiritual minority authors, and LGBTQ authors.


Minor Arcana Press is powered by Shunpike.

story:
About Us

We are a PhD graduate teaching assistant & community food forest organizer (Catherine Bukowski) and an agroforestry professor and forest management extension specialist. We coordinate a virtual community for forest farming education and teach agroforestry and whole-farm planning using permaculture site assessment and design principles.


What is a community food forest?


Spanish Version:

Food forests, also known as forest gardens, are edible perennial landscapes modeled after a young forest ecosystem. They provide an efficient way to grow food in small spaces and are part of an increasingly visible local food movement.

Over 80% of the American population now resides in urban areas. Community food forests are one of many strategies emerging across the US to reconnect urban populations to sources of local affordable, nutritious food. They give people an opportunity to shape their urban landscape into one that nourishes:

  • their body through producing food,
  • their mind by giving a place to relax, escape city sounds and reconnect with nature
  • the community by providing a place for creating connections with others over producing food together! 

Community food forests are created when volunteers come together to enliven a space with edible plants planted to mimic a forest ecosystem. They are generally open to the public for recreation, relaxing and harvesting fruits, nuts, vegetables and herbs for free. Volunteering time and effort to maintain the plants is the best way to give back.


About the Book

We are researching community food forests across the United States to offer holistic planning strategies and best management practices to help current and future initiatives succeed. Currently there is little information out there on how to plan and manage food forests at the community scale and leaders are searching for
resources.  

Help us get to as many sites as possible to learn directly from the pioneers of the community food forest movement. We're excited to write a book to share the results of our research and their personal experiences with social design, planning and management of these perennial edible gardens. 

The book will discuss terminology, project management, site design and educational elements, motivations and social movements, partnerships and collaboration considerations, lessons learned and best practices, frameworks for measuring the community food forest as a whole system through different forms of capital and inspirational stories of some of the unique community food forests we visit throughout the country.


How Your Donation Helps

The short answer: We will be able to travel to multiple sites collecting information and inspirational stories to produce a comprehensive and high quality book. The book will be an educational resource for anyone looking to start a community food forest in their neighborhood.

The longer answer: The financial support will primarily be used to cover travel costs to visit as many community food forest examples as we can. There are approximately forty community food forests currently across the US and new ones are initiated every year. We hope to visit at least half of them in areas spread throughout the country to capture regional differences. One site in Colorado and nine sites throughout New England, the Mid-Atantic and Appalachia were visited during 2014. 

The next areas on the list are southern California, the San Francisco Bay Area, Pacific Northwest and the Midwest. If we surpass our $8,000 goal we are also hoping to include Austin, TX, Atlanta, GA, Jackson, MI, Nashville, TN and Florida. A smaller portion of the funding will also be used for equipment to create book-quality photos and illustrations, website management to keep people informed on the progress of the research and time to analyze the research results and transform it into writing!

This funding will allow us to focus on producing the book in a shorter period of time while making it more comprehensive by including multiple examples. If the entire funding goal is not reached, any amount we receive will go towards travel costs for a more limited number of sites, photos and illustrations.


The Impact

During visits and interviews in 2014 there was overwhelming interest from leaders and participants of community food forests in learning more about the design, partnerships, successes and challenges that other sites are experiencing. There aren't many planning resources available that focus on community food forests and offer solid ideas on how to maintain volunteer engagement.  

The book will help prepare future community food forest organizers with the tools and inspiration to get their projects up and running for the long term. For those already involved with a project it will provide guidance on how to analyze the whole system, evaluate stakeholder partnerships, improve design to maximize current assets and create a future vision for next steps.    


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially we are thankful for your support in helping to:

  • Spread the word about the campaign

  • Share our website address with friends to stay current on the research

  • Like the community food forest page on Facebook

  • Contact us with information on community food forests you know of, especially if you live in the research areas mentioned above! It takes a lot of time to track down the right people to talk with and any help is appreciated!


Indiegogo makes sharing easy with their share tools so spread the word to as many social media sites as you can!

Thank you for your support!!!!
