How Your Donation Helps





The short answer: We
will be able to travel to multiple sites collecting information and
inspirational stories to produce a comprehensive and high quality book. The book will be an educational resource for anyone looking to start a community food forest in their neighborhood.


The longer answer: The financial support will primarily be used to cover travel costs to visit as many community food forest examples as we can. There are approximately forty community food forests currently across the US and new ones are initiated every year. We hope to visit at least half of them in areas spread throughout the country to capture regional differences. One site in Colorado and nine sites throughout New England, the Mid-Atantic and Appalachia were visited during 2014. 
The next areas on the list are southern California, the San Francisco Bay Area, Pacific Northwest and the Midwest. If we surpass our $8,000 goal we are also hoping to include Austin, TX, Atlanta, GA, Jackson, MI, Nashville, TN and Florida. A smaller portion of the funding will also be used for equipment to create book-quality photos and illustrations, website management to keep people informed on the progress of the research and time to analyze the research results and transform it into writing!
This funding will
allow us to focus on producing the book in a shorter period of time while
making it more comprehensive by including multiple examples. If the entire
funding goal is not reached, any amount we receive will go towards travel costs
for a more limited number of sites, photos and illustrations.   



The Impact 
During visits and interviews in 2014 there was overwhelming interest from leaders and participants of community food forests in learning more about the design, partnerships, successes and challenges that other sites are experiencing. There aren't many planning resources available that focus on community food forests and offer solid ideas on how to maintain volunteer engagement.  The book will help prepare future community food forest organizers with the tools and inspiration to get their projects up and running for the long term. For those already involved with a project it will provide guidance on how to analyze the whole system, evaluate stakeholder partnerships, improve design to maximize current assets and create a future vision for next steps.      

Other Ways You Can Help


Even if you can't contribute financially we are thankful for your support in helping to:

Spread the word about the campaign
Share our website address with friends to stay current on the research
Like the community food forest page on Facebook 
Contact us with information on community food forests you know of, especially if you live in the research areas mentioned above! It takes a lot of time to track down the right people to talk with and any help is appreciated!

Indiegogo makes sharing easy with their share tools so spread the word to as many social media sites as you can! Thank you for your support!!!!

story:
What is this 'Nerd Girl?'

Hi, welcome to another installment of Liz's Crazy Ideas. Brought to you by Liz's Overactive Imagination, 3am Insomnia, and Too Much Caffeine.

This has been an idea I have been tossing around for quite some time, and I thought, what better way to celebrate International Women's Day than by going out on a terrifying limb and finally launching Nerd Girl Magazine. Nerd Girl magazine will start off as a 100 page quarterly magazine, supported by small numbers of relevant content and paying for this content. Small at first, and if it works I will expand the print run and the advertising budget so I can pay content providers more. The first run will be limited to 100 unless the unthinkable happens and more than 100 people want to buy a print mag. 

Each issue will have a theme, and the theme of the first issue will be a Cosplay theme. I'd like to explore many different sides of Cosplay in this issue, from how exploring alter egos can be healing and wonderful experiences, to the experiences of Cosplayers from different backgrounds, countries, and cultures. Get inspired, and send me your ideas, I can't wait to hear them!

Website has been launched!!! There's still a lot of prettying up to do, but here's the basic website: www.nerdgirlmagazine.com

We're also on Facebook :)

What you get for your cash:

I am basing this campaign around three things: getting advance orders for the first 100 magazines to be ready by July 2015, spreading the work about Nerd Girl Magazine to get a wide variety of submissions, and signing up advertisers to pay for the content. 
There are several different levels of sponsorship; e-zine orders, print magazine orders, annual subscriptions, and then advertising options starting at $30 and working up to $180. Each advertising option is for advertising in one issue of Nerd Girl, and ALL advertising revenue goes back to content providers such as writers, photographic teams, artists, basically anyone who provides content.

Risks & Challenges

I suppose inexperience and lack of funds are the two biggest hurdles I face. Here's more:

  • Inexperience: I have never run a mag before. However I have worked as a freelance writer, mostly ghost-writing, creating online content, and writing lifestyle and fashion articles for magazines and blogs, for a number of years. I also have lots of people willing to help me, from those currently running mags, to retired journos, currently working journos, graphic designers, and heaps more. I plan on yelling 'HELP' loudly in their direction when I inevitably get over my head.
  • Lack of funds: obviously, if this indiegogo thing goes swimmingly, all will be well in that area. I'm going to pull it off either way. If people like my idea and want the mag, I'll keep doing it.
  • Editing: I'm not a trained editor, but have fallen into editing and proofreading books by virtue of being a grammar nerd. I've helped edit, ghostwrite, and proofread lots of books, documents and essays. I prefer a 'less is more' approach and work closely with the writer to ensure I refine rather than re-write. If you're a fantastic writer, I don't want to mess with that. If you're a fantastic creative with a story that needs to be heard, I have the skill to give your story greater clarity without removing your personality from your writing. 
  • Only being one person: I am not expecting Nerd Girl to go viral, like the Glitterbombing guy. However in one of the other dimensions where it does fluke virality, I will grab all my friends and bribe them with my incredibly good cooking (ok, wine. Lots of wine.) to help me get the first issue out. If the interest continues to grow, I will (gasp) hire or contract some of the many amazingly competent women I know to help me handle everything.

Other Ways You Can Help

SUBMIT!!!!! SO I CAN RULE THE WORLD, AND EAT ALL THE RAISINS I WANT!!!

But seriously, submissions are the reason I'm doing this. Send me stuff!! I can't accept everything of course, but I want to hear from you. All of you!!


The long story, where Liz rants on for hours about her raisin d'etre and other boring things: 


Firstly; I have gone with 'Nerd' over the prettier and more alliterative 'Geek,' because that's what gets flung at you for being smart in Australia, and often is linked to being boring, too intimidating, and undesirable. I'm proud of being a Nerd, and I'd like to see other Nerdy girls being proud of it too. 

The magazine has come about after much discussion with women working in a wide cross-section of 'nerdy' industries and careers, and hearing the same tired story from each of them. Over the years, since my mother first saw a massive roomful of computer in 1970s London, and my mother-in-law fought her way to one of the highest paid jobs a woman could hold in her developing post-colonial country, the story hasn't changed much.

Women are actively discouraged from doing Smart things. Girls are teased for getting good marks in school. Engineering, IT, trades, the sciences, law, and many other brilliant careers, are not offered or encouraged, especially if you come across as very girly. Hostility in the workforce is a thing. Women not getting promotions, contracts, full time positions, is a thing. Women not getting jobs at all is a thing. 

And outside jobs and careers, the wide cultural explosion of Geek is often hostile as well. From cosplayers who get groped at conventions, to women who hide their identities in the gaming world so as to be related to as people rather than a set of breasts with little intellectual ability, culturally the nerdy world is pretty anti-female. This is changing. Perhaps this little mag can be a small part of that change. At least we can publish some cosplay that isn't just all Sexy Wimmin Being Sexy. Although sexy women are certainly encouraged to submit work as well!!

So my goal with Nerd Girl, is to open some discussions, create a platform, and start allowing women to tell some stories of their own. Often we don't get to tell our story, because the men who run magazines, while well meaning and perhaps not realizing they are doing this, discount or ignore our stories because they do not personally connect with them. Oh, and I also want to pay people for their content. Crazy, I know. But the whole movement of print media into not paying for content irritates me. We'll see whether I can pull it off. 

Now, before you get all #notallmen at me, please take your own personal outrage outside. I'm not running a we-hate-men magazine. In fact, this magazine wouldn't even be on the table if I didn't have the excellent example of at least four amazingly supportive men. 

My father, who always told my three sisters and myself we could do anything, and believed it. My grandfather, who took great care to answer all my questions and pull out reference books whenever I found a weird sea creature, and my father in law, who looked after the home & kids, in spite of ridicule from everyone he knew, so my mother in law could work. And last but not least, my husband, who encourages me to do stupid things like this on a regular basis. 

 These men change history along with us, and I encourage men who do these things for their wives, daughters, and women around them, to write and send in empowering content as well. We are all in this together, and this issue hurts us all.

One more thing: I'd love to have submissions from women of all cultures, countries, and backgrounds. Feminism is for everyone. If you identify as female, or like to support and encourage people who identify as female, send in what your thoughts are!


I could talk on and on and on about this for ages, but I'll leave it there. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions or if you'd like to know more about Nerd Girl. Website with more coming soon...

I spelt it 'raisin' on porpoise.

story:
Short Summary

HELP US PUBLISH OUR MAGAZINE.
The writers & artists creating Gonzo Today were drawn together by the Great Magnet in the fall of 2014. Our vision: to carry on the one gonzo spirit of Hunter S. Thompson; reinvigorate & celebrate a new generation of gonzo journalism, art, literature & culture; and provide an inclusive platform for all voices from the edge. 
Beginning with our website www.gonzotoday.com we are now preparing to take the next step in our devious plot to overthrow all the bastards: the debut publication of Gonzo Today magazine in print.

What We Need

We are looking to cover the expenses of printing our first issue chock full of gonzo art, essays, literature, poetry, points of view and other pontifications from our talented core group and anybody else who wants to throw down: submissions@gonzotoday.com 

  • We are trying to raise $5,000 to give us a kinghell kickstart towards printing as many copies of the highest quality Gonzo Today Issue #1 as possible.
  • Any excess funds will go towards subsequent issues of the magazine.

The Impact

  • Today, more than ever, there is a dire need for alternative voices and alternative outlets for those voices to be heard. Gonzo Today is committed to networking those voices in a mighty roar of individual truth, freedom & rebellion bent on tearing down the walls of artifice, violence & corruption that seek to surround, cage & destroy the human spirit. 
  • In addition to our website, we also sponsor a number of podcasts like Doc Jeffurious Higgason's weekly news broadcast "Memos from the National Affairs Desk" and the anything-goes "Great American Circus" featuring Kidman WIlliams & Chris LoBosco. We are in the process of coming together and establishing a permanent headquarters in Louisville, from whence we will commence publishing the magazine, sponsoring readings, art shows, musical performances, and many other enterprises to expand and enrich the #onegonzospirit.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please also check out our website www.gonzotoday.com
  • Like us on Facebook, Follow us on Twitter, Subscribe on Youtube.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
“Sexuality is one of the ways that we become enlightened because it leads us to self-knowledge.”

- Alice Walker


WHERE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO

Many Lives, Many Lovers:  Lessons From My Search for Ecstatic Sex, a Consummate Man & True Love

Your contributions will go towards funding both the last leg of research for my book, and to writing, production and publishing of it.

I wouldn't be surprised if at this point you're asking, exactly what type of research would she be doing?!?!

The last leg of research is an incredible (and pricey) weeklong seminar in June that is dedicated to opening people up to their fullest potential through the practice of sexual mastery. I have been practicing this groundbreaking work since early this year, and it is an absolute game changer for anyone wanting to empower themselves and deepen their sex lives.

This seminar will give me the final touch on the (37) years of work I’ve done in personal empowerment and conscious sexuality/love.

I look forward to writing this book, and I deeply appreciate your support!

A BIT ABOUT DONNA M THOMAS

My adult life has been dedicated to uncovering for myself, and then offering to others, insights on how to create deep fulfillment in life.

For my bio, go here: http://donna-thomas.com/blog/about/.

I am the author of, From Pebbles to Pathways: A Journey of Healing the Heart One Insight at a Time, 388 pp. It has been well received, considering the limited marketing resources available. If you’d like to see the reviews, go here: http://www.amazon.com/From-Pebbles-Pathways-Journey-Healing/dp/098593901X/.

It took me 4 1/2 years to write From Pebbles to Pathways, working on it nights after my young daughter went to bed (if I didn’t fall asleep with her!)  Then it took an additional 3 years to raise the money to edit, create and publish the book.

My intent is to have the first draft of Many Lives, Many Lovers completed by fall of 2015.

MANY LIVES, MANY LOVERS: THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY

The long and the short of “why” I’m writing this book is this: I was sexually compromised the first time at age 5, and the last time at age 16 when I was coerced into having sex for the first time. The long-term affects were partially responsible for my marriage ending, and definitely contributed to the years of sex that wasn't all I imagined it could be. It took me “many lives” and “many lovers” to figure out how to let go of shame and how to create a hot, deep and connected sex life.

I have found that MANY women and men (for ALL manner of reasons) have some level of shame around their sexuality and sex.  This affects:

• how they feel about themselves (self-confidence, self-acceptance)
• how they conduct themselves in their life and their relationships 
• what relationships they choose, AND
• the quality of their sex life 

I am doing the weeklong intensive seminar to release whatever last vestiges of shame I may have around sexuality. Then I will share ALL of what I’ve learned over the last 40 years with YOU!

Many Lives, Many Lovers will shed light on the search for a combination of deep love, fulfilling sex, and a strong sense of connection with spirit/God/the Universe (not in the title, but as with From Pebbles to Pathways, an added benefit). And as in my first book, you’ll get the spicy stories behind the lessons!

story:
How often do you read?

I read something once, and it made me a little sad. The average person, according to Pew Research's study, finishes less than five books a year. As a person who once embarked in a contest to finish fifty in a year, you can understand how my feelings were hurt.

But, it gave me the idea for what would become Creative Edge Publishing. If you love reading like we do, help us make it relevant again with a new series and a new way to read it. Join the #ReadingRevolution

An illustrated sci-fi/fantasy novel series, released as digital episodes on a weekly basis until the season is completed.

Our Series

The Descendants

Synopsis:

“Set on a world apart from ours, the series initially follows five narrators, a half-elf named Alexandria, a doctor named Ron, a pirate named Jack, a bounty hunter named Halazar, and a female security officer for Scarab Corp. named Kyle.

The world’s technology is powered by mysterious powerstones. Everything from vehicles to houses to weapons are all powered by these small crystals. Though generally only used as power sources for technology, there are those individuals that can harness the power of the stones for their own physical use, they are known as manipulators.

The most famous of those with this power are the Knights of the Old Code, a group that follows the old code of chivalry and attempts to use their powers garnered from the stones for the betterment of mankind. They worked closely with the Empire’s government for many, many years.

However, the king of the continent wide Empire inexplicably stamped out The Old Code and its followers by destroying the temple in the capitol city of Terrnog and killing most of the knights. This event became known to history as The Purge.

The story picks up many years later as Alexandria is attempting to shuttle the most powerful powerstone in history to a safe place where it will be out of reach of the king and his Empire. But the Empire may not be what it seems, and this stone may hold more secrets and be more powerful than anyone could ever imagine.”

The Descendants will be a rollercoaster ride of fun and adventure and we have many wonderful artists who’s work will shine through the pages of the series.

What We Need

First and foremost, we are trying to raise funds so we can properly pay our artists. If you are an artist, or know an artist, then you know how frustrating it can be when people expect you to "art" for them for free. We don't believe anyone should have to work for free.

The way we figure it:

  • $1,200 for artists
  • $1,200 for writers
  • $400 for perks
  • $200 for Indiegogo fees

What You Get

Everyone will get a special prequel episode to the series as a free download before it becomes available to the public, and when the series premiers in fall, you will also get the series premier as a free download. Other perks come with different tiers. But, no matter what you contribute you get to read some of it, which is the whole point. We want to get people back into reading.

Get This For Free!

And you can read an excerpt of it right now! Get it here!

Risks & Challenges

It's not all daisies and green tea, there could be set backs. Artists will need to finish their illustrations and publications will need to be formatted and writing will need to be refined, but if everything goes according to plan, we should launch on schedule, which will hopefully be in the fall.

Why You Should Care

Reading is the the most time tested and respected way to tell a story and I fear we are losing it. This world bombards us with pictures and ads and videos and sounds and people these days have the attention span of a gnat and really, we have lost our respect for the written word. 

I want to change that.

And I know deep down you do too.

What if for the cost of a hardcover book you had a subscription to a beautifully illustrated, entertaining, online novel at your disposal, to be downloaded on all your devices for months to come? 

What if we lived in a society that got excited about the next episode of a weekly novel? That set aside their Thursday night for family reading time or they pop a bowl of popcorn to enjoy on the couch while reading the next episode?

By combining the best of the digital age with the classic wisdom that's borne from reading a good book, we hope to get people excited about reading again, and be a part of creating something new and wonderful.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute we completely understand. But any publicity will help, so tell your friends, your hairdresser, your dog, your prison guard, anyone! It is much appreciated!

FAQ

How will The Descendants be distributed?

The releases would follow a pattern similar to a television series, a "season" getting released with an episode per week for a set number of weeks out of the year.

You will either be able to buy and download individual episodes or buy a season pass and get notifications when new episodes become available for download.

How long will they be?

The goal of this point is to make it easy for people to get back into the habit of reading. So there is a simple formula we will follow.

People read an average of 300 words per minute.

So if the episodes are around 5,000 to 7,000 words, plus pictures, it should take the average person under half an hour to finish.

Each season will have twelve episodes.

How much will they cost?

A single episode will cost $1.50

A season pass will cost $15

How often do you read? I read something once, and it made me a little sad. The average person, according to Pew Research's study, finishes less than five books a year. As a person who once embarked in a contest to finish fifty in a year, you can understand how my feelings were hurt.
But, it gave me the idea for what would become Creative Edge Publishing. If you love reading like we do, help us make it relevant again with a new series and a new way to read it. Join the #ReadingRevolution
An illustrated sci-fi/fantasy novel series, released as digital episodes on a weekly basis until the season is completed.

   Our Series The Descendants

Synopsis:
“Set on a world apart from ours, the series initially follows five narrators, a half-elf named Alexandria, a doctor named Ron, a pirate named Jack, a bounty hunter named Halazar, and a female security officer for Scarab Corp. named Kyle.
The world’s technology is powered by mysterious powerstones. Everything from vehicles to houses to weapons are all powered by these small crystals. Though generally only used as power sources for technology, there are those individuals that can harness the power of the stones for their own physical use, they are known as manipulators.
The most famous of those with this power are the Knights of the Old Code, a group that follows the old code of chivalry and attempts to use their powers garnered from the stones for the betterment of mankind. They worked closely with the Empire’s government for many, many years.
However, the king of the continent wide Empire inexplicably stamped out The Old Code and its followers by destroying the temple in the capitol city of Terrnog and killing most of the knights. This event became known to history as The Purge.
The story picks up many years later as Alexandria is attempting to shuttle the most powerful powerstone in history to a safe place where it will be out of reach of the king and his Empire. But the Empire may not be what it seems, and this stone may hold more secrets and be more powerful than anyone could ever imagine.”
The Descendants will be a rollercoaster ride of fun and adventure and we have many wonderful artists who’s work will shine through the pages of the series.
    What We Need First and foremost, we are trying to raise funds so we can properly pay our artists. If you are an artist, or know an artist, then you know how frustrating it can be when people expect you to "art" for them for free. We don't believe anyone should have to work for free.
The way we figure it:


$1,200 for artists
$1,200 for writers
$400 for perks
$200 for Indiegogo fees


What You Get
Everyone will get a special prequel episode to the series as a free download before it becomes available to the public, and when the series premiers in fall, you will also get the series premier as a free download. Other perks come with different tiers. But, no matter what you contribute you get to read some of it, which is the whole point. We want to get people back into reading.
Get This For Free!

And you can read an excerpt of it right now! Get it here!
    Risks & Challenges It's not all daisies and green tea, there could be set backs. Artists will need to finish their illustrations and publications will need to be formatted and writing will need to be refined, but if everything goes according to plan, we should launch on schedule, which will hopefully be in the fall.

Why You Should Care
Reading is the the most time tested and respected way to tell a story and I fear we are losing it. This world bombards us with pictures and ads and videos and sounds and people these days have the attention span of a gnat and really, we have lost our respect for the written word. 
I want to change that.

story:
"If you work doing what you love, you never work a day in your life."

Ever since I was figuring out what I wanted to do after high school years ago, I applied this principle to mind. Being the son of a former game designer, I was exposed to gaming at a pretty early age and now, on the cusp of my graduation from college, it's safe to say it's shaped who I am. To me, gaming isn't a childish diversion, but is a phenomenon of something very human that has the potential to speak to us on a deeper level. I want to bring that perspective to light, and I need your help.

Though a lot of gamers want to start their own YouTube channels with Let's Plays or their own indie news website, we wanted to take it a step further. Start 2 Continue is meant to focus on the individuals that comprise the whole industry, the culture of the gamer. Some of us play solely for diversion, but others find gaming as an escape from the mundanity of their lives, being able to become someone they might not be able to become in the waking world. Moreover, from a production side, games are a means of creative expression and offer a critique of the world we live in, from the transhumanist ideals of "Deus Ex: Human Revolution" to the dystopian cities of Rapture and Columbia across the "BioShock" universe.

Whether people like it or not, gaming is seeping into other industries too. "Gameification" of businesses helps motivate employees and give them objectives and structure in a new way, and schools have begun adopting games to help teach concepts ranging from simple math and science exercises to philosophical and moral debates.

Start 2 Continue seeks to capture ALL parts of the video game industry and provide a gathering place for others who feel the same way as we do: that gaming is a worthwhile passion and it can be adapted to many ways to serve us in the professional and practical world as well as offer us the chance to meet some awesome people from across the world. We want to help make these connections between the market and developers and be a podium for ethics and activism, helping to build a better world through a mutual passion.

We just need a little extra help doing so.

"A thousand mile journey starts with a single step."

Start 2 Continue has been around since June 2013. Though we started as a video game news website, our shift to focus more on gamer culture earlier this year seems to have piqued interest and we figured now is as good a time as any to test the crowdfunding waters.
That said, the money raised in this campaign will enable us to:
  • Take care of website and server costs
  • Actually pay our staff (rather than rely on donated articles from contributors)
  • Publish even better work rather than selling it off to other larger websites
  • Fund expansion into Twitch and grow our social media presence
  • Keep finding and writing about cool things happening in the industry
  • And, of course, allowing us to get a leg up and help kickstart the site to start generating its own income.

Okay, but so what?

In light of the numerous questions surrounding gaming ethics, from GamerGate, to sexism and misogyny as well as the market's reaction to DLC, Early Access and crowdsourcing, and modders (specifically Steam's latest move to offer pay-to-use mods), we want to speak out and help steer the industry in a better direction.

Granted, everyone has an idea of what "better" means, but for us, we want to unite the industry under the values of passion for what is becoming widely considered an interactive art form. We want to be a platform of reason amidst the hype and chaos, trying to bring the industry back to its roots: having fun.

As the bigger companies seem to bow more readily to their investors than to their fans who actually buy their games, we want to provide an alternative perspective. Websites often champion "By gamers, for gamers," but we want to make sure there is no doubt if we invoke such a claim.

Given that we have a focus on ethics and the love of games, we're also well aware that donations are acts of faith; all too often, it's a faith that's readily preyed upon by some within the industry, and it's a trend we want to help put to an end.

Help us, help you

As a soon-to-be college graduate, that alone should speak to not having much money out of the gate. Though we'll still keep trekking along, trying to grow our website, your donations will help act as a catalyst, allowing us to do more and, in turn, help give back to the gaming industry overall.

As a writer, language has always been a passion of mine alongside gaming. I'm currently in the process of writing a book as well as getting my feet wet in freelance copywriting and project management. I'm fluently bilingual, but am far from through learning languages, aspiring to go to grad school later on for linguistics (baby steps, though).

Your support will not only allow myself and our team, but others who want to express their artistic passions--whether it's writing, video production and streaming, or coming up with awesome game-related art, food, drinks, and clothing. Fundamentally, we want to help as many people find joy in their work. Just video games happen to be what binds us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, just helping spread the word about us will help tremendously. You can find us actively on Facebook or even on Steam if you'd like to check us out and play a few rounds of Counterstrike or pull off some heists in GTA V.

Of course, if you'd like to contribute through writing or videos, or are an indie developer, modder, or YouTuber/streamer/whatever who wants to be highlighted by us, feel free to get in contact with us through our website.

Every little bit helps!

Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Trashina Conner.  I am a 27-year old native of Saginaw, MI. who currently resides in New York. My father was my first love, #1 fan, supporter, and my hero. Our bond was untouchable, with him on my side I was ready to conquer the world. However, God had slightly different plans and my father unexpectedly died  Sunday March 26, 2006. I was ready to curl up into a ball and give up on all my dreams, but that was not an option. Daddy instilled in me such a high level of tenacity, strength and love that I had to continue. 

This is where the idea of "18 ingredients to Make Daddy" came from. In this book I highlight some of the most important characteristics a dad should have to assure the best relationship possible with his daughter. A daughter's first relationship is with her father, and this sets the standards for all that will follow. I did not receive a degree in father/daughter relationships, but I experienced it for 18 amazing years and am still able to utilize it today, so trust me, I know this stuff.   
I have been blessed to publish my book with Mascott Books, but need your help to make this happen. My goal is to have the book published and ready for distribution by the end of 2015. But that will only be possible with your support. Here is a breakdown of all the expenses so you can have clarity on where your donation will be going: 

  1. Illustration:$1500
  2. Editing, Copyright, layout,  graphic layout, 500 hard copies for distribution: $2625
  3. e-book set-up (will be available on amazon,Ingram, Baker and Taylor and Follet): $295
  4. Promotions including: flyers, posters, and bookmarks: $500


Sometimes our trials are used to bring victory and transformation to others and through this book that is what I want to do.  I believe that all little girls can and should experience the amazing love, patience, and trust (a few ingredients in the book) from their First Love (AKA) Daddy. 

I understand that you may not be able to contribute monetarily but if you could spread the word and share this page with your friends and family  and just pray for me as I set out on this new journey, it will greatly be appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Muerta-Paz Con-Corazon Sin-Guerra founded I Am Bad Whether to bring to light the voices that mainstream publishing normally considers bad, irrelevant, or unworthy. Her experiences as a mex-tiza, queer, Xicana, nepantler@, feminist, writer, antiwar advocate, border transformer, and technology guru coalesced into her desire to bring forth unheard voices.

Now, the company is ready to get off the ground. We're poised to launch our first title, Allyson Whipple's poetry collection Curved Tongue, Forked Road. We also have other projects in the pipeline, including a short story collection and an essay anthology. But we need your help to get up and running!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to launch our first title and build a foundation for our upcoming projects. Your contributions will help us not just with this first book, but with future titles. Donations from this campaign will be used for the following:

  • Art commissions and rights
  • Editing and printing costs
  • Review copies and free author copies
  • Up-to-date computer hardware and software
  • Marketing, publicity, regional book tours, and press kits
  • Submission fees for post-publication book awards
  • The fees Indiegogo and PayPal get from this campaign
As a a show of thanks for your contributions, we've come up with a range of literary-themed rewards. There are postcards, writing workshops, and manuscript consultations all up for grabs. Of course, we're offering signed copies of Curved Tongue, Forked Road to donors! And there's a chance to even get free Bad Whether titles for life!
In the even that we don't meet our goal, we'll concentrate the money we do receive on our first print run, relying on more grassroots efforts for marketing and distribution. Please help us meet our full amount so we can build a stable base and ensure the future success of all of our titles!

The Impact

I Am Bad Whether is a press that encourages feisty, fierce voices from all walks of life. Some of the work we publish will be explicitly political; some of it won't. No matter what, though, the press is focused on bringing to light the voices of women who are largely ignored by mainstream publishers. We celebrate the activists, the rabblerousers, and those that just don't fit in. We revel in your badness, the way you refuse to conform. I Am Bad Whether seeks to bolster those voices that have been told to be quiet, to act ladylike. It's an inclusive literary space for all voices. 

Although the gender parity in literary publishing has made some headway, women are still underrepresented in traditional publishing. The 2014 VIDA Count shows that while for some publishers, things are improving, we still have a long way to go before women are fully represented (http://www.vidaweb.org/2014-vida-count/#The 2014 VIDA Count Overall). And for women of color, representation is even worse. While the 2014 VIDA Women of Color Count struggled to get comprehensive data, they are not the only ones tracking representation of women of color in literary publishing, and finding it lacking. 

Your support will contribute to a press devoted to increasing the representation of women in all genres of writing, as well as a commitment to diversity. We're tired of the ways in which even mainstream feminism tends to be exclusionary. We don't believe in the concept of emerging voices. We've been hearing those voices loud and clear for years. Our job is to give them a megaphone.

Risks & Challenges

I Am Bad Whether faces both short-term and long-term challenges. In the short term, the biggest hurdle is to finish the first book and get it into the world. In the long-term, the press has to negotiate ongoing viability in a rapidly changing publishing culture.

Short-Term

  • In her startup efforts, Muerta-Paz has been assisted by poet Allyson Whipple, who has already co-run a successful crowdfunding campaign and finished the project (www.playchoicetexas.com). Through collaborative effort, Allyson brings her skills and experience to ensure rewards get sent out and the projects get finished.
  • Curved Tongue, Forked Road is a complete manuscript that has already gone multiple rounds of revision over the course of three years. This book is ready to be brought into the world!

Long-Term

  • Bad Whether values print culture, but also recognizes the market demands for e-books. The press will embrace both forms of media to help ensure economic viability.
  • Muerta-Paz is a technology guru who has worked with a number of nonprofits over the years to help them use technology to their advantage. She knows how to use technology to her advantage. She'll keep Bad Whether up-to-date with the ongoing changes in print and digital publishing.
  • After helping with the initial crowdfunding release, Allyson Whipple is excited to lend her skill set to further development of the press. She has a work background in e-publishing, as well as working for small businesses in Austin. Through her work experience, she has the insight and skills to help the press make money and become a viable part of the larger feminist community. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to contribute, but lack the resources to do so? You can always help us get the word out! Share this campaign on your social media outlet of choice, make some noise, and let people know you believe in feminist writing and publishing!

story:
My name is Bethy Williams and I’m writing a book about the lesbian history of South Bend, Indiana, my hometown.  This Indiegogo campaign is a request for support to help me finish the book, titled “I don’t want to be the victim no more.”: A Lesbian History of South Bend, Indiana 1974-present.  The quote in the title is from one of the women I interviewed.  She burnt 20 years worth of her journals.  She explained why, “I was so much the victim . . . . But I don’t want to be the victim no more . . . Your story from your past if you keep talking about it and tell it over again, you keep it alive.”  Her words capture what became the mission of my project.  I want to keep these stories alive, preserve a history which has been destroyed and unheard, and be honest about both its darkness and triumph.

In the text below, I’ll explain that there are many ways you can be a part of the project apart from a financial donation.  As one of the lesbians I interviewed said, “Some people can write checks, some people have their hands.”  Your contribution will support a young scholar and make this dream become a reality.

I interviewed many South Bend women for this book.  I learned a lot from my two-three hour oral histories with each of the narrators.  I write about the history of rustbelt South Bend, gay bars, lesbian softball teams, the Michigan Womyn’s Music Festival, rape, domestic violence, alcoholism, drug addiction, Notre Dame, Saint Mary’s, Indiana University South Bend, voting, religion, local political struggles, and so much more.  I use an intersectional feminist approach and include identities and stories beyond lesbianism.  There is a lot of sadness, darkness in this history.  But there are many memories of survivorship, unity, and agency in South Bend lesbian history.  I honor both the lives of individuals and the history of the city’s lesbian community.  Today, South Bend is in a renaissance.  It’s a city with more courage and charisma than I ever imagined.  With many puzzle pieces missing in our nationwide history, the book is not only significant to South Bend, but can also serve as a case study for other communities.

The book began as my senior thesis at Smith College and I’ve been working on this project for almost three years.  I’m beginning graduate school at the end of September.  My goal is to finish my manuscript by mid-August, find a publisher and make my final edits in the following year.

 If you donate in any form, you’ll be thanked in the acknowledgements of my book. I’m asking for support in the following four ways:

1.   You can donate money.  The donations here will help cover costs associated with publication, some of my basic living expenses, and travel necessary for research.   As creating a book requires money and time, this campaign could allow me to be a writer and stay financially afloat.   I live pretty frugally, and thankfully South Bend is an affordable place to live.  I’ll continue doing some part-time work, but I want to give this project my full attention.  My goal is to raise $3,500, which would support me and this project from June-September. 

If you can donate $100 or more, you’ll be the first to receive an individually signed, printed copy of this book.

In addition to being generally shy about writing this book, I also feel reluctant asking my friends for their money and time.  But enough people encouraged me to do this fundraiser, so here we are.  

2.   I hope to interview three-four more lesbians and need help transcribing these oral histories.  I typed out the interviews I have completed already, totaling 460 pages.  The interviews will be donated to the Indiana University South Bend Archives where they will stay safe and accessible forever.  In addition to learning someone’s story, transcribing is a solid skill that can help you build professional experience and have something to add your resume.  One hour of an interview might take you about three hours of transcribing.  I can get you some free software on your computer and a portion of a video tape of an oral history.  Email me if you want to transcribe and learn someone’s story (or if you want more information about the project.)  bethy.am.williams@gmail.com

3.  You can like or share this campaign on social media, email, whatever.  Please spread the word to those who might be interested in being part of this project.  Social media is powerful.

4.  If you know people in South Bend, I need help finding more lesbians to interview.  I already have a diverse sample with a majority of working-class and/or women of color.  I have, however, identified a few gaps in my research.  The term lesbian is applied loosely, and anyone who feels like they identify with the title of the project can participate.  I already have a diverse sample with the 13 women I interviewed.  There is a majority of working-class and/or women of color.  I have, however, identified a few gaps in my research.  I’m hoping to interview a Latina lesbian (I can do an interview in Spanish).  A middle or upper-class black lesbian.  An African lesbian.  A transgender person who identified or currently identifies as a lesbian.  And a lesbian with a physical disability.  This is not to say these identities are more important than others, it’s just what I feel is missing from this story as it stands.  There are consent forms through Smith College, which offer protection, resources, and anonymity to those who participate in the study.

One of the lesbians I interviewed summarized why I’m doing this project and what I learned.  She said, “We have to really be present for each other for things to work . . . With all the hate and fear on this issue . . . I just feel so strongly about doing this all out of love . . . It’s just moving to me that you’re spending the time doing this, I hope out of love.”  I am doing this out of love and I believe communities are stronger if they know their history.  Many people have supported in this project and I’m so grateful.  Thank you for listening, and peace.

Special thanks to those who helped create this campaign:
Elli Levy, April Lidinsky, Katie Madonna Lee, Alison Stankrauff, Nalani Stolz, Jamie Wagman
Academic advisers: Susan Van Dyne and Nancy Whittier
Indiana University South Bend Archives
Smith College
The brave lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer people of 
South Bend, Indiana

story:
Short Summary

"10 Ways The Media Is Letting You Down... Number 7 Will Blow Your Mind!"

Don't you hate yourself when you click on those headlines? Soundbites and listicles are taking over media, dumbing down complex issues like inequality, foreign policy, climate change and immigration. We can't afford to be wrong on these issues and we need your help to change that. 

We are building the premier media company for our generation. We have spent the last three months cultivating an incredible community of the most talented young people across the world to share their stories, insight and perspectives with readers in over 130 countries. We have seen our web traffic grow exponentially over the last three months and are excited for the future, but we need your help!

Our community are young politicians, activists, entrepreneurs, economists and people who want to be heard and share their voice. We are giving them a platform to do so on the issues that matter most to them.

This is our passion. We met at Harvard Business School and realized that we spent all our time talking about these topics. Fred worked for the UK government and BCG and used to be the Managing Editor of Oxford University’s Newspaper. Tewfik managed the MIT International Review when he was an undergrad there and worked for McKinsey, Facebook and Roominate. Alex is our media guru having helped launch HuffPost Live and worked at ABC News 'Nightline'.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15k to really take this to the next level. We currently have an MVP up using WordPress that you can find here: http://opedspace.com/

From in-depth analysis of the war in Yemen, to an exclusive documentary with the families of Egyptian Christians beheaded by ISIS and a series of posts from the rebel front lines in Eastern Ukraine.

We need the money to do an overhaul of the website and to improve our video capabilities. We currently produce only written content and want to shift into more rich media stuff starting with a Video series featuring one of our contributors called “Time Out With Tara.” 

From there we want to run concerted campaigns about the issues that matter to our generation (e.g. political dysfunction, diminished job opportunities and climate change). Our current site can’t handle all that so we need to give it an upgrade.

Aside from that general feeling of smug satisfaction that one gets after doing a good thing we are prepared to offer you more than that!

·  $10 – gets you onto our weekly email list that highlights our best content

·  $75 – gets you a trendy OpedSpace t-shirt (this will show your friends that you are an informed consumer of quality news)

·  $250 – gets you a ticket to our OpedSpace Contributor Conference where you can interact with our community that is producing all the great stories you will be reading/watching

The Impact

We hope to change the way media is created and consumed by our generation. Despite popular belief this isn’t a narcissistic generation. Sure we like our occasional selfie but we are also deeply consumed by issues that go beyond our immediate surroundings. That can be seen by the way the world intently followed the Arab Spring in 2011 and how thousands of Americans participated in Tea Party rallies and the #blacklivesmatter movement. Young people of all political persuasions are taking action.


Whether it is the second year analyst on Wall Street that still finds time to volunteer at an education NGO, or the Tunisian Civil Rights activist who has devoted her entire life to improving job opportunities to her compatriots you see young people all around the world actively contributing to their communities. The sad part is that their stories are largely ignored and unheard… We want to change that.

Risks & Challenges

Media is tough and this won’t be easy. Aside from the usual “how do you monetize?” questions getting good content from around the world is always a challenge. We are also committing ourselves to being credible and accurate, a last stop destination for international insight for our generation. Making sure we do that will be a challenge that we will rely on our contributor base to overcome. We’ve invested upfront quite a bit of time and energy to making sure our contributors are the best and brightest people from their country. We work with them to ensure they produce great content and double check their facts and figures on the stories we publish.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute (and even if you can) you can still help us in other ways.

Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Follow us on Instagram. Tell your friends about us and read the stuff we post!

story:
Brief review

For far too long the voices of Indigenous communities have been silenced. Help provide four Indigenous leaders from different regions of Mexico a platform so they can be heard by the world! On September 25th in Geneva, Switzerland the United Nations is hosting the 30th session of the human rights council where they'll be holding a parallel discussion on Indigenous people.

We are Pro Mazahua and Pro Mexico Indigena, two organizations that work for the integral development of the indigenous communities of Mexico with a clear and strong commitment towards strengthening the greatness of Mexico’s native people through an integral sustainable development model which is divided into 4 areas: 

  1. physical-environmental
  2. economic-productive
  3. social-humane
  4. civic-cultural; 
We are proud to communicate that  we' ve been selected to provide testimony at the conference.

Our plan is to send four leaders of indigenous communities to speak for their selves: 


  • Manuela Alberto Flores, of the indigenous Mazahua of Chonteje community, municipality of San Felipe del Progreso, Mexico State. She has worked with Pro Mazahua since 2009 and has participated in several events and meetings they have organized with different venues. She is an active community leader.


  • Yazmin Martinez Lopez, of the indigenous Otomi community of Tixmadeje, Acambay municipality, State of Mexico. She is a young, spirited and talented woman who sets an example in the work we’ve done with her community.


  • Maria Margarita Dzib Caamal, of the indigenous Mayan community of Katab in Campeche. She is fluent both in her mayan native dialect and in spanish, and uses this to tirelessly empower her culture.


  • Don Manuel Guzman Gomez, of the indigenous Tseltal community of Kotolte in Chiapas. He is a traditional physician and the indigenous chairman of Pro Tseltal that works with 30 communities and promotes the Tseltal culture.


Call to action

These four leaders need your help to spread their testimony to the world! They are looking for financial assistance to provide for their passports, airfare, lodging and living expenses while staying in Switzerland. The total expense is an estimated of 13,620. They will be going to the U.N. to provide testimony on their culture, the progress they’ve witnessed in their communities, their way of being, living and thinking, and the work that still needs to be done for the resurgence of indigenous people in their greatness. Please share and donate what you can and help the original nations of Mexico usher in a new era of peace and success. We don’t have much time and we’ll appreciate your help!


What we need

We need $ 13,620 to meet our goal.

Every Indigenous leader requires $ 3,405 in expenses, which include:

  • Passport $ 70
  • Transfer $ 2,100
  • Accommodation for three nights $ 675
  • Travel expenses (taxis, food) $ 380
  • Translator $180

Every extra donation above our goal will go directly to the organizations Pro Mazahua and Pro México Indígena so they can continue their great work in the development of indigenous communities.

If we reach the goal we will provide 10% of the total order to the nonprofit Social Brick to help them to continue growing and developing successful fundraising campaigns for social causes.


Perks

Indigenous communities have made a big effort to  provide rewards for generous donors. Any reward is handmade by different indigenous people of Mexico. What better in addition to helping with the donation if we can promote the development of our brethren by their products!

Embroidered hand towels and Woven bracelets

 

Tissues tablecloths

Table runners


Risks and Challenges

We are working with a flexible plan so we are going to take the number of indigenous leaders by the amount collected at the end of the deadline by which all aid is totally useful!

We have very little time! But we rely on the generosity of people. Any help is important! Also sharing this project in social networks can help us a lot! This is an opportunity for our Indigenous community to be heard and valued and we can support them!



fundaciónpromexicoindigena@gmail.com
Teléfono: +52 555 604 84 05 


Nota Importante para donativos en México

Cada donativo hecho en México por medio de este portal es deducible de impuestos. Solo debes enviarnos tus datos de facturación junto con la imagen de aprobación de tu pago a socialbrick@hotmail.com

Si prefieres  también puedes donar directo a la cuenta

Banamex sucursal 0660 Lilas, D.F. 

No. Cuenta 70085427855

story:
Testimonials

"All the holes I felt from the system's incessant attack on black lives... All those holes were filled by the love of everyone who spoke to me & hugged me & recited things that ensured me of my validity & purpose here IN this nation, ON this earth as opposed to under it. This retreat is a necessary force in uplifting & rekindling the artists who stand on the frontlines for our communities, campuses & neighborhoods."

"TWH experience is organic and revolutionary."

"I was extremely nervous about the retreat because I didn't have any money  to pay for the tuition or travel. I was worried it wouldn't be possible, then I found out that TWH fundraised enough money to offer scholarships and I was a recipient of The George Rufus Lindsey Scholarship. That was a breath of fresh air. All I had to worry about was getting there and a poet stepped up and paid for my entire bus travel round-trip. When I arrived I felt right at home and left with an entire tribe of good writers who are great people. Everyone was open to conversations, networking, sharing work, and medicine hugs. I left the retreat feeling more driven to build my craft and become a better writer, reader, and person. I LOVE THE WATERING HOLE and can't wait to see my family next year."

Who We Are

The Watering Hole is 501(c)3 poetry organization for writers of color. We began 3 years ago with a Facebook Group of 19. We now have 52 fellows and more than 500 members. This has all been a grassroots movement, prompted by two ladies, Candace and Monifa, who felt isolated and underfed in the Carolina poetry landscape. These women decided to create the very thing they needed by hosting a retreat in 2013 with Tyehimba Jess, Remica Bingham Risher, and Lita Hooper and dozens of poets. After overwhelming success of this first venture, we launched a series of Online Masterclasses with the core tenets of affordability and accessibility in mind. The objective was to reach poets regardless of location and personal situation (finances, babysitters, etc.). Our following retreat with Nikky Finney, Frank X Walker, Roger Bonair-Agard, and Mariahadessa Ekere Tallie was equally a blessing and a result of your support last year. (We surpassed our funding goal!) We had an influx of applications, standing scholarships, and were able to open more spaces for poets. Following the retreat, we were able to achieve nonprofit status, begin a TWH anthology, host a poetry festival, launch a STEAM camp for kids, as well as give panel talks.

Our members all have varying backgrounds--some of us M.F.A. candidates, some professors, some on the spoken word tour circuit, some closet poets; however, all of us were searching to fill a void. We needed a community of poets who understood the cultural framework of our work; who could breakdown Plato, Patricia Smith, and Biggie in the same breath; who believed in the power of a united writing community; and who were passionate about getting our voices into the world as a team. The Watering Hole provides underfed poets an affordable, accessible craft-oriented poetry community of color.

What We Need & What You Get

This year we are hosting the retreat again with Jericho Brown, Tara Betts, and Randall Horton. All donations are tax-deductible, so your donation will be returned to you after you file taxes. Receipts are automatically generated.

For two years, we have been running our initiatives on heart, fumes, and out of our own pockets. We are aiming for $10,000 to go towards supporting a $30,000 retreat. 

This amount will bring in world-class retreat facilitators (including a surprise guest speaker), visit Mother Emmanuel Church to do poetic work for the Charleston Nine, subsidize tuition and lodging costs for all of our poets, and fund at least 5 need-based partial scholarships for our participants. We are creating a Harlem Renaissance/Black Arts Movement for this next generation of poets and we want you to be a part of the movement.

We have lots of gifts for you! With donations (all tax-deductible) you receive your choice of our newly designed “i think i write i publish” t-shirts, passes to our 2-day Poetry Festival, Online Masterclass seats on November 7 with author of "Gathering the Waters" Keisha-Gaye Anderson, the opportunity for us to come to you and give a TWH reading or workshop, and more! You even have the opportunity to provide a scholarship for a poet. Remember, all donations are tax-deductible and come with a gift, which means that everything is free. You receive your gift and your money gets returned to you when you file taxes. All this while still giving you the opportunity to expand poetry of color in the South.

  

(The t-shirts will be blue, not gray)       (Featured easy-peel laptop stickies)

As always, we’re grateful for any level of support. Five dollars makes a difference. Every donation allows us to keep our doors open for another year of sharing, growing and continuing to provide educational opportunities to poets of color in the South.  Plus, your donation is now tax deductible.

           

             (The mousepad)                                                      (The notebook)

More Testimonials
"The Watering Hole Writer's Retreat was an amazing experience. Not only is it a learning experience but an engaging one that challenges every writer to push their craft as well as critically examine their methods, boundaries, and purpose. Thank you for offering a community like this."
"I find it easy to leave my ethnic experience behind and otherwise neglect myself. Not only is the Watering Hole retreat changing the way that I think about my identity as a writer, but it is also showing me how to affect and fight against societal prejudices through my art and craft."

"TWH Retreat was a breath of fresh air! Poets in one location feeding from each other and experiencing dynamic teaching and motivation was inspiring to say the least! Once I returned home, I continued to write daily and I utilized every bit of teaching that I was blessed to receive. I am now working on my third book."

"One of the best parts of the retreat was finding a real community or "tribe" of writers who are serious about their craft and will help one another in any way to excel. I have developed life-long relationships at this retreat."

"The gathering of black poets from all different areas up the coast was extraordinary. A lot of us are spread throughout the country, yet we know one another and interact through social media. So being able to come together and finally meet one another on a lake in some cabins, cooking for one another and staying up swapping books and the black cultural aesthetic was like a family reunion-style poetry retreat model I never experienced before."

Testimonials
"All the holes I felt from the system's incessant attack on black lives... All those holes were filled by the love of everyone who spoke to me & hugged me & recited things that ensured me of my validity & purpose here IN this nation, ON this earth as opposed to under it. This retreat is a necessary force in uplifting & rekindling the artists who stand on the frontlines for our communities, campuses & neighborhoods."
"TWH experience is organic and revolutionary."
"I was extremely nervous about the retreat because I didn't have any money  to pay for the tuition or travel. I was worried it wouldn't be possible, then I found out that TWH fundraised enough money to offer scholarships and I was a recipient of The George Rufus Lindsey Scholarship. That was a breath of fresh air. All I had to worry about was getting there and a poet stepped up and paid for my entire bus travel round-trip. When I arrived I felt right at home and left with an entire tribe of good writers who are great people. Everyone was open to conversations, networking, sharing work, and medicine hugs. I left the retreat feeling more driven to build my craft and become a better writer, reader, and person. I LOVE THE WATERING HOLE and can't wait to see my family next year."

Who We Are

The Watering Hole is 501(c)3 poetry organization for writers of color. We began 3 years ago with a Facebook Group of 19. We now have 52 fellows and more than 500 members. This has all been a grassroots movement, prompted by two ladies, Candace and Monifa, who felt isolated and underfed in the Carolina poetry landscape. These women decided to create the very thing they needed by hosting a retreat in 2013 with Tyehimba Jess, Remica Bingham Risher, and Lita Hooper and dozens of poets. After overwhelming success of this first venture, we launched a series of Online Masterclasses with the core tenets of affordability and accessibility in mind. The objective was to reach poets regardless of location and personal situation (finances, babysitters, etc.). Our following retreat with Nikky Finney, Frank X Walker, Roger Bonair-Agard, and Mariahadessa Ekere Tallie was equally a blessing and a result of your support last year. (We surpassed our funding goal!) We had an influx of applications, standing scholarships, and were able to open more spaces for poets. Following the retreat, we were able to achieve nonprofit status, begin a TWH anthology, host a poetry festival, launch a STEAM camp for kids, as well as give panel talks.Our members all have varying backgrounds--some of us M.F.A. candidates, some professors, some on the spoken word tour circuit, some closet poets; however, all of us were searching to fill a void.
